original: dge ba'i rtsa ba de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //

analyzed: dngos po dman pa'i skyon spangs pa'i phyir mthun pa'i dngos pos mchod pa byed de zhes bya ba'o //

original: de dag las bzlog pa'i rgyu bzhi dang ldan pa las ni gzhan la phan 'dogs pa las ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag las bzlog pa'i rgyu bzhi dang ldan pa las ni gzhan la phan 'dogs pa las ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One does not fail to benefit others because of possessing the four causes that are the opposites of those.

original: yang yan lag rnam pa brgyad kyis dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi yon tan rnam pa gsum gsal bar bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: yang yan lag rnam pa brgyad kyis dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi yon tan rnam pa gsum gsal bar bstan pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, the eight members clearly show the three kinds of virtues of the spiritual teacher.

original: tshig gzung bar 'os pa dang / gzhan gyi don sgrub par byed pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa dang / gzhan don sgrub pa'i byed pa dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: tshig gzung bar 'os pa dang / gzhan gyi don sgrub par byed pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa dang / gzhan don sgrub pa'i byed pa dang ldan pa ste /
translated: He is endowed with the virtue of being worthy to be followed, and with the activity of accomplishing the aims of others.

original: yan lag gcig dang / gsum dang / bzhi dang go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: yan lag gcig dang / gsum dang / bzhi dang go rims bzhin no //
translated: The three virtues are shown by the first, third, and fourth members, respectively.

original: tshul khrims la gnas pa ni tshig gzung bar 'os par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims la gnas pa ni tshig gzung bar 'os par 'gyur ro //
translated: One who is established in morality becomes worthy to be heeded.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi sdom pa legs par blangs pa'i phyir tshul khrims rnams la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi sdom pa legs par blangs pa'i phyir tshul khrims rnams la gnas pa'o //
translated: One is established in morality because one has properly taken up the bodhisattva vow of morality.

original: de'i rjes su bsrung ba'i phyir ma nyams pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes su bsrung ba'i phyir ma nyams pa'o //
translated: One is not deficient because one guards it subsequently.

original: nyes pa byung ba phyir 'chos pa'i phyir skyon med par byed pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa byung ba phyir 'chos pa'i phyir skyon med par byed pa'o //
translated: One makes it flawless because one remedies any transgression.

original: de ltar na yang dag par blangs pa dang / bsrung ba dang / phyir bcos pas tshul khrims la gnas par gsal par bstan pa yin no //üîΩlung gi chos mang du thos par byas na blos rtogs nas ni mang du thos pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar na yang dag par blangs pa dang / bsrung ba dang / phyir bcos pas tshul khrims la gnas par gsal par bstan pa yin no // lung gi chos mang du thos par byas na blos rtogs nas ni mang du thos pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Thus, it is shown that one is established in morality through proper acceptance, guarding, and remedy.üîΩOne is called learned when one has understood through the intellect after having studied much the Dharma of scripture.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod las brtsams nas chos gang dag gis byang chub sems dpa'i lam mngon par brjod pas rjod par byed la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod las brtsams nas chos gang dag gis byang chub sems dpa'i lam mngon par brjod pas rjod par byed la /
translated: One is called learned when one has understood through the intellect after having studied much the Dharma of scripture.

original: de lta bu'i chos mang du thos par gyur la gzung zhing brjod nas yid kyis legs par dpyad de lta bas rab tu rig par byas pa de lta bu ni mang du thos pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i chos mang du thos par gyur la gzung zhing brjod nas yid kyis legs par dpyad de lta bas rab tu rig par byas pa de lta bu ni mang du thos pa zhes bya'o //
translated: One who has heard many teachings such as these, who has retained and recited them, and who has well investigated them with the mind, and who has understood them in this way, is called learned.

original: zhig nas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa dang ldan pa ni rtogs pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zhig nas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa dang ldan pa ni rtogs pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ste /
translated: One who has attained tranquility and insight is called realized.

original: bsam gtan dang po nas 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar du dang / byams pa la sogs pa tshang med pa bzhi dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ting ngo 'dzin sna tshogs pa de lta bu @215b thob pa ni zhi gnas thob pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po nas 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar du dang / byams pa la sogs pa tshang med pa bzhi dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ting ngo 'dzin sna tshogs pa de lta bu @215b thob pa ni zhi gnas thob pa zhes bya'o //
translated: One who has attained such things as the first meditative concentration up to the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception, the four immeasurables such as love, and the various meditative concentrations of the bodhisattvas, is called one who has attained tranquility.

original: mi rtag pa'i 'du shes nas 'gog pa'i 'du shes kyi bar du thob pa de lta bu ni lhag mthong thob pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i 'du shes nas 'gog pa'i 'du shes kyi bar du thob pa de lta bu ni lhag mthong thob pa zhes bya'o //
translated: One who has attained such things as the perception of impermanence up to the perception of cessation is called one who has attained insight.

original: sems can rnams la phan pa dang bde ba'i bsam pa dang ldan pa'i phyir snying brtse ba'i bsam pa can zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la phan pa dang bde ba'i bsam pa dang ldan pa'i phyir snying brtse ba'i bsam pa can zhes bya ba'o //
translated: He is called ‚Äúone who has the attitude of compassion‚Äù because he has the attitude of benefiting and gladdening sentient beings.

original: bdag nyid la ltos pa med par gzhan la phan pa sgrub par byed pa ni snying rje dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid la ltos pa med par gzhan la phan pa sgrub par byed pa ni snying rje dang ldan pa'o //
translated: He is called ‚Äúone who has compassion‚Äù because he accomplishes the benefit of others without regard for himself.

original: des na smras pa /
analyzed: des na smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: rang gi bde ba yal bar dor nas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rang gi bde ba yal bar dor nas zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúHaving abandoned his own happiness,‚Äù

original: rang gi nyams su myong ba'i bde ba yongs su btang nas gzhan gyi don la sbyor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi nyams su myong ba'i bde ba yongs su btang nas gzhan gyi don la sbyor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: means that he is dedicated to the benefit of others, having given up his own experience of happiness.

original: dran pa nyams pa med pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa zad pa med pas chos ston pa na bag tsha ba med pa yin pa'i phyir 'jigs pa med pa yin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dran pa nyams pa med pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa zad pa med pas chos ston pa na bag tsha ba med pa yin pa'i phyir 'jigs pa med pa yin zhes bya'o //
translated: He is called ‚Äúone who is fearless‚Äù because he is fearless when teaching the Dharma, due to his undiminished mindfulness and his undiminished analytical knowledges.

original: gzhan gyi gnod pa byas pa bzod pas bzod pa can du bstan pa'i phyir brnyas kyang rung /üîΩ'phyas kyang rung /
analyzed: gzhan gyi gnod pa byas pa bzod pas bzod pa can du bstan pa'i phyir brnyas kyang rung / 'phyas kyang rung /
translated: He is called ‚Äúone who is patient‚Äù because he is patient with the harm done by others.

original: bstings kyang rung /
analyzed: bstings kyang rung /
translated: He is called ‚Äúone who is not contemptuous‚Äù because he is not contemptuous of others.üîΩHe is called ‚Äúone who is not arrogant‚Äù because he is not arrogant toward others.

original: ngan du brjod kyang rung 'gyur ba mi bskyed par gzhan gyi don la sems par byed pa dang / khros pa la lan du mi khro ba yin /üîΩgzhan gyis smod cing tshig ngan pa brjod pa'i bar du byas kyang gzhan dag la khro bar yang mi byed la yid kyis kyang log par mi sems so //
analyzed: ngan du brjod kyang rung 'gyur ba mi bskyed par gzhan gyi don la sems par byed pa dang / khros pa la lan du mi khro ba yin / gzhan gyis smod cing tshig ngan pa brjod pa'i bar du byas kyang gzhan dag la khro bar yang mi byed la yid kyis kyang log par mi sems so //
translated: Even when spoken to harshly, he does not become angry, but thinks about the welfare of others.üîΩEven when others criticize him, speak ill of him, and so on, he does not become angry with them, nor does he think ill of them.

original: brdeg pa la sogs pas kun du skyo bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: brdeg pa la sogs pas kun du skyo bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: He does not become discouraged by being beaten and so on.

original: lus kyi mthu thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus kyi mthu thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he has attained physical strength.üîΩHe does not become discouraged mentally, because of the strength of discernment.

original: so sor rtog pa'i stobs kyis yid yongs su mi skyo ba yin no zhes bya ba ni so sor rtog pa mang pa nyid do //
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i stobs kyis yid yongs su mi skyo ba yin no zhes bya ba ni so sor rtog pa mang pa nyid do //
translated: This is the abundance of discernment.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: ngal ba med pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: ngal ba med pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: He is indefatigable.

original: dge ba'i tshig yin pa'i phyir rdzogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas rgyas par 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i tshig yin pa'i phyir rdzogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas rgyas par 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of the word ‚Äúvirtuous,‚Äù he is said to be ‚Äúperfect‚Äù and so on.

original: mdor bsdu na chos nyid las ma nyams pa'i ngag dang / slu ba med pas rgyun chags su 'byung ba dang / yi ge gsal bas gsal ba nyid do //
analyzed: mdor bsdu na chos nyid las ma nyams pa'i ngag dang / slu ba med pas rgyun chags su 'byung ba dang / yi ge gsal bas gsal ba nyid do //
translated: In brief, the spiritual teacher is one who is not corrupt in speech, who is not deceptive, who is not incoherent, and who is clear in pronunciation.

original: de lta bu'i yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni rnam pa thams cad kyis gzhan gyi don byed par nus so zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bu'i yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni rnam pa thams cad kyis gzhan gyi don byed par nus so zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: The spiritual teacher who has these eight qualities is able to benefit others in every way.

original: bya ba don yod pa yin te zhes bya ba ni nges par phan bsgrub par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya ba don yod pa yin te zhes bya ba ni nges par phan bsgrub par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is one whose actions are not fruitless, because he is certain to accomplish the benefit.

original: don yod pa rnam pa lnga po 'di dag ni sngar bstan pa'i yan lag gi rjes su 'brangs nas shes par bya'o //üîΩsnying brtse ba can ni phan pa dang bde bar 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: don yod pa rnam pa lnga po 'di dag ni sngar bstan pa'i yan lag gi rjes su 'brangs nas shes par bya'o // snying brtse ba can ni phan pa dang bde bar 'dod pa'o //
translated: These five kinds of fruitfulness should be understood as following from the previously mentioned qualities.

original: mang du thos pa ni yang dag pa ji lta ba @216a * //
analyzed: mang du thos pa ni yang dag pa ji lta ba @216a * //
translated: The spiritual teacher is compassionate, desiring the benefit and happiness of others.

original: bzhin du rab tu shes pa'o //
analyzed: bzhin du rab tu shes pa'o //
translated: He is learned, knowing reality as it is.

original: rtogs pa dang ldan pa ni blo phyin ci log tu mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa dang ldan pa ni blo phyin ci log tu mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: He is intelligent, his mind not being perverted.

original: 'jigs pa med pa dang / gsal ba'i tshig nyid ni thabs gang dang / chos bstan pa'i tshul gang gis sems can gang 'dul nus pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'jigs pa med pa dang / gsal ba'i tshig nyid ni thabs gang dang / chos bstan pa'i tshul gang gis sems can gang 'dul nus pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The words ‚Äúfearless‚Äù and ‚Äúclear‚Äù indicate the method and the way of teaching the Dharma by which he is able to train sentient beings.

original: ldang ba phun sum tshogs pa ni yid yongs su mi skyo ba yin no //
analyzed: ldang ba phun sum tshogs pa ni yid yongs su mi skyo ba yin no //
translated: The perfection of rising is the absence of mental fatigue.

original: bzod pa dang ldan pa'i phyir phyogs su ma lhung ba'o //
analyzed: bzod pa dang ldan pa'i phyir phyogs su ma lhung ba'o //
translated: He is impartial because he is patient.

original: de ltar na bsam pas don 'dod pa yin pa nyid dang / bstan pa'i tshul phun sum tshogs pas lung dang rtogs pa dag gi don ji lta ba bzhin mkhyen pa nyid dang / 'dul ba'i thabs mkhyen pa dang / brtson 'grus brtsams pa nyid dang /
analyzed: de ltar na bsam pas don 'dod pa yin pa nyid dang / bstan pa'i tshul phun sum tshogs pas lung dang rtogs pa dag gi don ji lta ba bzhin mkhyen pa nyid dang / 'dul ba'i thabs mkhyen pa dang / brtson 'grus brtsams pa nyid dang /
translated: Thus, he is shown to have the desire for the benefit of others through his intention, to have knowledge of the reality of the scriptures and the realizations through the perfection of the way of teaching, to have knowledge of the means of training, to have begun his striving,

original: sems snyoms pa nyid yongs su gsal bar byas pa yin no //
analyzed: sems snyoms pa nyid yongs su gsal bar byas pa yin no //
translated: and to have an impartial mind.

original: mthong ba dang thos pas kyang sems mngon par dang bar byed na zhes bya ba ni dad par bya ba'i gnas su bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: mthong ba dang thos pas kyang sems mngon par dang bar byed na zhes bya ba ni dad par bya ba'i gnas su bstan pa yin te /
translated: He causes faith to arise in the minds of those who see or hear him.

original: sems rab tu zhi ba'i phyir spyod lam rab tu zhi ba phun sum tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: sems rab tu zhi ba'i phyir spyod lam rab tu zhi ba phun sum tshogs pa ste /
translated: He is endowed with the perfection of calm deportment because his mind is very calm.

original: yan lag mi 'gyur bas rab tu mdzes pa nyid do //
analyzed: yan lag mi 'gyur bas rab tu mdzes pa nyid do //
translated: He is very beautiful because his limbs are unmoving.

original: lus la sogs pa'i las rab tu zhi ba'i phyir dbang po rnams zhi zhing mi g-yo bas brtan pa ste /
analyzed: lus la sogs pa'i las rab tu zhi ba'i phyir dbang po rnams zhi zhing mi g-yo bas brtan pa ste /
translated: He is steady because his faculties are calm and unmoving because his bodily and other actions are calm.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid g-yo ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid g-yo ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is steady because his body, speech, and mind are unmoving.

original: gzhan las rnyed pa la sogs pa la ltos pa med pa'i phyir tshul 'chos pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan las rnyed pa la sogs pa la ltos pa med pa'i phyir tshul 'chos pa med pa yin no //
translated: He is not hypocritical because he is not concerned with gain, etc. from others.

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti yongs su bsgyur pa dang / yongs su thob pa'i gang zag la phrag dog med pa yin te /
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti yongs su bsgyur pa dang / yongs su thob pa'i gang zag la phrag dog med pa yin te /
translated: He is not envious of persons who have gained wealth and honor, or who have attained the scriptures.

original: ji ltar bdag nyid kyis rnyed pa dang bkur sti thob pas dga' ba de bas ches gzhan gyis thob na dga' bas phrag dog med pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar bdag nyid kyis rnyed pa dang bkur sti thob pas dga' ba de bas ches gzhan gyis thob na dga' bas phrag dog med pa'o //
translated: He is not envious because he is more pleased at another's gain than at his own.

original: de ltar na bsam pa nyid dang / sbyor ba nyid kyis phrag dog med pa gsal bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na bsam pa nyid dang / sbyor ba nyid kyis phrag dog med pa gsal bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, he is shown to be without envy both by his attitude and by his application.

original: zang zing la shin tu 'dod pa ma yin pas yo byad bsnyungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zang zing la shin tu 'dod pa ma yin pas yo byad bsnyungs pa yin no //
translated: He is not very attached to material things, so he is a person of few desires.üîΩHe is a person of few desires because he gives away everything he gets.üîΩHe is a person who is content with anything at all because he is satisfied with whatever he gets.üîΩHe is a person who is easy to nourish because he is satisfied with little.üîΩHe is a person who is easy to satisfy because he is not very attached to material things.

original: yo byad bsnyungs pa nyid kyang rnyed do cog thams cad yongs su gtong bas zhes bya bas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: yo byad bsnyungs pa nyid kyang rnyed do cog thams cad yongs su gtong bas zhes bya bas bstan pa yin no //
translated: He is a person who is not a busybody because he does not engage in many activities.üîΩHe is a person who is grateful and thankful because he does not forget an act of kindness.üîΩHe is a person who is honest because he does not deceive his friends.üîΩHe is a person who is steadfast because he does not give up his undertakings.üîΩHe is a person who is free of acquisitiveness because he does not hoard things away.üîΩHe is a person who is pure in his means of livelihood because he does not deceive others with magical spells.üîΩHe is a person who is wise because he is skilled in the three types of knowledge.üîΩHe is a person who is a master of the tradition because he is skilled in the three types of training.üîΩHe is a person who is a master of the canon because he is skilled in the three canons.üîΩHe is a person who is a master of the scriptures because he is skilled in the five sections of the scriptures.üîΩHe is a person who is a master of the treatises because he is skilled in the five branches of learning.üîΩHe is a person who is a master of the arts because he is skilled in the five arts.üîΩHe is a person who is a master of the world because he is skilled in the five components of social interaction.

original: lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi tshul khrims nyams pa dang / spyod pa nyams pa'i dbang du byas nas mthong ba la sogs pa'i tshig gi lam lngas skul bar byed pa ni gleng bar byed pa zhes bya'o //üîΩltung ba'i chos sam /
analyzed: lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi tshul khrims nyams pa dang / spyod pa nyams pa'i dbang du byas nas mthong ba la sogs pa'i tshig gi lam lngas skul bar byed pa ni gleng bar byed pa zhes bya'o // ltung ba'i chos sam /
translated: He is a person who is a master of the vehicles because he is skilled in the three vehicles.üîΩHe is a person who is a master of the levels because he is skilled in the ten levels.üîΩHe is a person who is a master of the perfections because he is skilled in the six perfections.

original: chos rnams dran par byed pa ni dran par byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos rnams dran par byed pa ni dran par byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He is a person who is a master of the factors for enlightenment because he is skilled in the thirty-seven factors that are conducive to enlightenment.

original: rab tu dben pas ji srid du zhi gnas dang lhag mthong phyin ci ma log pa'i gdams ngag ston pa @216b ni 'doms par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rab tu dben pas ji srid du zhi gnas dang lhag mthong phyin ci ma log pa'i gdams ngag ston pa @216b ni 'doms par byed pa yin no //
translated: He is a person who is a master of the powers, the faculties, and the branches of enlightenment because he is skilled in the four forms of correct understanding, the four forms of thorough relinquishment, the four forms of miraculous feet, the five faculties, the five

original: chos dang 'dul ba las yang dag par bstan pa rnams las 'das pa las shes na spyo ba nas bskrad pa'i las kyi bar du byed pa ni bya ba dang bya ba ma yin pa dag la spyad kyang rung /üîΩma spyad kyang rung /
analyzed: chos dang 'dul ba las yang dag par bstan pa rnams las 'das pa las shes na spyo ba nas bskrad pa'i las kyi bar du byed pa ni bya ba dang bya ba ma yin pa dag la spyad kyang rung / ma spyad kyang rung /
translated: Whether or not one has engaged in what should be done and what should not be done,

original: byas pa dang ma byas pa dag la ston par byed pa dang / rjes su ston par byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byas pa dang ma byas pa dag la ston par byed pa dang / rjes su ston par byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: one is said to be a teacher and an instructor of what has been done and what has not been done.üîΩAt the appropriate times, one ripens sentient beings by means of a discourse that is based on the past and a discourse that is based on the future.

original: dus dang dus su sngon gyi dus su byas pa'i gtam dang / yang dag par 'byin par byed pa'i gtam gyis sems can yongs su smin par byed pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang ldan pa'i tshig dang yi ge nas mkhas par gyur pa'i bar gyi lam gyi tshogs kyi chos rab tu ston par byed pas na chos ston par byed pa yin zhes bya'o //üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: dus dang dus su sngon gyi dus su byas pa'i gtam dang / yang dag par 'byin par byed pa'i gtam gyis sems can yongs su smin par byed pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang ldan pa'i tshig dang yi ge nas mkhas par gyur pa'i bar gyi lam gyi tshogs kyi chos rab tu ston par byed pas na chos ston par byed pa yin zhes bya'o //üîΩ'di lta ste /
translated: One is said to be a teacher of the Dharma because one teaches the Dharma that is the collection of the path, from the words and syllables that are related to purification up to the state of being learned.

original: nyan thos kyi sa las rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la ji ltar rtogs par bya zhe na khyad par rgyas par ni stobs kyi rigs kyi le'u las rig par bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sa las rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la ji ltar rtogs par bya zhe na khyad par rgyas par ni stobs kyi rigs kyi le'u las rig par bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: It should be understood from the Sravakabhumi. How should it be understood? It is taught that it should be understood in detail from the chapter on the family of powers.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa ni rnam pa bzhis yongs su rdzogs par rig par bya ste zhes bya ba la dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsten par bya ba ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen mi slu ba ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa ni rnam pa bzhis yongs su rdzogs par rig par bya ste zhes bya ba la dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsten par bya ba ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen mi slu ba ste /
translated: The reliance on the spiritual mentor is to be known as complete in four ways. The spiritual mentor is to be relied upon as the non-deceptive spiritual mentor.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen yang dag par bsgrubs pas mnyes par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen yang dag par bsgrubs pas mnyes par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The spiritual mentor is to be pleased by the accomplishment of the spiritual mentor.

original: rnam pa bzhi nyid mdor bsdu na mchod pa rnam pa gnyis su gsal bar bstan te /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi nyid mdor bsdu na mchod pa rnam pa gnyis su gsal bar bstan te /
translated: The four ways are summarized and clearly taught as two kinds of worship.

original: sgrub pa'i mchod pa dang / zang zing gi mchod pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i mchod pa dang / zang zing gi mchod pa'o //
translated: The worship of accomplishment and the worship of material things.

original: sgrub pa'i mchod pa ni na ba dang mi na ba'i dus su g-yog bya ba'i spyod pas so //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i mchod pa ni na ba dang mi na ba'i dus su g-yog bya ba'i spyod pas so //
translated: The worship of accomplishment is by the practice of service at the time of sickness and at the time of health.

original: sbyin pa ni gos la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa ni gos la sogs pa'o //
translated: Giving is clothing, etc.

original: sdud pa'i las bya ba ni brtse ba dang gus pas nye bar bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: sdud pa'i las bya ba ni brtse ba dang gus pas nye bar bsdus pa ste /
translated: The function of gathering is gathering through love and respect.

original: sgrub pa'i mchod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i mchod par rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood as the worship of practice.

original: chos dang mthun pa shes bya ba ni chos dang mi 'gal ba'i don rnams la bdag nyid yang dag par sgrub par byed pa ni yang dag par gzung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos dang mthun pa shes bya ba ni chos dang mi 'gal ba'i don rnams la bdag nyid yang dag par sgrub par byed pa ni yang dag par gzung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The understanding of what is in accord with the Dharma is the correct practice of things that are not in conflict with the Dharma. This is called correct reception.

original: rnam par gzung ba ni bla ma'i bka' sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par gzung ba ni bla ma'i bka' sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: Reception is the practice of the guru's words.

original: don la dbang byed pa ni de bzhin du nan tan byed cing bla ma'i bka' mi gcog pa'o //
analyzed: don la dbang byed pa ni de bzhin du nan tan byed cing bla ma'i bka' mi gcog pa'o //
translated: Dominance over the meaning is the practice in that way without contradicting the guru's words.

original: de dag gnyi ga la gus pas sgrub par byed pa ni rnam par mi g-yo ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gnyi ga la gus pas sgrub par byed pa ni rnam par mi g-yo ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The practice with respect to both is called unshakable.

original: bdag nyid kyi skyon mi 'chab pa ni 'chags pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi skyon mi 'chab pa ni 'chags pa'o //
translated: The confession of one's own faults is the confession of faults.

original: shes par bya ba'i bsam pas zhes bya ba ni shes par 'dod pas drung du 'gro ba dang / bsnyen bkur byed pa ni phyag 'tshal ba la sogs pa'i bya bas rjes su 'jug @217a * //
analyzed: shes par bya ba'i bsam pas zhes bya ba ni shes par 'dod pas drung du 'gro ba dang / bsnyen bkur byed pa ni phyag 'tshal ba la sogs pa'i bya bas rjes su 'jug @217a * //
translated: The thought of understanding is the thought of wanting to understand. Going to the guru and serving is following through with prostrations and so forth.

original: pa'o // 'dri ba ni the tshom gcad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa'o // 'dri ba ni the tshom gcad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Questioning is for the purpose of eliminating doubt.

original: nyan pa ni des gsungs pa rnams so //
analyzed: nyan pa ni des gsungs pa rnams so //
translated: Listening is to what he has said.

original: legs par bshad pa ni 'ga' zhig res 'ga' rnyed par 'gyur gyi rtag tu ni ma yin te /
analyzed: legs par bshad pa ni 'ga' zhig res 'ga' rnyed par 'gyur gyi rtag tu ni ma yin te /
translated: Good speech is sometimes obtained, but not always,

original: au dumwa ra'i me tog bzhin no zhes bya bas rnyed par dka' bar bstan to //
analyzed: au dumwa ra'i me tog bzhin no zhes bya bas rnyed par dka' bar bstan to //
translated: like the udumbara flower. Thus, it is taught that it is difficult to obtain.

original: de ltar na lus dang srog dang longs spyod ni rnyed par sla ba yin la /
analyzed: de ltar na lus dang srog dang longs spyod ni rnyed par sla ba yin la /
translated: Thus, the body, life, and enjoyments are easily obtained.

original: legs par gsung ba ni rnyed par dka' ba yin bas des na de dag la ltos pa med par byas la chos mnyan pa la rab tu sbyar bar bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: legs par gsung ba ni rnyed par dka' ba yin bas des na de dag la ltos pa med par byas la chos mnyan pa la rab tu sbyar bar bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Good speech is difficult to obtain. Therefore, it is taught that, disregarding those, one should apply oneself to listening to the Dharma.

original: 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi mig thob pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir mig tu gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi mig thob pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir mig tu gyur pa yin te /
translated: It is an eye because it is the cause for obtaining the eye of noble wisdom.

original: chos mnyan pas phra ba dang rgya che ba'i don mthong ba dang / ma 'ongs pa na skye bas thob pa'i shes rab thob par 'gyur bas zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: chos mnyan pas phra ba dang rgya che ba'i don mthong ba dang / ma 'ongs pa na skye bas thob pa'i shes rab thob par 'gyur bas zhes bya bas so //
translated: By listening to the Dharma, one sees subtle and extensive meanings, and in the future one will obtain wisdom obtained through birth. Thus, it is said.

original: snang pa ni lhan cig skyes pa'i mig thob tu zin kyang de gong du shes bya'i don ji lta ba bzhin du gsal por rab tu ston pa ste /
analyzed: snang pa ni lhan cig skyes pa'i mig thob tu zin kyang de gong du shes bya'i don ji lta ba bzhin du gsal por rab tu ston pa ste /
translated: Although the eye has already obtained the innate, it is the clear manifestation of the object of knowledge just as it is.

original: 'bras bu dang phan yon chen po'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i go 'phang gi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang phan yon chen po'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i go 'phang gi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the cause of the state of nirvana, which is the great result and benefit.

original: chos thos pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa dang / rdzogs pa'i byang chub dag kyang yang dge par rab tu 'byed pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dag gi kha na ma tho ba med pa'i dga' ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dga' ba kha na mtho ba med pa'i 'du shes so //üîΩyid la byed pa mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos thos pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa dang / rdzogs pa'i byang chub dag kyang yang dge par rab tu 'byed pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dag gi kha na ma tho ba med pa'i dga' ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dga' ba kha na mtho ba med pa'i 'du shes so // yid la byed pa mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The Dharma that is heard is the cause of the undefiled joy of the tranquility and insight that fully discern nirvana and perfect enlightenment, therefore it is the perception of undefiled joy.üîΩOne should not attend to mental activity.

original: 'bad ba dang bcas pas mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'bad ba dang bcas pas mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that one should not attend to it with effort.

original: tshul khrims 'chal pa nyid dang / rigs dman pa nyid dang / byad ngan pa nyid dang / tshig 'bru ngan zhing legs par sbyar ba ma yin pa nyid yin na yang don la brten par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal pa nyid dang / rigs dman pa nyid dang / byad ngan pa nyid dang / tshig 'bru ngan zhing legs par sbyar ba ma yin pa nyid yin na yang don la brten par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even if they are immoral, of low caste, ugly, or have bad grammar and syntax, you should rely on the meaning.

original: khro zhing snyan par smra ba ma yin pa nyid yin na yang yid la byed par mi bya ste de'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: khro zhing snyan par smra ba ma yin pa nyid yin na yang yid la byed par mi bya ste de'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Even if they are angry and do not speak pleasantly, you should not reject them, because the reason for that is taught.

original: chos ni nam yang gang zag gi skyon gyis skyon can du mi 'gyur pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: chos ni nam yang gang zag gi skyon gyis skyon can du mi 'gyur pa'i phyir te /
translated: The Dharma is never flawed by the faults of the person.

original: gang zag kyang gzhan yin la chos kyang gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang zag kyang gzhan yin la chos kyang gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the person is one thing and the Dharma is another.

original: de'i phyir gang zag gi skyon gyis chos skyon can du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang zag gi skyon gyis chos skyon can du mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, the Dharma is not flawed by the faults of the person.

original: des ni chos kyi skyon med par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: des ni chos kyi skyon med par bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows that the Dharma is flawless.

original: de'i phyir gang zag gi skyon gyis sems sun 'byin par gyur pa'i byang chub sems dpa' shes rab dman pa dag chos nyan par mi byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang zag gi skyon gyis sems sun 'byin par gyur pa'i byang chub sems dpa' shes rab dman pa dag chos nyan par mi byed do //
translated: Therefore, bodhisattvas who are of little wisdom and who are discouraged about the Dharma by the faults of the person do not listen to the Dharma.

original: ma mnyan pas bdag nyid phan pa ma yin pa la 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ma mnyan pas bdag nyid phan pa ma yin pa la 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: Because of not listening, one engages in what is not beneficial,üîΩand one becomes deficient in wisdom.

original: shes rab las yongs su nyams pa dang ldan par @217b 'gyur ro zhes nye bar brtags nas gnas lnga la yid la byed pa med par chos mnyan pa la 'bad par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab las yongs su nyams pa dang ldan par @217b 'gyur ro zhes nye bar brtags nas gnas lnga la yid la byed pa med par chos mnyan pa la 'bad par bya'o //
translated: Having examined this, one should strive to listen to the Dharma without mental activity directed toward the five topics.

original: tshad med pa bsgom pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: tshad med pa bsgom pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The bodhisattva who cultivates the immeasurables is of two kinds:

original: so so'i skye bo rnams dang thun mong ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo rnams dang thun mong ma yin pa'o //
translated: one who is not in common with ordinary beings and one who is in common.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: As to how, etc.

original: bzhi'i ming bstan pa'i phyir byams pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi'i ming bstan pa'i phyir byams pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: In order to show the names of the four, [the text] says love, etc.

original: rnam pa gsum du zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' mdor bsdus nas kun rdzob kyi tshul dang don dam pa'i tshul la brten nas tshad med pa rnams bsgom bar bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum du zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' mdor bsdus nas kun rdzob kyi tshul dang don dam pa'i tshul la brten nas tshad med pa rnams bsgom bar bya ba nyid do //
translated: In three ways means that the bodhisattva, in brief, should cultivate the immeasurables based on the conventional mode and the ultimate mode.

original: kun rdzob kyi tshul ni mos pas spyod pa'i gnas skabs kyi de kho na ma rtogs pa'i tshe ste //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi tshul ni mos pas spyod pa'i gnas skabs kyi de kho na ma rtogs pa'i tshe ste //
translated: The conventional method is when one has not realized reality at the stage of devoted engagement.

original: sems can rnams bde par gyur cig ces yid la byas nas tshad med pa rnams sgom par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams bde par gyur cig ces yid la byas nas tshad med pa rnams sgom par byed pa'o //
translated: One cultivates the immeasurables by keeping in mind, ‚ÄúMay sentient beings be happy,‚Äù and so on.üîΩWhy is that?

original: gang gi phyir smras pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir smras pa /
translated: It is said:

original: sems can la dmigs pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sems can la dmigs pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is focused on sentient beings.‚Äù

original: don dam pa'i tshul gyis rab tu dbye ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: don dam pa'i tshul gyis rab tu dbye ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The classification by way of the ultimate method is twofold:

original: gang zag la bdag med pa mthong ba'i stobs kyis bsgom pa ni chos la dmigs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med pa mthong ba'i stobs kyis bsgom pa ni chos la dmigs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Cultivation by the power of seeing the selflessness of persons is called ‚Äúfocused on phenomena.‚Äù

original: chos la bdag med pa mthong ba'i stobs kyis goms par byed pa ni dmigs pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos la bdag med pa mthong ba'i stobs kyis goms par byed pa ni dmigs pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Cultivation by the power of seeing the selflessness of phenomena is called ‚Äúwithout focus.‚Äù

original: de ltar na rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de ltar na rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Thus there are three types.

original: tshad med pa bzhir rnam par gzhag par bya ba ni dmigs pa'i dbye bas rnam par gzhag pa nyid do //
analyzed: tshad med pa bzhir rnam par gzhag par bya ba ni dmigs pa'i dbye bas rnam par gzhag pa nyid do //
translated: The immeasurables are established by the classification of their objects.

original: tshogs gsum du rnam par bzhag nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshogs gsum du rnam par bzhag nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The three collections are established by the classification of their objects.

original: ngo bo nyid rnam par gzhag pa ni bde ba bsgrub pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa dang zhes bya ba'o //üîΩkhyad par nyid du rnam par gzhag pa ni gang yang smras pa /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid rnam par gzhag pa ni bde ba bsgrub pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa dang zhes bya ba'o // khyad par nyid du rnam par gzhag pa ni gang yang smras pa /
translated: The establishment of their nature is stated as ‚Äúthe superior intention to achieve happiness.

original: phyogs bcu khyab par byas nas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyogs bcu khyab par byas nas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äù The establishment of their distinction is stated as ‚Äúpervading the ten directions.

original: yid la byed pa'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa nyid ni gang gi phyir smras pa sems can la mos pas gnas pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa nyid ni gang gi phyir smras pa sems can la mos pas gnas pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äù The establishment of their specific activity is stated as ‚Äúthe basis of sentient beings‚Äô aspirations.

original: de ltar na tshul dang pos tshad med pa rnams mos pas rab tu phye ba bstan te /
analyzed: de ltar na tshul dang pos tshad med pa rnams mos pas rab tu phye ba bstan te /
translated: ‚Äù Thus, by the first method, the immeasurables are explained as distinguished by aspiration.

original: mos pas sems can rnams bde bar gyur ci ga ces dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mos pas sems can rnams bde bar gyur ci ga ces dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they focus on sentient beings with the aspiration, ‚ÄúMay they be happy!‚Äù

original: tshad med pa bzhi rnam pa'i dbye bas dbye bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshad med pa bzhi rnam pa'i dbye bas dbye bar bya'o //
translated: The immeasurables should be distinguished by their aspect.

original: rnam pa'i dbye ba yang dmigs pa'i dbye ba med pa ma yin zhes bya bas dmigs pa'i dbye ba rnam bar gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa'i dbye ba yang dmigs pa'i dbye ba med pa ma yin zhes bya bas dmigs pa'i dbye ba rnam bar gzhag par bya'o //
translated: And since their aspect is not without an objective basis, their objective basis should be established.

original: gal te sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i sems can la dmigs pa byams pa yin na /üîΩmdo las sems can thams cad la byams pa'i sems bsgom par @218a * //
analyzed: gal te sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i sems can la dmigs pa byams pa yin na / mdo las sems can thams cad la byams pa'i sems bsgom par @218a * //
translated: If love is the observation of sentient beings who are neither happy nor unhappy,üîΩhow is it that a sutra declares:

original: bya'o zhes bya ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: bya'o zhes bya ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúOne should cultivate a loving mind toward all sentient beings‚Äù?

original: phyogs kyi dbye ba dang / gnas kyi dbye ba'i dbang du byas nas zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs kyi dbye ba dang / gnas kyi dbye ba'i dbang du byas nas zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: The intended meaning is that it is cultivated in terms of the division of directions and the division of abodes.

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i sems can rnams bdag gi phyogs la sogs pa rnam pa gsum du 'gyur te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i sems can rnams bdag gi phyogs la sogs pa rnam pa gsum du 'gyur te /
translated: Sentient beings who are neither happy nor unhappy are of three types in relation to oneself:

original: dgra dang / gnyan bshes dang / tha mal pa'o //
analyzed: dgra dang / gnyan bshes dang / tha mal pa'o //
translated: enemies, friends, and neutral persons.

original: sems can de dag gi gnas kyi dbye ba yang nam mkha'i khams kyi mthar thug pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med par gtogs pa de dag thams cad la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can de dag gi gnas kyi dbye ba yang nam mkha'i khams kyi mthar thug pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med par gtogs pa de dag thams cad la dmigs pa'o //
translated: The division of their abodes is that they are observed in all the immeasurable world-realms that belong to the end of space.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: phyogs bcu khyab par byas nas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyogs bcu khyab par byas nas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving pervaded the ten directions.‚Äù

original: chos tsam du 'du shes dang ldan pa ni gang zag la bdag med par rab tu rtogs pa bdag gis dben pa'i gzugs la sogs pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos tsam du 'du shes dang ldan pa ni gang zag la bdag med par rab tu rtogs pa bdag gis dben pa'i gzugs la sogs pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The idea of mere phenomena is the realization of the selflessness of persons, because one sees form, etc. as devoid of self.

original: sems can du 'dogs par bsam pa thag pa nas mthong ste zhes bya ba ni sems can du tha snyad du btags pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems can du 'dogs par bsam pa thag pa nas mthong ste zhes bya ba ni sems can du tha snyad du btags pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: One sees the designation of sentient beings as a sentient being, i.e. as a conventional designation of a sentient being.

original: de dag gis ni sems can zhes mos par mi bya bar bstan to //
analyzed: de dag gis ni sems can zhes mos par mi bya bar bstan to //
translated: This shows that one should not conceive of sentient beings.

original: de ltar na yang de'i gnas skabs kyi chos la bde ba'i bsam pas nye bar sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar na yang de'i gnas skabs kyi chos la bde ba'i bsam pas nye bar sgrub par byed do //
translated: Nevertheless, one accomplishes the welfare of sentient beings by means of the Dharma in that situation.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: byams pa nyid sgom par byed pa de ni zhes bya ba ni de dag thams cad bde bar gyur cig ces yid la byas nas chos la dmigs pas sgom par byed kyi sems can du mos pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: byams pa nyid sgom par byed pa de ni zhes bya ba ni de dag thams cad bde bar gyur cig ces yid la byas nas chos la dmigs pas sgom par byed kyi sems can du mos pas ni ma yin no //
translated: One who cultivates loving kindness, i.e. one who cultivates loving kindness by means of the objective support of the Dharma, having taken to mind the thought, ‚ÄúMay all of them be happy!‚Äù and not by means of the conception of sentient beings.

original: chos de dag kyang byis pas yongs su brtags pa'i rnam par rtog par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: chos de dag kyang byis pas yongs su brtags pa'i rnam par rtog par mi byed pa'o //
translated: And one does not conceive of those phenomena as conceptual thoughts imagined by the childish.

original: chos tsam la yang mngon par zhen pa med pa de lta na yang bde ba nye bar bsgrub cing sbyin par 'dod pa ni byams pa'o //
analyzed: chos tsam la yang mngon par zhen pa med pa de lta na yang bde ba nye bar bsgrub cing sbyin par 'dod pa ni byams pa'o //
translated: Even though one does not cling to mere phenomena, still, the desire to give and to bring about the attainment of happiness is love.

original: de bzhin du snying rje la sogs pa'i tshul yang rig par bya'o //üîΩda ltar gyi sdug bsngal bsal bar 'dod pa'i bsam pa ni snying rje ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du snying rje la sogs pa'i tshul yang rig par bya'o // da ltar gyi sdug bsngal bsal bar 'dod pa'i bsam pa ni snying rje ste /
translated: The method of compassion, etc. should be understood in the same way.üîΩThe desire to remove the present suffering is compassion.

original: bsam pa thag pa nas sdug bsngal bsal bar 'dod pa nyid do //
analyzed: bsam pa thag pa nas sdug bsngal bsal bar 'dod pa nyid do //
translated: It is the desire to remove suffering from the very depths of one's heart.

original: de bzhin du bde ba dang bral bar ma gyur cig ces don du gnyer ba ni dga' ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bde ba dang bral bar ma gyur cig ces don du gnyer ba ni dga' ba'o //
translated: The desire that they not be deprived of happiness is joy.

original: de'i phyir bde ba la rjes su yi rang ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa dga' ba dang ldan pa zhes smras pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bde ba la rjes su yi rang ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa dga' ba dang ldan pa zhes smras pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the superior resolve of rejoicing in happiness is joy.

original: sems can gyi tshogs gsum gyi so sor nges pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa bsal bar 'dod pa ni btang snyoms te /
analyzed: sems can gyi tshogs gsum gyi so sor nges pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa bsal bar 'dod pa ni btang snyoms te /
translated: The desire to remove the specific addictions of the three groups of living beings is impartiality.

original: bde ba dang ldan pa rnams la rjes su chags pa med par ston pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang ldan pa rnams la khong khro ba med par ston par byed cing khro ba med par byed @218b pa dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba ma yin pa dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams la so sor ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms mi byed pas kun du rmongs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bde ba dang ldan pa rnams la rjes su chags pa med par ston pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang ldan pa rnams la khong khro ba med par ston par byed cing khro ba med par byed @218b pa dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba ma yin pa dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams la so sor ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms mi byed pas kun du rmongs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He shows those who are happy that there is no attachment, shows those who are suffering that there is no anger, and does not become confused by not being indifferent to those who are neither happy nor suffering.

original: de ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i btang snyoms su gnas pa nyid kyis de dag kyang de dang bral bar 'dod par byed de nyon mongs pa bsal bar 'dod pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i btang snyoms su gnas pa nyid kyis de dag kyang de dang bral bar 'dod par byed de nyon mongs pa bsal bar 'dod pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Thus, by abiding in indifference without defilement, he wishes them to be free from that, which is called the superior intention to remove defilement.

original: 'di dag 'dod chags la sogs pa dang bral bar gyur cig ces yid la byas nas btang snyoms sgom par byed do //
analyzed: 'di dag 'dod chags la sogs pa dang bral bar gyur cig ces yid la byas nas btang snyoms sgom par byed do //
translated: Having brought to mind, ‚ÄúMay they be free from attachment and so on,‚Äù he cultivates equanimity.

original: gzhan dag dang thun mongs pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir gzhan mu stegs can dang thun mongs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo dang thun mong pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag dang thun mongs pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir gzhan mu stegs can dang thun mongs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo dang thun mong pa ste /
translated: In order to show that it is shared with others, it is said to be shared with non-Buddhists.

original: ji ltar sems can du lta ba la mngon par zhen pa so so'i skye bo rnams sgom par byed pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang sgom par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar sems can du lta ba la mngon par zhen pa so so'i skye bo rnams sgom par byed pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang sgom par byed pa'o //
translated: Just as ordinary beings who are attached to the view of a real self cultivate it, so also do the bodhisattvas.

original: ji ltar nyan thos la sogs pa dag bdag med pa la mngon par zhen pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang zhes bya bas de dag dang thun mong pa'o ;
analyzed: ji ltar nyan thos la sogs pa dag bdag med pa la mngon par zhen pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang zhes bya bas de dag dang thun mong pa'o ;
translated: Just as the sravakas, etc. are attached to selflessness, so also are the bodhisattvas.

original: / rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa thams cad dang bral du zin kyang phan pa dang bde ba'i bsam pas nye bar sgrub pa'i ngo bo ni thun mong ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: / rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa thams cad dang bral du zin kyang phan pa dang bde ba'i bsam pas nye bar sgrub pa'i ngo bo ni thun mong ma yin pa'o //
translated: Even though they are free from all conceptual elaborations, the essence of their practice with the intention of benefiting and gladdening is not shared.

original: bde bar bya ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pas bsdus pa zhes bya ba ni bde ba ma skyes pa sgrub par 'dod pa dang / sdug bsngal skyes pa bsal ba'i bde ba sgrub par 'dod pa dang / bde ba skyes pa rnams gnas par rjes su yi rang ba'i rnam pa dang go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: bde bar bya ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pas bsdus pa zhes bya ba ni bde ba ma skyes pa sgrub par 'dod pa dang / sdug bsngal skyes pa bsal ba'i bde ba sgrub par 'dod pa dang / bde ba skyes pa rnams gnas par rjes su yi rang ba'i rnam pa dang go rims bzhin no //
translated: The four immeasurables are called ‚Äúcompassion‚Äù because they are included in the superior attitude of bringing happiness. The superior attitude of bringing happiness is threefold: the desire to bring about the happiness that has not arisen; the desire to remove the suffering that has arisen; and the desire to preserve the happiness that has arisen.

original: phan par bya ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pas bsdus pa zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam par spang ba'i bsam pa'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan par bya ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pas bsdus pa zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam par spang ba'i bsam pa'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The four immeasurables are called ‚Äúcompassion‚Äù because they are included in the superior attitude of bringing benefit. The superior attitude of bringing benefit is threefold: the desire to remove the suffering that has arisen; the desire to prevent the arising of suffering that has not yet arisen; and the desire to remove the causes of suffering.

original: de'i phyir tshad med pa bzhi la snying brtse ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshad med pa bzhi la snying brtse ba zhes brjod do //
translated: Therefore, the four immeasurables are called ‚Äúcompassion‚Äù because they are included in the superior attitude of bringing benefit and happiness.

original: de dag kyang phan pa dang bde ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi lhag pa'i bsam pa yin la snying brtse bar yang de'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang phan pa dang bde ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi lhag pa'i bsam pa yin la snying brtse bar yang de'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are also called ‚Äúcompassion‚Äù because they are characterized by the superior attitude of bringing benefit and happiness.

original: de'i phyir tshad med pa thob pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' la snying brtse ba can zhes ba rjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshad med pa thob pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' la snying brtse ba can zhes ba rjod do //
translated: Therefore, because of attaining the immeasurables, the bodhisattva is called ‚Äúcompassionate.‚Äù

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i snying rje ni sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal tsam la dmigs pa'i phyir snying rje chen po ma yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i snying rje ni sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal tsam la dmigs pa'i phyir snying rje chen po ma yin no //
translated: The compassion of the ≈õrƒÅvakas, etc. is not great compassion, because it is focused on the mere suffering of suffering.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa thams cad kyi dbye ba la dmigs pa'i phyir snying rje chen po yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa thams cad kyi dbye ba la dmigs pa'i phyir snying rje chen po yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the bodhisattvas‚Äô is great compassion because it is focused on the classification of all the aspects of suffering, he says:

original: sdug bsngal rnam pa brgya rtsa bcu mthong bas zhes bya ba la /üîΩlnga bcu rtsa lnga dang lnga @219a * //
analyzed: sdug bsngal rnam pa brgya rtsa bcu mthong bas zhes bya ba la / lnga bcu rtsa lnga dang lnga @219a * //
translated: Because of seeing the one hundred and ten aspects of suffering.

original: bcu rtsa lnga pa'i rnam grangs rnam pa gnyis kyis rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: bcu rtsa lnga pa'i rnam grangs rnam pa gnyis kyis rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
translated: The one hundred and ten aspects are to be established by way of two sets of fifty-five.

original: rnam grangs dang po lnga bcu rtsa lnga bstan pa'i phyir sdug bsngal rnam pa gcig ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rnam pa gcig ces bya ba ni 'dus byas thams cad du gtogs pa'i bye brag med pa'i spyi'i sdug bsngal ni 'jug pa'i sdug bsngal zhes
analyzed: rnam grangs dang po lnga bcu rtsa lnga bstan pa'i phyir sdug bsngal rnam pa gcig ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rnam pa gcig ces bya ba ni 'dus byas thams cad du gtogs pa'i bye brag med pa'i spyi'i sdug bsngal ni 'jug pa'i sdug bsngal zhes
translated: The one aspect is the general suffering of all that is compounded, without distinction.

original: brjod do // de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: brjod do // de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, he says:

original: sems can thams cad 'jug par gtogs pa'i sdug bsngal dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba brjod do //üîΩ'dod chags dang gti mug gi rgyus go rims bzhin du 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal gyi dbang du byas nas sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa gnyis ni 'dun pa'i rtsa ba can zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems can thams cad 'jug par gtogs pa'i sdug bsngal dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba brjod do // 'dod chags dang gti mug gi rgyus go rims bzhin du 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal gyi dbang du byas nas sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa gnyis ni 'dun pa'i rtsa ba can zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúAll sentient beings possess the suffering of the life-cycle.‚ÄùüîΩThe two aspects of suffering are based on desire and ignorance, respectively, and are based on the suffering of change and the suffering of pain.üîΩThe two aspects of suffering are based on desire and ignorance, respectively, and are based on the suffering of change and the suffering of pain.

original: gang la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags yod pa ste 'gyur ba ste gzhan du gyur pa las mya ngan la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: gang la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags yod pa ste 'gyur ba ste gzhan du gyur pa las mya ngan la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal lo //
translated: The suffering of change is the suffering of grief, etc., that arises from the change of what is pleasant.üîΩThe suffering of pain is the suffering of the five aggregates of the lower realms and of the suffering of humans and gods.

original: de sngon du 'gro ba yin pas na 'dun pa'i rtsa ba can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de sngon du 'gro ba yin pas na 'dun pa'i rtsa ba can zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it is the basis of the former, it is called the root of aspiration.

original: 'gyur ba rnam pa brgyad ni ji ltar nyan thos kyis las bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gyur ba rnam pa brgyad ni ji ltar nyan thos kyis las bstan pa yin no //
translated: The eight transformations are as they are taught in the Sravakabhumi.

original: de dag las dus kyis yongs su 'gyur ba ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: de dag las dus kyis yongs su 'gyur ba ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal lo //
translated: Among them, the transformation of time is the suffering of transformation.

original: lhag ma ni gzhan du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni gzhan du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The rest are the other transformations.

original: byis pa mi mkhas pa'i rang bzhin can dag lus la sdug bsngal gyi reg pa skyes par gyur pa na rmongs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba so //
analyzed: byis pa mi mkhas pa'i rang bzhin can dag lus la sdug bsngal gyi reg pa skyes par gyur pa na rmongs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba so //
translated: When the ignorant, foolish ordinary person experiences the arising of painful contact in the body, he becomes confused.

original: de ni kun du rmongs pa'i rnam par smin pa'i sdug bsngal te /
analyzed: de ni kun du rmongs pa'i rnam par smin pa'i sdug bsngal te /
translated: This is the suffering of the maturation of confusion.

original: gang la kun du rmongs pa'i rnam par smin pa'i sdug bsngal yod pa de ni kun du rmongs pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gang la kun du rmongs pa'i rnam par smin pa'i sdug bsngal yod pa de ni kun du rmongs pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: One who has the suffering of the maturation of confusion is said to have the result of confusion.

original: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag byis pa so so'i skye bo thos pa dang mi ldan pa dag lus kyis sdug bsngal gyi reg pa'i tshor ba myong bar gyur pa na mya ngan gyis kun du rmongs pa'i dbang du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa
analyzed: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag byis pa so so'i skye bo thos pa dang mi ldan pa dag lus kyis sdug bsngal gyi reg pa'i tshor ba myong bar gyur pa na mya ngan gyis kun du rmongs pa'i dbang du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa
translated: ‚ÄúMonks, when foolish, ordinary, untrained people experience painful bodily feelings, they become confused and overwhelmed by grief.üîΩ‚Äù

original: yin no // de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: yin no // de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: tshor ba drag po gang dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: tshor ba drag po gang dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: ‚ÄúBy whatever intense feelings‚Äù and so on.

original: zug rngu gnyis zhes bya ba ni lus kyi dang / sems kyi sdug bsngal rnam pa gnyis kyis gnod ba'o //
analyzed: zug rngu gnyis zhes bya ba ni lus kyi dang / sems kyi sdug bsngal rnam pa gnyis kyis gnod ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTwo kinds of pain‚Äù refers to the two kinds of suffering: that of the body and that of the mind.

original: sdug bsngal gsum gyi tshul gyis sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum pa nyid do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gsum gyi tshul gyis sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum pa nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúThree kinds of suffering‚Äù refers to the three kinds of suffering.

original: rnam pa bzhi mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis su rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis su rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
translated: ‚ÄúFour kinds‚Äù are summarized as two kinds:

original: bral ba'i sdug bsngal dang / kun du rmongs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: bral ba'i sdug bsngal dang / kun du rmongs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: the suffering of separation and the suffering of confusion.

original: de la bral ba'i sdug bsngal yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la bral ba'i sdug bsngal yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The suffering of separation is of two kinds:

original: 'dod pa dang bral @219b ba las byung ba gang yin pa de ni dang po'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang bral @219b ba las byung ba gang yin pa de ni dang po'o //
translated: The suffering that arises from separation from what is pleasant is the first.

original: 'tsho ba dang bral ba las byung ba gang yin pa de ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'tsho ba dang bral ba las byung ba gang yin pa de ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: The suffering that arises from association with what is unpleasant is the second.

original: gzhan yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two other kinds of suffering:

original: dus re zhig pa'i skye ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i sdug bsngal gang yin pa de ni des na smras pa /üîΩskye ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dus re zhig pa'i skye ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i sdug bsngal gang yin pa de ni des na smras pa / skye ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the suffering that is the continuation of birth, the suffering that is the succession of one birth from another,

original: skye ba thams cad du gtan sdug bsngal ba gang yin pa de ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba thams cad du gtan sdug bsngal ba gang yin pa de ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: and the suffering that is the nature of all conditioned things, the suffering that is the nature of all that is produced.

original: rnam pa lda ni kun nas dkris pa'i sgrib pa rnam pa ldas byas pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa lda ni kun nas dkris pa'i sgrib pa rnam pa ldas byas pa ste /
translated: There are five kinds of obscurations that are entanglements.

original: ji skad du mdo gzhan dag las /
analyzed: ji skad du mdo gzhan dag las /
translated: As it is said in another sutra:

original: 'di na 'ga' zhig 'dod pa la 'dun pas kun nas dkris pa'i rkyen gyis sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba rab tu myong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: 'di na 'ga' zhig 'dod pa la 'dun pas kun nas dkris pa'i rkyen gyis sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba rab tu myong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Here someone experiences pain and mental anguish due to the condition of being entangled in desire,

original: de bzhin du the tshom gyi rkyen gyis zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du the tshom gyi rkyen gyis zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: up to and including the condition of being entangled in doubt.

original: rnam pa drug tu rnam par gzhag pa ni nyes par spyod pa byed pa rnams kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dbye ba dang / longs spyod bsgrub pa la sogs pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa drug tu rnam par gzhag pa ni nyes par spyod pa byed pa rnams kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dbye ba dang / longs spyod bsgrub pa la sogs pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: The sixfold classification is in terms of the causes and results of those who engage in misdeeds, and in terms of the attainment of enjoyments, and so on.

original: sdug bsngal rnam pa bdun ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa bstan pa'i tshig rnams las phyi ma rtsa ba'i sdug bsngal ma gtogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal rnam pa bdun ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa bstan pa'i tshig rnams las phyi ma rtsa ba'i sdug bsngal ma gtogs pa rnams so //
translated: The seven kinds of suffering are the latter ones among the statements of the truth of suffering, excluding the fundamental suffering.

original: sdug bsngal rnam pa brgyad ni dus yongs su gyur pa las byung ba dang / 'byung ba yongs su gyur pa las byung ba dang / lhan cig skyes pa dang / byed pa dang bcas pa'i sdug bsngal dang / gnas pa'i sdug bsngal gyi dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal rnam pa brgyad ni dus yongs su gyur pa las byung ba dang / 'byung ba yongs su gyur pa las byung ba dang / lhan cig skyes pa dang / byed pa dang bcas pa'i sdug bsngal dang / gnas pa'i sdug bsngal gyi dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: The eight kinds of suffering are in terms of the suffering that arises from the transformation of time, the suffering that arises from the transformation of the elements, the suffering of the origin of suffering, the suffering of the origin of the elements, the suffering of the origin of time, the suffering of the origin of the combination of the elements and time, the suffering of birth, and the suffering of the origin of birth.

original: dang po dang gnyis pa ni rnam pa gnyis gnyis su dbye ba'o //
analyzed: dang po dang gnyis pa ni rnam pa gnyis gnyis su dbye ba'o //
translated: The first two are divided into two kinds each.

original: gsum pa ni rnam pa gcig nyid do //
analyzed: gsum pa ni rnam pa gcig nyid do //
translated: The third is only one kind.

original: bzhi pa ni rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: The fourth is two kinds.

original: gzhan gyis byas pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis byas pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: That produced by another is also two kinds.

original: gzhan gyi bsam pa sngon du song nas byas pa dang / reg pa nyams su myong ba sngon du song ba las byung ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi bsam pa sngon du song nas byas pa dang / reg pa nyams su myong ba sngon du song ba las byung ba'o //
translated: and the other's intention precedes the action, and the experience of contact precedes the action.

original: rnam pa dgu ni dngos po'i dbye ba dang / bye brag gi dbye ba dang / gnas skabs kyi dbye ba'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa dgu ni dngos po'i dbye ba dang / bye brag gi dbye ba dang / gnas skabs kyi dbye ba'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: The nine types are from the point of view of the classification of entities, the classification of distinctions, and the classification of states.

original: dngos po'i dbye ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dngos po'i dbye ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The classification of entities is also twofold:

original: bdag dang gzhan no //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan no //
translated: one's own and others'.

original: gzhan gcig pu yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gzhan gcig pu yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Others alone are also twofold:

original: sdug pa'i sems can dang dngos po'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: sdug pa'i sems can dang dngos po'i dbye bas so //
translated: from the point of view of the classification of sentient beings and things that are pleasant.

original: gang gi phyir smras pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir smras pa /
translated: For what reason is it said:

original: nye du rgud pa'i sdug bsngal dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nye du rgud pa'i sdug bsngal dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The suffering of relatives' decline?

original: bdag nyid rgud pa'i dbang du byas pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: bdag nyid rgud pa'i dbang du byas pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: From the point of view of one's own decline, there are three types:

original: 'bras bu dang rgyu'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang rgyu'i dbye bas so //
translated: from the point of view of the classification of results and causes.

original: nad med pa ni rnyed pa'i mchog ces bya ba'i tshig gis de rgud pa ni 'bras bus bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: nad med pa ni rnyed pa'i mchog ces bya ba'i tshig gis de rgud pa ni 'bras bus bsdus pa'o //
translated: Health is the supreme gain - by this statement, its decline is included in the result.

original: tshul khrims dang lta ba rgud pa ni rgyus bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang lta ba rgud pa ni rgyus bsdus pa'o //
translated: The decline of morality and view is included in the cause.

original: gnas skabs kyi dbye ba yang @220a * //
analyzed: gnas skabs kyi dbye ba yang @220a * //
translated: There are also classifications of the levels of the path.üîΩ

original: rnam ba gnyis te /
analyzed: rnam ba gnyis te /
translated: The classification of the occasion is also twofold:üîΩthe occasion of this life and the occasion of another life.

original: tshul khrims kyis phongs pa dang / lta bas phongs pa'i sdug bsngal gnyis ma gtogs pa gzhan dag ni tshe 'di pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyis phongs pa dang / lta bas phongs pa'i sdug bsngal gnyis ma gtogs pa gzhan dag ni tshe 'di pa'o //
translated: The suffering of the loss of virtue and the suffering of the loss of view are the occasion of this life, except for the two sufferings of the loss of virtue and the loss of view.

original: de gnyis ni tshe gzhan pa'o //
analyzed: de gnyis ni tshe gzhan pa'o //
translated: The other sufferings are the occasion of another life.

original: rnam pa bcu ni lus kyi yo byad bcus phongs pa'i dbye ba ste //
analyzed: rnam pa bcu ni lus kyi yo byad bcus phongs pa'i dbye ba ste //
translated: The classification of the ten kinds of suffering is the classification of the loss of the ten kinds of physical necessities.

original: de ltar lnga bcu rtsa lngar bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar lnga bcu rtsa lngar bstan to //
translated: Thus, there are fifty-five kinds of suffering.

original: yang sdug bsngal ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: yang sdug bsngal ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Again, suffering is of two kinds, etc.

original: rnam grangs gnyis pas lhag ma sdug bsngal rnam pa lnga bcu rtsa lnga rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir bstan te /
analyzed: rnam grangs gnyis pas lhag ma sdug bsngal rnam pa lnga bcu rtsa lnga rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir bstan te /
translated: By the second enumeration, the remaining fifty-five kinds of suffering are presented.

original: yang zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs gzhan gyi sdug bsngal rnam pa dgu rnam par gzhag pa ste //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs gzhan gyi sdug bsngal rnam pa dgu rnam par gzhag pa ste //
translated: Again means that the nine kinds of suffering are presented by another enumeration.

original: mdor bstan pa rnam par dbye ba nyid ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ma lus par yongs su 'dzin pa nyid dang / sdug bsngal thams cad rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: mdor bstan pa rnam par dbye ba nyid ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ma lus par yongs su 'dzin pa nyid dang / sdug bsngal thams cad rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: The presentation of the brief summary is just the presentation of the cause of suffering and the presentation of all suffering.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The causes of suffering are also of two kinds:

original: 'das pa'i skye bar sngon bsags pa'i las kyis bskyed pa gang yin pa'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu sdug bsngal du 'gyur ba dang / tshe 'di'i rang gi rkyen gyis yongs su gzung ba ste /

original: gang las rgud pa'i sdug bsngal gyi 'bras bu 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gang las rgud pa'i sdug bsngal gyi 'bras bu 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //

original: dus la sogs pa chen po dang ldan pas sdug bsngal rnam pa bzhi ni sdug bsngal chen po'o //
analyzed: dus la sogs pa chen po dang ldan pas sdug bsngal rnam pa bzhi ni sdug bsngal chen po'o //
translated: The suffering of suffering is great suffering, because it is associated with great time, etc.üîΩThe suffering of everything that is composite is the suffering that is associated with all the realms of existence, because it is associated with all the realms of existence.

original: 'gro ba thams cad kyi sgo nas zhugs pa'i phyir thams cad kyi sgo nas te /üîΩji ltar rigs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad kyi sgo nas zhugs pa'i phyir thams cad kyi sgo nas te / ji ltar rigs par sbyar ro //
translated: It is associated with all the realms of existence, because it is associated with all the realms of existence.

original: bdag nyid kyis lus dang ngag dang yid kyis ngan par spyod pa las skyes pa ni log par zhugs ba'i sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis lus dang ngag dang yid kyis ngan par spyod pa las skyes pa ni log par zhugs ba'i sdug bsngal lo //
translated: The suffering of those who are in error is the suffering that arises from the evil conduct of body, speech, and mind.

original: yang log par zhugs pa de ni dngos po rnam pa drug tu shes par bya ste /
analyzed: yang log par zhugs pa de ni dngos po rnam pa drug tu shes par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, that suffering of those who are in error should be understood as being of six kinds:

original: sems can gzhan gyis byas pa ni gang gi phyir smras pa /
analyzed: sems can gzhan gyis byas pa ni gang gi phyir smras pa /
translated: The suffering created by other sentient beings is that which is stated:

original: gzhan gyis gnod pa byas pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gzhan gyis gnod pa byas pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: ‚Äúcreated by the harm of others,‚Äù and so on.

original: gzhan gyis gnod pa byas pa bshad pa ni gzhan la gnod pa byas pa las byung ba zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyis gnod pa byas pa bshad pa ni gzhan la gnod pa byas pa las byung ba zhes bya ba ste /

original: gzhan dag la mi 'dod pa'i gnod pa byas ba las byung ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhan dag la mi 'dod pa'i gnod pa byas ba las byung ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

original: byang pas byed pa pos thob bo zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: byang pas byed pa pos thob bo zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /

analyzed: gnod pa byas pa las byung ba dang zhes bya ba la rang nyid ldang ba'i phyir kun nas slong ba'o /

original: kha zas mi mthun pa zos pas khams ma snyoms pa las byung ba ni nad sna tshogs kyi sdug bsngal zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: kha zas mi mthun pa zos pas khams ma snyoms pa las byung ba ni nad sna tshogs kyi sdug bsngal zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúCreated by the imbalance of the elements‚Äù means that which arises from the imbalance of the elements due to eating incompatible foods. The meaning is the suffering of various illnesses.

original: bdag nyid kyis mi rigs par sdug bsngal bar byas pa las zhes bya ba ni bsod nams ma yin pa la bsod nams kyi blos spyod par byed @220b pa dang / rang gi rnam par rtog pa'i dbang gis phyin ci log tu yid la byed pa mang ba las nyon mongs pas kun nas dkris pa'i rkyen gyis sdug bsngal so sor myong bar 'gyur ba las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis mi rigs par sdug bsngal bar byas pa las zhes bya ba ni bsod nams ma yin pa la bsod nams kyi blos spyod par byed @220b pa dang / rang gi rnam par rtog pa'i dbang gis phyin ci log tu yid la byed pa mang ba las nyon mongs pas kun nas dkris pa'i rkyen gyis sdug bsngal so sor myong bar 'gyur ba las 'byung ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom the suffering that one has brought upon oneself through unreasonableness‚Äù means that one engages in unwholesome actions with the thought that they are wholesome, and one is often mentally engaged in error through the power of one‚Äôs own conceptual thoughts. From these conditions, one experiences suffering that is bound up with the afflictions.

original: nyes par spyod pa mang du spyad pas rgyu des ma 'ongs pa na ngan 'gro'i sdug bsngal thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyes par spyod pa mang du spyad pas rgyu des ma 'ongs pa na ngan 'gro'i sdug bsngal thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom the many misdeeds that one has done‚Äù means that through that cause one will obtain the suffering of the unfortunate realms in the future.

original: 'jug pa'i sdug bsngal ni 'khor ba na nges pa med pa'i bya bas gnas skabs gzhan du gyur pa'i tshul gyis yongs su gyur pa dang ldan pa na sngon gyi gnas skabs btang nas gnas skabs gzhan thob par 'gyur ba'o /

translated: The suffering of change is that, in sa·πÉsƒÅra, through the activities of uncertainty, one is subject to transformation in the manner of a change of state. Having given up the previous state, one obtains another state.

original: lus ma des pas zhes bya ba ni bdag la nges pa med pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lus ma des pas zhes bya ba ni bdag la nges pa med pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause the body is not firm‚Äù means that the self is not fixed.

original: mi 'dod pas byas pa'i sdug bsngal ni 'dod pa'i phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa bdun las bzlog pa'i rgud pa nye bar thob pa ste /
analyzed: mi 'dod pas byas pa'i sdug bsngal ni 'dod pa'i phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa bdun las bzlog pa'i rgud pa nye bar thob pa ste /
translated: Pain that is not desired is the misfortune that is the opposite of the seven kinds of excellence that are desired.

original: tshe ring ba phun sum tshogs pa 'dod pa las de las bzlog pa'i mi 'dod pa'i sdug bsngal thob par 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: tshe ring ba phun sum tshogs pa 'dod pa las de las bzlog pa'i mi 'dod pa'i sdug bsngal thob par 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang sbyar bar bya ste /

original: gzugs phun sum tshogs pa dang rigs phun sum tshogs pa dang / longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa dang / stobs phun sum tshogs pa dang / shes rab phun sum tshogs pa dang / rnam par rgyal ba phun sum tshogs pas te /
analyzed: gzugs phun sum tshogs pa dang rigs phun sum tshogs pa dang / longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa dang / stobs phun sum tshogs pa dang / shes rab phun sum tshogs pa dang / rnam par rgyal ba phun sum tshogs pas te /
translated: such as the excellence of physical appearance, the excellence of family, the excellence of wealth, the excellence of power, the excellence of wisdom, and the excellence of victory.

original: phun sum tshogs pa ni 'di dag go //
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa ni 'di dag go //
translated: These are the kinds of excellence.

original: gang ci yang rung ba'i rnam pas mi 'dod pa dang phrad pa ni phongs pa'i sdug bsngal zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang ci yang rung ba'i rnam pas mi 'dod pa dang phrad pa ni phongs pa'i sdug bsngal zhes bya ste /
translated: Meeting with what is not desired in any way whatsoever is called the suffering of misfortune.

original: de yang khyim pa rnams kyi ni yongs su bzung ba'i dngos po nyams par gyur pa las byung ba'i sdug bsngal dang / mu ge byung bas nye bar gnod pa'i bkres pa'i sdug bsngal dang / gzhan gyis gnod pa byas pas rnam par nyams pa'i sdug bsngal dang /

translated: Moreover, for householders, it is suffering that arises from the loss of property, the suffering of hunger that is harmed by famine, the suffering of decline that is harmed by others,

original: gcong rong du zhugs pa'i sdug bsngal dang / 'tsho ba nyams pa'i sdug bsngal dang / yan lag nyams pa'i sdug bsngal dang / gzhan gyis mi 'dod pa byas pa'i yan lag bcing ba dang gcad pa la sogs pa las byung ba'i sdug bsngal gyi dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: gcong rong du zhugs pa'i sdug bsngal dang / 'tsho ba nyams pa'i sdug bsngal dang / yan lag nyams pa'i sdug bsngal dang / gzhan gyis mi 'dod pa byas pa'i yan lag bcing ba dang gcad pa la sogs pa las byung ba'i sdug bsngal gyi dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: the suffering of entering a ravine, the suffering of a ruined livelihood, the suffering of crippled limbs, and the suffering that arises from being bound, cut, and so on by others.

original: sems can thams cad dang thun mongs pa gang yin pa ni rjes su 'brel pa las byung ba'i sdug bsngal te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad dang thun mongs pa gang yin pa ni rjes su 'brel pa las byung ba'i sdug bsngal te /
translated: That which is shared with all sentient beings is the suffering that arises from being related.

original: dngos po med par gyur pa ni 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po med par gyur pa ni 'jig pa'o //

original: ma lus par gyur pa ni zad pa'o //
analyzed: ma lus par gyur pa ni zad pa'o //
