original: cha phra ba nyid kyang rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cha phra ba nyid kyang rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Subtlety itself is difficult to understand.

original: tshor ba'i sdug bsngal ni tshor ba gang ci yang rung ba de ni sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bya bas so //üîΩrgyu rnam pa bzhis zhes bya ba ni chen po bzhi dang ldan bas na snying rje chen po zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: tshor ba'i sdug bsngal ni tshor ba gang ci yang rung ba de ni sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bya bas so // rgyu rnam pa bzhis zhes bya ba ni chen po bzhi dang ldan bas na snying rje chen po zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The suffering of sensation is any sensation whatsoever, since it is said that ‚Äúall sensation is suffering.‚ÄùüîΩThe fourfold cause is the possession of the four greatnesses, and thus it is taught that compassion is great.

original: chen po rnam pa bzhi'i dmigs pa chen po nyid ni gang gi phyir smras pa /
analyzed: chen po rnam pa bzhi'i dmigs pa chen po nyid ni gang gi phyir smras pa /
translated: The greatness of the object of the four greatnesses is stated as follows:

original: zab cing cha phra la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //üîΩdus chen po nyid ni gang yang smras pa /
analyzed: zab cing cha phra la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // dus chen po nyid ni gang yang smras pa /
translated: The phrase profound and subtle and so on.

original: yun ring po nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yun ring po nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase for a long time and so on.

original: yid la byed pa chen po nyid ni gang gi phyir smras pa /
analyzed: yid la byed pa chen po nyid ni gang gi phyir smras pa /
translated: The phrase with great mental activity and so on.

original: rtsol ba drag pos dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rtsol ba drag pos dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase with intense effort and so on.

original: de ltar 'bad pa med par snying rjes non pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems can gcig gi don du yang bdag nyid dang / bdag gi lus dang nye bar mkho ba thams cad yongs su btang nas bdag nyid sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa thams cad yongs su 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar 'bad pa med par snying rjes non pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems can gcig gi don du yang bdag nyid dang / bdag gi lus dang nye bar mkho ba thams cad yongs su btang nas bdag nyid sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa thams cad yongs su 'dzin par byed do //
translated: Thus, without any effort, the bodhisattvas, who are overcome with compassion, for the sake of even a single sentient being, give up their own bodies and all their possessions and take on all the various kinds of suffering.

original: 'di dag gis ni bdag nyid la ltos pa med pa dang / lhun gyis grub pa'i khyad par can gyi snyang rje sems can rnam sa la skyed par byed do zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag gis ni bdag nyid la ltos pa med pa dang / lhun gyis grub pa'i khyad par can gyi snyang rje sems can rnam sa la skyed par byed do zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: These verses show that compassion is generated in sentient beings through its special quality of being independent of any personal motive and spontaneous.

original: rnam par dag pa chen po nyid ni gang gi phyir smras pa /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa chen po nyid ni gang gi phyir smras pa /
translated: Great purity itself is stated in the verse:üîΩIt is also extremely pure.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa yang yin te zhes bya ba la rnam par dag pa ni mthar thug pa'i sa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ni snying po la yod pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa yang yin te zhes bya ba la rnam par dag pa ni mthar thug pa'i sa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ni snying po la yod pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Purity is for the Bodhisattvas who have attained the stage of culmination, because they have abandoned the obscurations that exist in the core.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni bag chags dang bcas pa spangs pas so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni bag chags dang bcas pa spangs pas so //
translated: The Tathagata is pure because he has abandoned the propensities.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje thams cad ces bya ba ni sems can dang / chos dmigs pa med pa'i snying rje'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje thams cad ces bya ba ni sems can dang / chos dmigs pa med pa'i snying rje'o //
translated: All the compassion of the Bodhisattvas refers to compassion that has sentient beings and dharmas as its objects.

original: yang na bstan ma thag pa'i snying rje thams cad do //
analyzed: yang na bstan ma thag pa'i snying rje thams cad do //
translated: Or else, it refers to all the compassion that has just been mentioned.

original: snying rje'i bsam pa rnam par dag bzhes @222a * //
analyzed: snying rje'i bsam pa rnam par dag bzhes @222a * //
translated: The thought of compassion is completely pure.

original: bya ba ni snying rje bsgom pa zhes bya bar bsams ba'o //
analyzed: bya ba ni snying rje bsgom pa zhes bya bar bsams ba'o //
translated: This means that the thought of compassion is cultivated.

original: sems shin tu mnyen pa ni sems can rnams yongs su mi gtong ba'i bsam pa nyid do //
analyzed: sems shin tu mnyen pa ni sems can rnams yongs su mi gtong ba'i bsam pa nyid do //
translated: The mind is very tender, because of the thought of not abandoning sentient beings.

original: byams pa'i sems ni kha na ma tho ba med pa'i 'dod pa'i bde ba nye bar bsgrub pa'i bsams pa'o //
analyzed: byams pa'i sems ni kha na ma tho ba med pa'i 'dod pa'i bde ba nye bar bsgrub pa'i bsams pa'o //
translated: The thought of love is the thought of attaining the happiness of the desire realm without fault.

original: byed 'dod pa'i sems ni phan pa dang bde ba nye bar bsgrub pa'i bya ba brtsams pa'i bsam pa nyid do //
analyzed: byed 'dod pa'i sems ni phan pa dang bde ba nye bar bsgrub pa'i bya ba brtsams pa'i bsam pa nyid do //
translated: The thought of desire to act is the thought of undertaking the activity of attaining benefit and happiness.

original: skyo ba med pa'i sems ni bar du ldog par mi 'gyur ba'i bsam pa nyid do //
analyzed: skyo ba med pa'i sems ni bar du ldog par mi 'gyur ba'i bsam pa nyid do //
translated: The thought of non-discouragement is the thought of not turning back in the middle.

original: sdug bsngal nyams su len pa'i sems ni sems can gyi sdug bsngal nyams su len pa'i bsam pa nyid do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal nyams su len pa'i sems ni sems can gyi sdug bsngal nyams su len pa'i bsam pa nyid do //
translated: The thought of taking on suffering is the thought of taking on the suffering of sentient beings.

original: las su rung ba'i sems ni sems can thams cad kyi bran gyi bsam pas gnas pa'o //
analyzed: las su rung ba'i sems ni sems can thams cad kyi bran gyi bsam pas gnas pa'o //
translated: The thought of flexibility is the thought of remaining like a servant of all sentient beings.

original: de ltar mi 'jug go zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de ltar mi 'jug go zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: As for ‚Äúnot engaging in that way,‚Äù and so on,

original: 'phags pa nyan thos skyo ba dang ldan pa'i sems kyis legs par bsgoms pas bden pa mthong ba'i gang zag dag gi rgyud kyi sdug bsngal zhi bar bya ba'i phyir thar par 'jug pa de bas ni byang chub sems dpa' sems can gyi rgyud kyi sdug bsngal bsal
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos skyo ba dang ldan pa'i sems kyis legs par bsgoms pas bden pa mthong ba'i gang zag dag gi rgyud kyi sdug bsngal zhi bar bya ba'i phyir thar par 'jug pa de bas ni byang chub sems dpa' sems can gyi rgyud kyi sdug bsngal bsal
translated: The bodhisattva enters more quickly than the noble ≈õrƒÅvakas, who, with a mind full of disgust, well cultivated, see the truth and enter into liberation in order to put an end to their own suffering.

original: bar bya ba'i phyir dang / rnam par grol bar bya ba'i phyir myur du 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: bar bya ba'i phyir dang / rnam par grol bar bya ba'i phyir myur du 'jug par byed do //
translated: The bodhisattva enters more quickly than they in order to remove the suffering of the stream of beings and in order to liberate them.üîΩIn this way, the bodhisattva who cultivates compassion also perfects the six perfections.

original: de ltar snying rje bsgoms pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug kyang yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de ltar snying rje bsgoms pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug kyang yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: To demonstrate this, he says,üîΩThere is nothing at all that he does not give up.

original: gang ci yang yongs su mi gtong ba med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa la pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa ni snying rje'i rtsa ba la sa yin la pha rol tu phyin pa rdzogs par gyur na ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang
analyzed: gang ci yang yongs su mi gtong ba med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa la pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa ni snying rje'i rtsa ba la sa yin la pha rol tu phyin pa rdzogs par gyur na ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang
translated: The perfection of the perfections is rooted in compassion. When the perfections are perfected, the bodhisattva is truly and completely

original: chub thob pa'i phyir dang byang chub ni snying rje la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chub thob pa'i phyir dang byang chub ni snying rje la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the bodhisattva is the one who is established in compassion, he says:üîΩThe perfection of the immeasurables is the cause of the attainment of enlightenment.

original: tshad med pa phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba la byang chub sems dpa' kho na'i tshad med pa phun sum tshogs pa yin gyi gzhan dag gi phun sum tshogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tshad med pa phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba la byang chub sems dpa' kho na'i tshad med pa phun sum tshogs pa yin gyi gzhan dag gi phun sum tshogs pa ma yin no //
translated: The perfection of the immeasurables is the cause of the attainment of enlightenment, because the bodhisattva alone has the perfection of the immeasurables, but others do not.

original: phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu tshad med pa yongs su 'dzin pa dang / rnam pa tshad med pa dang ldan pa dang / phan yon gyi khyad par tshad med pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu tshad med pa yongs su 'dzin pa dang / rnam pa tshad med pa dang ldan pa dang / phan yon gyi khyad par tshad med pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The perfection of the immeasurables is so called because it embraces immeasurable results, because it is endowed with immeasurable aspects and because it is endowed with immeasurable benefits.

original: bskal pa dpag tu med par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu rgyun mi 'chad pa ster par sbyor ba'i phyir 'dod pa'i 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: bskal pa dpag tu med par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu rgyun mi 'chad pa ster par sbyor ba'i phyir 'dod pa'i 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: It embraces immeasurable results because it bestows the result of the desired for an immeasurable length of time, since it is applied for immeasurable aeons.

original: ji skad bstan pa'i sdug bsngal rnams la dmigs pa nyid ni tshad med pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i sdug bsngal rnams la dmigs pa nyid ni tshad med pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The immeasurable aspects of the immeasurables refer to the very immeasurables that are the objects of mental attention.

original: rnam pa de dag gzhan la phan pa dang bde ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pas yongs su goms par byas pa'i phyir dge zhing @222b kha na mtho ba med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa de dag gzhan la phan pa dang bde ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pas yongs su goms par byas pa'i phyir dge zhing @222b kha na mtho ba med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: These aspects are called virtuous and irreproachable because they are thoroughly familiar with the superior intention of benefiting and gladdening others.

original: phan yon rnam pa bzhi ni tsho 'di pa nyid kyi yin gyi gzhan gyi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phan yon rnam pa bzhi ni tsho 'di pa nyid kyi yin gyi gzhan gyi ni ma yin no //
translated: The four benefits are for this life, not for another life.

original: rten dang brten pa'i khyad par dang sbyor bas te /
analyzed: rten dang brten pa'i khyad par dang sbyor bas te /
translated: They are due to the distinction of the basis and the dependent, and to practice.

original: tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa ni rten gyi khyad par gyis dug dang mtshon la sogs pa'i gnod pas mi tshugs pa'o //
analyzed: tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa ni rten gyi khyad par gyis dug dang mtshon la sogs pa'i gnod pas mi tshugs pa'o //
translated: Happy abiding in this life is due to the distinction of the basis, not being harmed by the dangers of poison, weapons and so on.

original: brten pa'i khyad par ni tshangs pa'i gnas kyis yongs su bsdus pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i 'jug pa'o /
analyzed: brten pa'i khyad par ni tshangs pa'i gnas kyis yongs su bsdus pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i 'jug pa'o /
translated: The distinction of the dependent is the engagement of mind and mental factors subsumed by the bases of Brahma.

original: bsod nams tshad med pa yongs su sdud pa'i phyir bsod nams kyi tshogs tshad med pa yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams tshad med pa yongs su sdud pa'i phyir bsod nams kyi tshogs tshad med pa yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
translated: It is the accumulation of immeasurable merit because it fully gathers immeasurable collections of merit.

original: brtan par 'gyur ba ni sems can rnams la phan pa dang bde ba'i bsam pa legs par bsgoms ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtan par 'gyur ba ni sems can rnams la phan pa dang bde ba'i bsam pa legs par bsgoms ba'i phyir ro //
translated: One becomes stable through cultivating the intention to benefit and gladden sentient beings.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bdag nyid la ltos pa med par bsgrubs pa dang ldan pas sdug bsngal nyams su len par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bdag nyid la ltos pa med par bsgrubs pa dang ldan pas sdug bsngal nyams su len par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: For that very reason, one is established without regard for oneself and so one takes on suffering.

original: mchod pa dang bshes gnyen bsten pa dang / tshad med pa bsgom pa'i le'u ste bcu drug pa'i 'grel pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: mchod pa dang bshes gnyen bsten pa dang / tshad med pa bsgom pa'i le'u ste bcu drug pa'i 'grel pa rdzogs so /
translated: This completes the commentary on the sixteenth chapter of the Bodhisattvabhumi, on worship, reliance on spiritual friends, and cultivation of the immeasurables.

original: // / ngo tsha brtan dad mi skyo dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa rnams kyi 'grel pa ni sngar /üîΩgang la ji ltar gang dag slob //
analyzed: // / ngo tsha brtan dad mi skyo dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa rnams kyi 'grel pa ni sngar / gang la ji ltar gang dag slob //
translated: The commentary on the verses of the summary beginning with ‚Äúconscientiousness, steadfastness, faith, and indefatigability‚Äù was given earlier.

original: ces bstan pa de las gang la ji ltar slob pa ni bstan nas gang dag slob pa ma bstan pas de'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: ces bstan pa de las gang la ji ltar slob pa ni bstan nas gang dag slob pa ma bstan pas de'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: What is taught there is ‚Äúwhat, how, and where one should train.‚Äù The ‚Äúwhat‚Äù and ‚Äúhow‚Äù of training have been taught, but the ‚Äúwhere‚Äù has not been taught, so now, in this context, it is said:

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa bcu gnyis yongs su rdzogs pa la slob po zhes chos kyi sdom 'di dag bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa bcu gnyis yongs su rdzogs pa la slob po zhes chos kyi sdom 'di dag bstan pa yin te /
translated: The bodhisattva trains in perfecting the twelve aspects.

original: ngo tsha brtan pa ni chos kyi mdo rnam pa bzhi'i bar la slob par 'gyur ro zhes rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ngo tsha brtan pa ni chos kyi mdo rnam pa bzhi'i bar la slob par 'gyur ro zhes rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the firm conscience is the training in the four Dharma summaries.

original: do tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa ni rnam pa gnyis su gzhag par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: do tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa ni rnam pa gnyis su gzhag par rig par bya ste /
translated: One should understand that conscience and shame are established in two ways:

original: rang gi mtshan nyid dang / dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid dang / dmigs pa'o //
translated: their own nature and their object.

original: de'i phyir rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that they should be understood in two ways.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis dmad cing brjod par rigs pa ma yin pa ni kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis dmad cing brjod par rigs pa ma yin pa ni kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'o //
translated: That which is censured by the Buddhas and bodhisattvas and is not suitable to be spoken of is reprehensible.

original: yang de ni mdor bsdu na dngos po nyid ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yang de ni mdor bsdu na dngos po nyid ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Moreover, in brief, there are two kinds of things:

original: byang chub sems dpa'i ldog pa'i tshul khrims dang / 'jug pa'i tshul khrims las brtsams nas bya bar 'os pa mi byed pa dang / bya ba ma yin pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i ldog pa'i tshul khrims dang / 'jug pa'i tshul khrims las brtsams nas bya bar 'os pa mi byed pa dang / bya ba ma yin pa byed pa'o //
translated: The morality of the bodhisattva is twofold: morality of restraint and morality of engagement. The first is violated by not doing what should be done and by doing what should not be done.

original: yang de dag las nyes pa byas nas phyir mi 'chos pa las brtsams nas rnam pa gnyis ni kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i dngos po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang de dag las nyes pa byas nas phyir mi 'chos pa las brtsams nas rnam pa gnyis ni kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i dngos po zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, when one has committed a transgression and does not make amends, the two are called ‚Äúthings with a fault.‚Äù

original: bzhi po 'di dag ni gnas zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bzhi po 'di dag ni gnas zhes bya ste /
translated: These four are called ‚Äúbases,‚Äù

original: de la gnas ni ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //üîΩde @223a * //üîΩla ji skad bstan pa'i kha na ma tho ba'i bya ba kun du spyod pa ni bdag gi zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi dbang du byas nas te /
analyzed: de la gnas ni ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o // de @223a * // la ji skad bstan pa'i kha na ma tho ba'i bya ba kun du spyod pa ni bdag gi zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi dbang du byas nas te /
translated: because shame and embarrassment are engaged on the basis of them.üîΩ‚ÄúIn regard to them‚Äù means in regard to the things that have been taught as faults. ‚ÄúOne does not do what should be done‚Äù means that one does not do what is proper. ‚ÄúOne does what should not be done‚Äù means that one does what is improper.üîΩ‚ÄúOne does not do what is in accord with one‚Äôs own nature‚Äù means that one does not do what is proper in regard to oneself.

original: bdag nyid la ltos nas 'di ni bdag dang mthun pa ma yin no zhes shes par byas nas so //
analyzed: bdag nyid la ltos nas 'di ni bdag dang mthun pa ma yin no zhes shes par byas nas so //
translated: ‚ÄúOne does what is not in accord with one‚Äôs own nature‚Äù means that one does what is improper in regard to oneself.

original: 'dzem pa ni sems rab tu bag tsha ba dang sems 'khums pas sems ldog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzem pa ni sems rab tu bag tsha ba dang sems 'khums pas sems ldog par byed pa'o //
translated: Shame is a shrinking of the mind, a contraction of the mind, a turning away from the thought of doing evil.

original: gzhan dag la zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten la ltos nas te /
analyzed: gzhan dag la zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten la ltos nas te /
translated: With regard to others means with regard to the world.

original: ji ltar ltos nas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar ltos nas she na /
translated: How is it with regard to the world?

original: 'jigs shing gus pas so //
analyzed: 'jigs shing gus pas so //
translated: It is with fear and respect.üîΩ Fear is shame with regard to the manifest and unmanifest, with regard to the virtuous and the nonvirtuous.

original: 'jigs pa ni mngon du gyur pa dang mngon du ma gyur kyang gus pa dang bcas pas ngo tsha ba dang / da byas kyis dogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jigs pa ni mngon du gyur pa dang mngon du ma gyur kyang gus pa dang bcas pas ngo tsha ba dang / da byas kyis dogs pa'o //
translated: Respect is shame with regard to the thought of doing evil.

original: de ltar na 'di gnyis ni ltos pa'i dbye bas thad dad kyi ngo bo la na thi dad pa med do //
analyzed: de ltar na 'di gnyis ni ltos pa'i dbye bas thad dad kyi ngo bo la na thi dad pa med do //
translated: Thus, these two are not different in nature, but are distinguished by their objects.üîΩBy nature means that the bodhisattva is naturally ashamed of doing evil, even before he has generated the thought of enlightenment.

original: rang bzhin nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni rigs kyi rtags kyi dus na yang shes che ba yin sems skyed pa rnams kyi ni shin tu yang che bar gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni rigs kyi rtags kyi dus na yang shes che ba yin sems skyed pa rnams kyi ni shin tu yang che bar gyur pa yin no //
translated: And when he has generated the thought of enlightenment, his shame becomes even greater.

original: de bzhi ni rang gi mtshan nyid dang / rang gi mtshan nyid kyi khyad par nyid kyis rang gi ngo bo bstan par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhi ni rang gi mtshan nyid dang / rang gi mtshan nyid kyi khyad par nyid kyis rang gi ngo bo bstan par byas pa yin no //
translated: Thus, these four are taught as the nature of shame, by their own characteristics and by the characteristics of their particularities.

original: re re yang dpag tu med pas mdor bsdu na gang smras pa byang chub sems dpa'i bya ba zhes bya ba ni bya ba la 'jug ba'i tshul khrims gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: re re yang dpag tu med pas mdor bsdu na gang smras pa byang chub sems dpa'i bya ba zhes bya ba ni bya ba la 'jug ba'i tshul khrims gang yin pa'o //
translated: Since each of these is also immeasurable, in brief, what is said is that the bodhisattva's activity is whatever morality is engaged in activity.

original: de la nan tan mi byed pa ni mi sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: de la nan tan mi byed pa ni mi sgrub pa'o //
translated: Not being intent on that is non-accomplishment.

original: des 'dzem pa gang yin pa de ni zhes bya ba ni ngo tsha ba'o //
analyzed: des 'dzem pa gang yin pa de ni zhes bya ba ni ngo tsha ba'o //
translated: That shame is whatever embarrassment there is in that.

original: bya ba ma yin pa ni ldog pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: bya ba ma yin pa ni ldog pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: What should not be done is the morality of restraint.

original: de la nan tan byed pa ni de dbye ba nyid dang dngos po'i gnas dang rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: de la nan tan byed pa ni de dbye ba nyid dang dngos po'i gnas dang rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: Being intent on that is twofold: just that division and the reality-realm.

original: nyams par 'gyur ba rnam pa gnyis bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: nyams par 'gyur ba rnam pa gnyis bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to show the two kinds of degeneration,

original: bdag nyid kyi sdig pa 'chab pa la zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims de dag la nyams su mi len pa dang nyams su len pa la chos bzhin du mi bsgrub pa la 'dzem pa dang / de las 'das pa gzhan la mi ston pa ste /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi sdig pa 'chab pa la zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims de dag la nyams su mi len pa dang nyams su len pa la chos bzhin du mi bsgrub pa la 'dzem pa dang / de las 'das pa gzhan la mi ston pa ste /
translated: concealing one's own sins is the embarrassment in not taking up those moralities and in not accomplishing them in accordance with the Dharma, and not teaching others what is beyond that.

original: bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du gzhan la mi ston pa de la khrel yod pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du gzhan la mi ston pa de la khrel yod pa'o //
translated: He has a sense of shame in that he does not show himself to others as he is not.

original: bdag nyid 'gyod pa skyes pa gzhan la ston du zin kyang rton pa dang bcas par bstan te /
analyzed: bdag nyid 'gyod pa skyes pa gzhan la ston du zin kyang rton pa dang bcas par bstan te /
translated: Even when he shows himself to others as having aroused remorse, he shows himself as having confidence.

original: bshags pa mi byed par yun ring du nyes pa dang bcas par 'jug pa ni gnas bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: bshags pa mi byed par yun ring du nyes pa dang bcas par 'jug pa ni gnas bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourth case is when he does not confess his sin for a long time, without confessing it.

original: de bzhin du nyes pa byung ba gzhan la ston pa dang / mthol nas bshags pa mi byed pa ni yang gnas gnyis zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du nyes pa byung ba gzhan la ston pa dang / mthol nas bshags pa mi byed pa ni yang gnas gnyis zhes brjod do //
translated: Similarly, the other two cases are when he shows his sin to others and when he does not confess it after showing it.

original: mi g-yo ba ni mi sprul pa nyid do //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba ni mi sprul pa nyid do //
translated: Immovability is non-dissimulation.

original: de'i brten pa nyid ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis zil gyis mi non pa nye bar bzung nas te /
analyzed: de'i brten pa nyid ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis zil gyis mi non pa nye bar bzung nas te /
translated: His steadfastness is taken as not being overcome by adverse elements.

original: mdor bsdus nas spyod pa dang / gnas pa gnyis @223b bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mdor bsdus nas spyod pa dang / gnas pa gnyis @223b bstan pa yin no //
translated: In brief, the two, practice and station, have been taught.

original: spyod par gtogs pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: spyod par gtogs pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Practice is threefold:

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa ma skyes ba mi bskyed pa nyid ni gang gi phyir smras pa nyon mongs pa can gyi sems yang dag par sdom pa dang zhes bya ba ni brtan pa dang brtan pa'i stobs bskyed pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa ma skyes ba mi bskyed pa nyid ni gang gi phyir smras pa nyon mongs pa can gyi sems yang dag par sdom pa dang zhes bya ba ni brtan pa dang brtan pa'i stobs bskyed pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The non-arising of the not yet arisen defilements is just what was said: ‚Äúthe restraint of the mind with defilements,‚Äù which is the generation of the power of stability.

original: thams cad kyi thams cad du kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi sems mi bskyed pa ni mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: thams cad kyi thams cad du kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi sems mi bskyed pa ni mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The non-arising of the mind with defilements in any way whatsoever is what is meant by ‚Äúimmovable.‚Äù

original: nyon mongs pa skyes pa rnams dang lhan cig mi gnas pa nyid ni gang yang smras pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa skyes pa rnams dang lhan cig mi gnas pa nyid ni gang yang smras pa /
translated: The not remaining together with the arisen defilements is just what was said:

original: nyon mongs pa'i dbang du mi 'gro ba dang zhes bya ba la ci zhig ltar skyes par gyur na yang de'i dbang gis mi gnas pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i dbang du mi 'gro ba dang zhes bya ba la ci zhig ltar skyes par gyur na yang de'i dbang gis mi gnas pa ste /
translated: ‚Äúnot going under the influence of the defilements.‚Äù No matter how they arise, one does not remain under their influence.

original: nyon mongs pa'i dbang du gyur nas gnas par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i dbang du gyur nas gnas par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one does not remain under the influence of the defilements.

original: dge ba'i phyogs la rab tu sbyor ba grang ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong bas mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i dang tshul can zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i phyogs la rab tu sbyor ba grang ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong bas mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i dang tshul can zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase not shaken by the experience of suffering, such as cold, etc., in the practice of virtue refers to the acceptance of suffering.üîΩThe phrase in the midst of a multitude of fields of suffering, which are the various kinds of fear and terror that arise in many ways when one is dwelling in solitude means that one does not become frightened and does not turn away from the practice even when experiencing the most intense suffering.üîΩThe phrase because of the multitude of fields of suffering means that one does not turn away from the practice even when experiencing the most intense suffering.üîΩThe phrase because of the multitude of fields of suffering means that one does not turn away from the practice even when experiencing the most intense suffering.üîΩThe phrase because of the multitude of fields of suffering means that one does not turn away from the practice even when experiencing the most intense suffering.

original: gnas su gtogs pa ni dben par gnas pa na 'jigs shing skrag pa rnam pa sna tshogs du ma sgo sna tshogs par 'jug par 'gyur ba'i zhing mang ba'i sdug bsngal thams cad kyi sgo nas shin tu drag pa myong bar gyur kyang 'jigs par mi 'gyur zhingüîΩsbyor ba las ldog par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: gnas su gtogs pa ni dben par gnas pa na 'jigs shing skrag pa rnam pa sna tshogs du ma sgo sna tshogs par 'jug par 'gyur ba'i zhing mang ba'i sdug bsngal thams cad kyi sgo nas shin tu drag pa myong bar gyur kyang 'jigs par mi 'gyur zhing sbyor ba las ldog par mi byed pa'o //
translated: The phrase because of the multitude of fields of suffering means that one does not turn away from the practice even when experiencing the most intense suffering.üîΩThe phrase because of the multitude of fields of suffering means that one does not turn away from the practice even when experiencing the most intense suffering.üîΩThe phrase because of the multitude of fields of suffering means that one does not turn away from the practice even when experiencing the most intense suffering.üîΩThe phrase because of the multitude of fields of suffering means that one does not turn away from the practice even when experiencing the most intense suffering.üîΩThe phrase because of the multitude of fields of suffering means that one does not turn away from the practice even when experiencing the most intense suffering.üîΩThe phrase because of the multitude of fields of suffering means that one does not turn away from the practice even when experiencing the most intense suffering.üîΩThe phrase because of the multitude of fields of suffering means that one does not turn away from the practice even when experiencing the most intense suffering.üîΩThe phrase because of the multitude of fields of suffering means that one does not turn away from the practice even when experiencing the most intense suffering.üîΩThe phrase because of the multitude of fields of suffering means that one does not turn away from the practice even when experiencing the most intense suffering.üîΩThe phrase because of the multitude of fields of suffering means that one does not turn away from the practice even when experiencing the most intense suffering.

original: brtan pa nyid kyi rgyu bstan pa ni /üîΩrang bzhin gyis snying stobs dang ldan pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /üîΩrang bzhin gyis snying stobs zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyi bsgoms pa'i stobs so //
analyzed: brtan pa nyid kyi rgyu bstan pa ni /üîΩrang bzhin gyis snying stobs dang ldan pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /üîΩrang bzhin gyis snying stobs zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyi bsgoms pa'i stobs so //
translated: The phrase

original: so sor brtags pa'i stobs bskyed pa ni 'dod chags dang ma bral ba rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: so sor brtags pa'i stobs bskyed pa ni 'dod chags dang ma bral ba rnams kyi'o //
translated: The power of discernment is for those who are not free from passion.

original: yang chos gsum shin tu lhag par 'jug cing 'byor par gyur pa ni snying stobs zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang chos gsum shin tu lhag par 'jug cing 'byor par gyur pa ni snying stobs zhes bya ste /
translated: Again, the predominance of three dharmas is called courage,

original: 'di lta ste shes rab dang / snying rje dang / brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: 'di lta ste shes rab dang / snying rje dang / brtson 'grus so //
translated: namely, wisdom, compassion, and effort.

original: de dag nyid chen por gyur pa thob par gyur pa ni rang bzhin gyis snying stobs dang ldan pa ste brtan pa nyid do //
analyzed: de dag nyid chen por gyur pa thob par gyur pa ni rang bzhin gyis snying stobs dang ldan pa ste brtan pa nyid do //
translated: When they attain the state of greatness, they are naturally courageous, i.e., firm.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs dang zhes bya ba ni skye ba la sogs pa'i sgo nas 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs dang zhes bya ba ni skye ba la sogs pa'i sgo nas 'jug pa ste /
translated: The phrase in various ways means that they engage in the practice through birth, etc.

original: de lta bu'i bdag nyid kyi 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gyis gnod par gyur kyang sgrub par byed pa las mi g-yo ba'o zhes bya bas sdug bsngal dang phrad pa ni gnas dang po'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i bdag nyid kyi 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gyis gnod par gyur kyang sgrub par byed pa las mi g-yo ba'o zhes bya bas sdug bsngal dang phrad pa ni gnas dang po'o //
translated: Even though they are harmed by the suffering of cyclic existence, which is of that nature, they do not waver from their practice.  The first stage is the encounter with suffering.

original: sems can rnams kyi log par sgrub pa ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi log par sgrub pa ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second is the wrong practice of sentient beings.

original: sems can gyi don du 'khor bar gnas par bdag nyid kyis khas len pa ni gsum pa'o //üîΩpha rol gyi rgol ba dag gis rang gi phyogs rnam par gzhag pa'i sgo nas @224a * //
analyzed: sems can gyi don du 'khor bar gnas par bdag nyid kyis khas len pa ni gsum pa'o // pha rol gyi rgol ba dag gis rang gi phyogs rnam par gzhag pa'i sgo nas @224a * //
translated: The third is the commitment to remain in cyclic existence for the sake of sentient beings.

original: de rgyal bar gyur pas bdag gi phyogs sun phyung bas mthar thug par byas kyang chos ston pa la yang lus dang sems kyi 'gyur pa mi bskyed cing brtan pa nyid ni bzhi ba'o //
analyzed: de rgyal bar gyur pas bdag gi phyogs sun phyung bas mthar thug par byas kyang chos ston pa la yang lus dang sems kyi 'gyur pa mi bskyed cing brtan pa nyid ni bzhi ba'o //
translated: The fourth is firmness: even if one's position is refuted by opponents who have set forth their own positions, one does not generate physical or mental change, but remains firm in teaching the Dharma.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa thams cad khas blangs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i mthu dang / de kho na'i don gyi dbang du byas nas chos zab mo thos pa ni lnga pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa thams cad khas blangs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i mthu dang / de kho na'i don gyi dbang du byas nas chos zab mo thos pa ni lnga pa'o //
translated: The fifth is the inconceivable: having accepted all the bodhisattva trainings, and having heard the profound Dharma from the perspective of the power of the bodhisattva and the meaning of reality.

original: de ltar na sdug bsngal nyams su myong ba dang / sems can gyi log par sgrub pa dang / 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal khas blangs pa dang / pha rol gyi rgol bas brtsad kyang 'khor gyi nang du chos ston pa dang byang chub sems dpa'i sgrub pa'i chos dang /
analyzed: de ltar na sdug bsngal nyams su myong ba dang / sems can gyi log par sgrub pa dang / 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal khas blangs pa dang / pha rol gyi rgol bas brtsad kyang 'khor gyi nang du chos ston pa dang byang chub sems dpa'i sgrub pa'i chos dang /
translated: He teaches the Dharma in the midst of the assembly, and he practices the Dharma of the bodhisattva.

original: lung gi chos kyi dbang du byas nas gnas rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: lung gi chos kyi dbang du byas nas gnas rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: He is not discouraged by the Dharma, either that of scripture or that of meditative realization.

original: yid yongs su mi skyo pa nyid ni lus kyi dal du ba dang sems skyo ba med pa la brten pa dang / sbyor ba brtsams pa la brtan nas ldog par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: yid yongs su mi skyo pa nyid ni lus kyi dal du ba dang sems skyo ba med pa la brten pa dang / sbyor ba brtsams pa la brtan nas ldog par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: He is not discouraged in his mind, because he is not discouraged in body or mind, and because he does not turn back from the task he has begun.

original: rgyu rnam pa lnga ni rten gyi khyad par dang / sbyor ba'i khyad par dang / bsam pa'i khyad par gyi dbang du byas nas rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu rnam pa lnga ni rten gyi khyad par dang / sbyor ba'i khyad par dang / bsam pa'i khyad par gyi dbang du byas nas rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: The five causes are established on the basis of the distinction of the support, the distinction of application, and the distinction of intention.

original: rten gyi khyad par ni lus stobs dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: rten gyi khyad par ni lus stobs dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The distinction of the support is the strong body.

original: gang gi phyir smras pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir smras pa /
translated: For this reason it is said:

original: rang bzhin gyis stobs dang ldan pa yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stobs dang ldan pa yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is naturally strong.

original: des na lus nyam chung ba'o zhes bya ba nas phyir mi ldog pa'o zhes bya bar ro //
analyzed: des na lus nyam chung ba'o zhes bya ba nas phyir mi ldog pa'o zhes bya bar ro //
translated: Therefore, it is not weak in body, and so on up to: it is irreversible.

original: sbyor ba'i dbye pa la yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i dbye pa la yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The classification of application is also threefold:

original: goms pa'i sbyor pa ste /
analyzed: goms pa'i sbyor pa ste /
translated: application through habituation,

original: rigs pa'i sbyor ba dang / so sor brtags pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: rigs pa'i sbyor ba dang / so sor brtags pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: application through reasoning, and application through investigation.

original: dang po'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: dang po'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: With reference to the first, it is said:

original: yang dang yang du goms par byas pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang dang yang du goms par byas pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Habituation through repeated practice.

original: dus ring por goms par byas pa de'i rang bzhin du gyur pas de la chags shing gnas skabs de las mi ldog pa'o //
analyzed: dus ring por goms par byas pa de'i rang bzhin du gyur pas de la chags shing gnas skabs de las mi ldog pa'o //
translated: Habituation for a long time, becoming habituated to that nature, one becomes attached to it and does not turn away from that situation.

original: rigs pa'i sbyor ba'i bye brag yang dag par mthong bas kyang ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rigs pa'i sbyor ba'i bye brag yang dag par mthong bas kyang ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One does not turn away through the specific application of reasoning, through seeing reality.

original: brtags shing brtags shing yang brtsams pa las ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brtags shing brtags shing yang brtsams pa las ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One does not turn away from repeated practice through investigation.

original: bsam pa ni sems can rnams la snying rje'i sems te /
analyzed: bsam pa ni sems can rnams la snying rje'i sems te /
translated: The intention is a compassionate attitude toward sentient beings.

original: snying rje'i stobs kyis nye bar gzung bas sems can gyi don las ldog par mi 'gyur pas snying rje can ni skyo bar mi 'gyur ro zhes byas nas so //
analyzed: snying rje'i stobs kyis nye bar gzung bas sems can gyi don las ldog par mi 'gyur pas snying rje can ni skyo bar mi 'gyur ro zhes byas nas so //
translated: The compassionate one does not become weary, because he does not turn away from the welfare of sentient beings, since he is sustained by the power of compassion.

original: mdor bsdu na bstan bcos shes pa ni yi ge la mkhas pa dang don la mkhas pa'i dbang du byas nas bstan bcos shes pa rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: mdor bsdu na bstan bcos shes pa ni yi ge la mkhas pa dang don la mkhas pa'i dbang du byas nas bstan bcos shes pa rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
translated: In brief, knowledge of the treatises should be presented as mastery of the letters and mastery of the meaning.

original: yi ge la mkhas pa ni gzhan dag las phyir @224b ci ma log pa'i yi ge thos pa nyid de /
analyzed: yi ge la mkhas pa ni gzhan dag las phyir @224b ci ma log pa'i yi ge thos pa nyid de /
translated: Mastery of the letters is hearing the letters from others without error.

original: gang gi phyir smras pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir smras pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: gzhan las legs par gzung ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhan las legs par gzung ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: Having well received from others.

original: thos pa legs par gzung bas na gang gi phyir smras pa /
analyzed: thos pa legs par gzung bas na gang gi phyir smras pa /
translated: Since one well receives what is heard, it is said:

original: kha don legs par byang ba yin //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: kha don legs par byang ba yin // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: One is well trained in recitation.

original: shes rab rnam pa gsum thob pa ni don la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab rnam pa gsum thob pa ni don la mkhas pa'o //
translated: Attaining the three kinds of wisdom is mastery of the meaning.

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i don thos pa las byung ba ste /
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i don thos pa las byung ba ste /
translated: It arises from hearing the unmistaken meaning.

original: gang gi phyir smras pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir smras pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: legs par thos pa yin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: legs par thos pa yin zhes bya'o //
translated: One has well heard.

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i don rigs pa dang ldan pas legs par bsams shing legs par brtags pa ni bsams pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i don rigs pa dang ldan pas legs par bsams shing legs par brtags pa ni bsams pa las byung ba'o //
translated: The wisdom that arises from reflection is the wisdom that arises from the proper reflection and proper investigation of the meaning of the scriptures with reasoning that is not erroneous.

original: ming dang tshig thos pa 'dzin pa nyid ni chos shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ming dang tshig thos pa 'dzin pa nyid ni chos shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The wisdom that arises from hearing is the wisdom that arises from the retention of the names and phrases of the scriptures.üîΩThe wisdom that arises from contemplation is the wisdom that arises from the contemplation of the meaning of the scriptures.üîΩThe wisdom that arises from cultivation is the wisdom that arises from the practice of meditation.üîΩThe wisdom that arises from the result is the wisdom that arises from the attainment of the result of the practice of meditation.üîΩThe wisdom that arises from the cause is the wisdom that arises from the cause of the wisdom that arises from the result.

original: don thos pa dang sems pa ni don shes pa zhes bya ste thos pa gsal bar bya ba'i phyir dang / ma thob pa thob par bya ba'i phyir bsam pa'i sbyor ba dor bar mi 'gyur ro //üîΩde'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: don thos pa dang sems pa ni don shes pa zhes bya ste thos pa gsal bar bya ba'i phyir dang / ma thob pa thob par bya ba'i phyir bsam pa'i sbyor ba dor bar mi 'gyur ro // de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: The wisdom that arises from the condition is the wisdom that arises from the condition of the wisdom that arises from the cause.üîΩThe wisdom that arises from the application is the wisdom that arises from the application of the wisdom that arises from the condition.

original: gong nas gong du shes par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la de ltar na thos pa dang / bsam pa'i shes rab mthar thug par 'gyur ro //üîΩde'i phyir smras pa /üîΩthos pa dang bsam pa'i mthar thug pa zhes bya ba'o //üîΩyongs su smin pa ni bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab thob pa'o //
analyzed: gong nas gong du shes par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la de ltar na thos pa dang / bsam pa'i shes rab mthar thug par 'gyur ro // de'i phyir smras pa / thos pa dang bsam pa'i mthar thug pa zhes bya ba'o // yongs su smin pa ni bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab thob pa'o //
translated: The wisdom that arises from the result is the wisdom that arises from the result of the application of the wisdom that arises from the application.üîΩThe wisdom that arises from the cause is the wisdom that arises from the cause of the wisdom that arises from the result.üîΩThe wisdom that arises from the condition is the wisdom that arises from the condition of the wisdom that arises from the cause.üîΩThe wisdom that arises from the application is the wisdom that arises from the application of the wisdom that arises from the condition.

original: dang pa thob pa ni lhag par mos pa ste /
analyzed: dang pa thob pa ni lhag par mos pa ste /
translated: The wisdom that arises from the result is the wisdom that arises from the result of the application of the wisdom that arises from the application.

original: chos dang don mngon par rtogs pa'i rjes su zhugs pa'i phyir dang / phas kyi rgol ba thams cad kyis mi bzlogs pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: chos dang don mngon par rtogs pa'i rjes su zhugs pa'i phyir dang / phas kyi rgol ba thams cad kyis mi bzlogs pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because it is in conformity with the realization of the teaching and its meaning, and because it cannot be refuted by any adversary.

original: / tshad med pa ni rig pa'i gnas lnga'i rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / tshad med pa ni rig pa'i gnas lnga'i rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is immeasurable because it is applied to the five branches of learning.

original: yongs su rdzogs pa ni chos dang don thos pa dang bsam pa mi 'dor ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa ni chos dang don thos pa dang bsam pa mi 'dor ba'o //
translated: It is complete because it does not abandon the study and reflection on the teaching and its meaning.

original: phyir ci ma log pa nyid ni yongs su smin pa'o //üîΩmdor bsdu na sems can dang / snod kyi 'jig rten yongs su shes pa ni 'jig rten gyi rjes su 'jug pas na 'jig rten shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: phyir ci ma log pa nyid ni yongs su smin pa'o // mdor bsdu na sems can dang / snod kyi 'jig rten yongs su shes pa ni 'jig rten gyi rjes su 'jug pas na 'jig rten shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: It is irreversible because it is mature.üîΩIn brief, the knowledge of the world is so called because it is applied to the knowledge of sentient beings and the receptacle world.üîΩIt is the knowledge of the world because it is applied to the knowledge of sentient beings and the receptacle world through four aspects.

original: rnam pa bzhis sems can dang / snod kyi 'jig rten yongs su rig par 'gyur ba ni sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten 'jug pa nyid dang / rnam pa brgyad kyis 'jig rten rnam par brtag pa'i don nyid dang / 'jig rten gyi don dam pa nyid dang /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhis sems can dang / snod kyi 'jig rten yongs su rig par 'gyur ba ni sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten 'jug pa nyid dang / rnam pa brgyad kyis 'jig rten rnam par brtag pa'i don nyid dang / 'jig rten gyi don dam pa nyid dang /
translated: It is the knowledge of the world because it is applied to the knowledge of the world through eight aspects.

original: de sems can gyi 'jig rten de la snying rje'i mig gis rnam par bltas pa nyam nga bar zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: de sems can gyi 'jig rten de la snying rje'i mig gis rnam par bltas pa nyam nga bar zhugs pa ste /
translated: He looks with the eye of compassion at that world of sentient beings, and sees that they are in a state of distress.

original: nyam nga ba'i gnas skabs thob pa mgon med pa dus ring por 'khor pa'i sdug bsngal la rjes su zhugs par mthong nas ston par byed de /
analyzed: nyam nga ba'i gnas skabs thob pa mgon med pa dus ring por 'khor pa'i sdug bsngal la rjes su zhugs par mthong nas ston par byed de /
translated: Having seen that they have attained a state of distress, that they are helpless, that they have been wandering for a long time, and that they are engaged in suffering, he teaches them.

original: nyam nga ba zhes bya ba ni bstan ba'i tshig go //üîΩskye yang skye zhes bya ba ni ngan 'gro thob bas bcos @225a * //
analyzed: nyam nga ba zhes bya ba ni bstan ba'i tshig go // skye yang skye zhes bya ba ni ngan 'gro thob bas bcos @225a * //
translated: The word distress is a term for teaching.

original: su med pa'i 'gro ba thob par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: su med pa'i 'gro ba thob par bstan pa'o //
translated: The phrase born, they are born indicates that they have attained a state of existence that is incurable by the attainment of a bad destiny.

original: rga yang rga zhes bya ba ni yid du 'od ba'i lang tsho las yongs su nyams par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rga yang rga zhes bya ba ni yid du 'od ba'i lang tsho las yongs su nyams par bstan pa'o //
translated: The phrase aged, they are aged indicates that they have attained a state of existence that is incurable by the attainment of a bad destiny.

original: 'chi yang 'chi zhes bya ba ni 'tsho ba nyams par 'gyur pa'o //üîΩde ltar 'dod pa'i khams kyi dbang du byas nas bstan nas gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: 'chi yang 'chi zhes bya ba ni 'tsho ba nyams par 'gyur pa'o // de ltar 'dod pa'i khams kyi dbang du byas nas bstan nas gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: The phrase dying, they are dying indicates that they have attained a state of existence that is incurable by the attainment of a bad destiny.

original: 'chi 'pho yang 'chi 'pho /
analyzed: 'chi 'pho yang 'chi 'pho /
translated: Having taught in this way with reference to the desire realm, he then says with reference to the form and formless realms, They die and transmigrate, die and transmigrate.

original: skye yang skye mod kyi zhes bya ba la /üîΩma thob ba mi thob pa dang / thob pa brtan pa med pa ni nyam nga bar zhugs pa thob par bstan to //
analyzed: skye yang skye mod kyi zhes bya ba la / ma thob ba mi thob pa dang / thob pa brtan pa med pa ni nyam nga bar zhugs pa thob par bstan to //
translated: Even if one is born, one is born meansüîΩthat one does not obtain what has not been obtained, and that one does not stabilize what has been obtained. This shows that one enters into a state of fear.

original: mgon med pa dang skyabs med par bstan pa ni nges par 'byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mgon med pa dang skyabs med par bstan pa ni nges par 'byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes so zhes bya ba la /
translated: The statement one is without a protector and without a refuge means that one does not know how to correctly go forth.

original: de ltar na rang gis grol bar bya ba ni nus pa ma yin no zhes bya bas mgon med pa dang / skyabs med pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rang gis grol bar bya ba ni nus pa ma yin no zhes bya bas mgon med pa dang / skyabs med pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the statement one is not able to liberate oneself shows that one is without a protector and without a refuge.

original: yang 'jig rten gyi 'byor pa dang / phongs pa rnams kyang shes so zhes bya bar smras pa /
analyzed: yang 'jig rten gyi 'byor pa dang / phongs pa rnams kyang shes so zhes bya bar smras pa /
translated: Moreover, it was said that one also knows the prosperity and decline of the world.

original: sems can gyi 'jig rten zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bkus te bor pa lta bur gyur pas na snyigs ma zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sems can gyi 'jig rten zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bkus te bor pa lta bur gyur pas na snyigs ma zhes bya ste /
translated: The impurity of the world of sentient beings, etc., is called impurity because it is as if it were cast down in contempt.

original: shin tu smad par bya'o //
analyzed: shin tu smad par bya'o //
translated: It is to be greatly despised.

original: tshe'i snyigs ma ni tshe thung ba nyid do //
analyzed: tshe'i snyigs ma ni tshe thung ba nyid do //
translated: The impurity of life is the shortness of life.

original: sems can gyi snyigs ma ni yang dag pa'i sgrub pa las nyams pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi snyigs ma ni yang dag pa'i sgrub pa las nyams pa'o //
translated: The degeneration of sentient beings is the decline of correct practice.

original: nyon mongs pa ni bzad pa'i dbang gis nyes par spyod pa zhes bya ba'o /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni bzad pa'i dbang gis nyes par spyod pa zhes bya ba'o /
translated: The degeneration of afflictions is the performance of evil deeds due to the power of afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa'i snyigs ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i snyigs ma zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the degeneration of afflictions.

original: phyin ci log gi chos don du nges par 'dzin pa ni lta ba'i snyigs ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log gi chos don du nges par 'dzin pa ni lta ba'i snyigs ma zhes bya'o //
translated: The degeneration of views is the grasping of false doctrines as definitive.

original: bar gyi bskal pa dang nye ba'i chos la kun du spyod pa ni bskal pa'i snyigs ma'o //
analyzed: bar gyi bskal pa dang nye ba'i chos la kun du spyod pa ni bskal pa'i snyigs ma'o //
translated: The degeneration of eons is the practice of the true Dharma during the intermediate eons.

original: tshe'i snyigs ma'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: tshe'i snyigs ma'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: Considering the degeneration of lifespan, it is said:

original: 'tsho ba yun thung ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa la //
analyzed: 'tsho ba yun thung ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa la //
translated: Life is short.

original: mi rnams ni zhes bya ba ni 'dzam bu'i gling pa rnams te //
analyzed: mi rnams ni zhes bya ba ni 'dzam bu'i gling pa rnams te //
translated: Humans refers to those of Jambudvƒ´pa.

original: gzhan dag gi tshe ni nges par gnas pa nyid yin pas so//
analyzed: gzhan dag gi tshe ni nges par gnas pa nyid yin pas so//
translated: Because the lifespans of others are fixed.

original: bla ma dang / bla ma'i gnas lta bu dag la rim gro med pa dang / rang gi las kyi mtha' la bsod nams kyi las kyi bya ba la nan tan mi byed pa ni sems can gyi snyigs ma zhes brjod do //
analyzed: bla ma dang / bla ma'i gnas lta bu dag la rim gro med pa dang / rang gi las kyi mtha' la bsod nams kyi las kyi bya ba la nan tan mi byed pa ni sems can gyi snyigs ma zhes brjod do //
translated: The absence of respect for the guru and those worthy of honor, and the absence of effort in meritorious action, are called the degeneration of sentient beings.

original: tsheg 'di dag gi don ni sngar bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: tsheg 'di dag gi don ni sngar bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of these terms has been explained above.

original: da ltar gyi mi phal cher ni chos ma yin pa la 'dod chags pa dang / mi mthun pa la chags pas mngon par zil gyis mnan pa dang log pa'i chos su gtogs pa zhes bya ba'i mdo'i tshig ni dum bu gnyis su byas te gnyis dang gcig gis te nyon mongs pa'i snyigs ma dang lta ba'i snyigs ma smras pa /
analyzed: da ltar gyi mi phal cher ni chos ma yin pa la 'dod chags pa dang / mi mthun pa la chags pas mngon par zil gyis mnan pa dang log pa'i chos su gtogs pa zhes bya ba'i mdo'i tshig ni dum bu gnyis su byas te gnyis dang gcig gis te nyon mongs pa'i snyigs ma dang lta ba'i snyigs ma smras pa /
translated: The present-day people are mostly attached to what is contrary to Dharma and to what is not Dharma, and are overcome by what is contrary to Dharma. The words of the sutra called the Discourse on the Degeneration of the Counterfeit Dharma are divided into two parts, and two and one of them are said to be the degeneration of afflictions and the degeneration of views.

original: de la chos ma yin pa la 'dod chags pa ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa'i yul gyi @225b longs spyod dang / 'dod pa la log par spyod pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de la chos ma yin pa la 'dod chags pa ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa'i yul gyi @225b longs spyod dang / 'dod pa la log par spyod pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Therein, attachment to what is contrary to Dharma is the enjoyment of the objects of improper mental attention, and the possession of perverted conduct.

original: mi mthun pa la chags pa ni chos ma yin pas longs spyod tshol ba ste //
analyzed: mi mthun pa la chags pa ni chos ma yin pas longs spyod tshol ba ste //
translated: Attachment to what is contrary is the pursuit of enjoyments that are not Dharma.

original: chom rkun la sogs pa'i las kyis gzhan gyi nor len pa'o //
analyzed: chom rkun la sogs pa'i las kyis gzhan gyi nor len pa'o //
translated: It is taking the wealth of others through the actions of thieves and so on.

original: des kun nas blang ba'i lus la sogs pa'i nyes par spyod pa bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: des kun nas blang ba'i lus la sogs pa'i nyes par spyod pa bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to demonstrate the misdeeds of the body and so on that are motivated by that,

original: mtshon cha thogs pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mtshon cha thogs pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: he says ‚Äútaking up weapons‚Äù and so on.

original: dge ba ma yin pa'i sdig pa can gyi chos kun du spyod pa ni /
analyzed: dge ba ma yin pa'i sdig pa can gyi chos kun du spyod pa ni /
translated: The practice of non-virtuous, sinful qualities

original: nyon mongs pa'i snyigs ma zhes bstan to //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i snyigs ma zhes bstan to //
translated: is taught to be the dregs of the afflictions.

original: dam pa'i chos 'jig par 'gyur ba ni dam pa'i chos yongs su nyams shing nub pas lhag ma ma lus par nub par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos 'jig par 'gyur ba ni dam pa'i chos yongs su nyams shing nub pas lhag ma ma lus par nub par gyur pa'o //
translated: The destruction of the true Dharma is the complete disappearance of the remainder of the true Dharma through its degeneration and decline.

original: chos ltar bcos pa zhes bya ba ni de'i gzugs brnyan ltar snang ba ste /
analyzed: chos ltar bcos pa zhes bya ba ni de'i gzugs brnyan ltar snang ba ste /
translated: A counterfeit of the Dharma is a semblance of it, like a reflection of it.

original: de dang 'dra ba zhes bya tha tshig ste //
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba zhes bya tha tshig ste //
translated: It is called ‚Äúsimilar to that.‚Äù

original: 'di lta ste gzhi bsdu ba las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di lta ste gzhi bsdu ba las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: This is as taught in the Compendium of Bases.

original: phyin ci log gi lta ba sngon du 'gro ba'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: phyin ci log gi lta ba sngon du 'gro ba'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: The words preceded by a false view are stated to indicate that.

original: log pa'i chos ki don spyod pa sngon du 'gro ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: log pa'i chos ki don spyod pa sngon du 'gro ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The words preceded by the practice of false doctrines are stated to indicate that.

original: bar gyi bskal ba dag nye bar gyur te zhes bya ba ni shin tu drag pa'i mu ge zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bar gyi bskal ba dag nye bar gyur te zhes bya ba ni shin tu drag pa'i mu ge zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The words when the intermediate eon has arrived mean when the famine has become very severe.

original: phal cher snang do zhes pa ni bar skabs par skabs su 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: phal cher snang do zhes pa ni bar skabs par skabs su 'byung ba'o //
translated: The words for the most part mean from time to time.

original: 'jig pa ni nyams par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig pa ni nyams par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The words destruction and disappearance mean destruction and disappearance.

original: 'chags pa ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'chags pa ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The words creation and appearance mean creation and appearance.üîΩThe words having been created mean having been created and having endured for such a long time.

original: chags pa yang chags nas 'di snyed cig tu gnas so //üîΩbya ba yang shes so //üîΩ'chags pa yang dag pa ji lta pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ni de bzhin du 'jig pa yang shes par bya ba yin pas me dang chu dang rlung gis zhes bya bar shes pa ste /
analyzed: chags pa yang chags nas 'di snyed cig tu gnas so // bya ba yang shes so // 'chags pa yang dag pa ji lta pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ni de bzhin du 'jig pa yang shes par bya ba yin pas me dang chu dang rlung gis zhes bya bar shes pa ste /
translated: The words having been destroyed mean having been destroyed and having remained empty for such a long time.üîΩThe words having been emptied mean having been emptied and having remained empty for such a long time.üîΩThe words having been created mean having been created and having endured for such a long time.üîΩThe words having been destroyed mean having been destroyed and having remained empty for such a long time.üîΩThe words having been emptied mean having been emptied and having remained empty for such a long time.üîΩThe words having been created mean having been created and having endured for such a long time.

original: de'i rim gyis 'jig par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar rab tu shes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rim gyis 'jig par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar rab tu shes pa'o //
translated: The words having been destroyed mean having been destroyed and having remained empty for such a long time.üîΩThe words having been emptied mean having been emptied and having remained empty for such a long time.

original: 'jig rten ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'o //
translated: The world is the five aggregates of clinging.

original: kun 'byung ba ni sreg pa'o //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba ni sreg pa'o //
translated: The origin is burning.

original: 'gog pa ni mya ngan las 'dag pa'o //üîΩkun 'byung bar 'gyur ba ni chags pa'i dga' ba'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa ni mya ngan las 'dag pa'o // kun 'byung bar 'gyur ba ni chags pa'i dga' ba'o //
translated: Cessation is nirvana.

original: 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'o //
translated: The path is the noble eightfold path.

original: ro myang ba ni gang 'jig rten la rab tu grags pa'i bde ba dang yid bde bar tshor ba'o //
analyzed: ro myang ba ni gang 'jig rten la rab tu grags pa'i bde ba dang yid bde bar tshor ba'o //
translated: Savor is the feeling of pleasure and mental pleasure that is well known in the world.

original: de la mi rtag pa la sogs pa nyid ni nyes dmigs so /
analyzed: de la mi rtag pa la sogs pa nyid ni nyes dmigs so /
translated: The disadvantages are impermanence and so on.

original: 'dun pa'i 'dod chags spangs ba ni nges par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'dun pa'i 'dod chags spangs ba ni nges par 'byung ba'o //
translated: The escape is the abandonment of attachment and desire.

original: mi nyid kyi mdo'i rjes su 'brangs nas don dam pa bstan te /
analyzed: mi nyid kyi mdo'i rjes su 'brangs nas don dam pa bstan te /
translated: The ultimate is taught following the S≈´tra on Human Life.

original: de las bstan pa ni mig dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam bar shes pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las bstan pa ni mig dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam bar shes pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It says: The eye consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and form.

original: gsum 'dus par gyur pa las ni reg pa'o //
analyzed: gsum 'dus par gyur pa las ni reg pa'o //
translated: From the assembly of three arises contact.

original: reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang 'du shes dang sems @226a * //
analyzed: reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang 'du shes dang sems @226a * //
translated: From contact arises feeling, discrimination, intention, and so on.

original: pa'i bar du 'byung ngo //
analyzed: pa'i bar du 'byung ngo //
translated: up to the arising of the mind.üîΩIn the same way, based on the mental faculty and mental objects, the mind arises.

original: de bzhin du yid dang chos la brten nas sems pa'i bar du ste zhes bya ba la gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po bzhi dang 'byung ba chen po bzhi las gyur pa gzugs kyi phung po 'di dag la mi nyid ces bya'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yid dang chos la brten nas sems pa'i bar du ste zhes bya ba la gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po bzhi dang 'byung ba chen po bzhi las gyur pa gzugs kyi phung po 'di dag la mi nyid ces bya'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The four non-material aggregates and the material aggregate, which is derived from the four great elements, are called human.

original: de la bdag gam sems can zhes bya ba'i 'du shes gang yin pa de ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de la bdag gam sems can zhes bya ba'i 'du shes gang yin pa de ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba yin no //
translated: The notion of self or sentient being in that is...

original: de la gang bdag gis ni mig gis gzugs rnams mthong ngo zhes dam 'cha' ba gang yin pa de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de la gang bdag gis ni mig gis gzugs rnams mthong ngo zhes dam 'cha' ba gang yin pa de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par gsungs pa yin no //
translated: In that, whatever is the vow that I see forms with the eye, that is... and so on in detail.

original: de la tha snyad gang yin pa 'di ni zhes bya ba ni ming 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas bar 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de la tha snyad gang yin pa 'di ni zhes bya ba ni ming 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas bar 'byung ba'o //
translated: In that, whatever is this conventional expression... that is... and so on in detail.

original: de ltar 'di dag ni 'du shes tsam dang dam bcas pa tsam dang / tha snyad tsam ste chos 'di dag thams cad ni mi rtag pa sems las byung ba rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'di dag ni 'du shes tsam dang dam bcas pa tsam dang / tha snyad tsam ste chos 'di dag thams cad ni mi rtag pa sems las byung ba rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, these are mere ideas, mere conventions, mere designations. All these phenomena are called impermanent, arisen from the mind, and dependently originated.

original: sems can gyi 'jig rten gyi 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa'i sdug bsngal dang ldan pa nyid do //
analyzed: sems can gyi 'jig rten gyi 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa'i sdug bsngal dang ldan pa nyid do //
translated: The engagement of the world of sentient beings is said to be associated with the suffering of engagement.

original: snod kyi 'jig rten gyi 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni 'chags pa dang 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: snod kyi 'jig rten gyi 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni 'chags pa dang 'jig pa'o //
translated: The engagement of the world of the environment is said to be creation and destruction.

original: nye bar brtags pa'i don rnam pa brgyad ni nye bar len pa'i phung po rtog pa dang / nye bar len pa'i tha snyad la brten pa dang / 'jig rten rnam par gzhag pa dang / 'jig rten gyi don dam pa nyid dang / ji ltar 'jig rten gyi shes pa de bzhin du de'i dbang du byas nas 'jig rten shes pa ston par byed do //
analyzed: nye bar brtags pa'i don rnam pa brgyad ni nye bar len pa'i phung po rtog pa dang / nye bar len pa'i tha snyad la brten pa dang / 'jig rten rnam par gzhag pa dang / 'jig rten gyi don dam pa nyid dang / ji ltar 'jig rten gyi shes pa de bzhin du de'i dbang du byas nas 'jig rten shes pa ston par byed do //
translated: The eight topics of investigation are the investigation of the appropriated aggregates, the basis of the convention of appropriation, the establishment of the world, the ultimate of the world, the knowledge of the world just as it is, and the teaching of the knowledge of the world based on that.

original: yang ji ltar 'jig pa dang 'jug pa'i dbang du byas nas 'jig rten shes pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: yang ji ltar 'jig pa dang 'jug pa'i dbang du byas nas 'jig rten shes pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is the knowledge of the world in terms of the creation and destruction of the world.

original: sems can gyi dbye ba rnam pa bcu gcig la ci nus ci rigs kyis de lta de ltar yang dag par bsgrub pa dang / bdag nyid la yang dag par bsgrub pa ni 'jig rten shes pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi dbye ba rnam pa bcu gcig la ci nus ci rigs kyis de lta de ltar yang dag par bsgrub pa dang / bdag nyid la yang dag par bsgrub pa ni 'jig rten shes pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The knowledge of the world is the correct practice of the eleven divisions of sentient beings, according to their capacity and their nature, and the correct practice with regard to oneself.

original: dbye ba'i rnam pa bcu gcig gang dag ce na /üîΩkhyad par du 'phags pa dang / mtshungs pa dang / dman pa dang / dman pa'i 'dod pa dang ldan pa dang / mtshungs pa dang / khyad par can thams cad 'dod pa dang ldan pa dang / dgra dang gnyen dang bar ma rnams rgud par gyur pa dang /
analyzed: dbye ba'i rnam pa bcu gcig gang dag ce na / khyad par du 'phags pa dang / mtshungs pa dang / dman pa dang / dman pa'i 'dod pa dang ldan pa dang / mtshungs pa dang / khyad par can thams cad 'dod pa dang ldan pa dang / dgra dang gnyen dang bar ma rnams rgud par gyur pa dang /
translated: What are the eleven divisions?üîΩThe superior, the equal, the inferior, the inferior who has the desire, the equal who has the desire, the superior who has the desire, the enemy, the friend, the neutral, the helpless, and the other sentient beings.

original: mgon med pa dang ; sems can gzhan dang / grogs rnams dang / gnod pa byed pa byed pa rnams so //
analyzed: mgon med pa dang ; sems can gzhan dang / grogs rnams dang / gnod pa byed pa byed pa rnams so //
translated: The friend is the one who is helpful. The neutral is the one who is neither helpful nor harmful. The helpless is the one who is not able to help. The other sentient beings are those who are not friends, enemies, or neutrals.

original: mdor bsdu na khyad par rnam pa gnyis kyis khyad par du 'phags pa'i 'jig rten shes pa zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mdor bsdu na khyad par rnam pa gnyis kyis khyad par du 'phags pa'i 'jig rten shes pa zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: In brief, it is taught that the knowledge of the world is superior by two kinds of distinctions.

original: na tshod khyad par du 'phags pa ni ches rgan pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: na tshod khyad par du 'phags pa ni ches rgan pa zhes pa'o //
translated: Superiority of age is referred to by the words ‚Äúthe very aged.‚Äù

original: yon tan khyad par du 'phags pa ni ches @226b yon tan gyis khyad par du 'phags pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan khyad par du 'phags pa ni ches @226b yon tan gyis khyad par du 'phags pa'o //
translated: Superiority of virtue is referred to by the words ‚Äúthe very virtuous.‚Äù

original: ngag gi las dang / lus kyi las dag las ngag gi las kyi dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: ngag gi las dang / lus kyi las dag las ngag gi las kyi dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: Of the verbal and bodily actions, the verbal action is mentioned first.

original: legs par kun du smra bar byed //üîΩces bya ba ste /
analyzed: legs par kun du smra bar byed // ces bya ba ste /
translated: He speaks well and is well-spoken to.

original: de dag 'tsham pa'i tshig smra bas nye bar sgrub par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dag 'tsham pa'i tshig smra bas nye bar sgrub par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: He is well-spoken to because he speaks words that are appropriate.

original: lus kyi las rnam pa gnyis te sbyin pa dang / bstod pa'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: lus kyi las rnam pa gnyis te sbyin pa dang / bstod pa'i dbye bas so //
translated: The bodily action is of two kinds: giving and praising.

original: sbyin pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa ni /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa ni /
translated: Giving is mentioned first.

original: stan stobs par byed ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: stan stobs par byed ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: He gives seats, etc.

original: bstod pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa ni phyag 'tshal pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bstod pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa ni phyag 'tshal pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The praise is stated in the verse beginning with ‚ÄúI pay homage to the one who is endowed with the most excellent of all good qualities.

original: mtshungs pa la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mtshungs pa la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: ‚Äù There are two kinds of equality:

original: na tshod dang / yon tan gyis so //
analyzed: na tshod dang / yon tan gyis so //
translated: equality of age and equality of good qualities.

original: de la rnam pa gnyis kyis yang dag par sgrub par byed de /
analyzed: de la rnam pa gnyis kyis yang dag par sgrub par byed de /
translated: One accomplishes these two in two ways:

original: snying dga' bar byed pa'i tshig gis legs par smra bar byed pa dang / yid kyis bdag dang mnyam po yin zhes dpog pas ma gus par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: snying dga' bar byed pa'i tshig gis legs par smra bar byed pa dang / yid kyis bdag dang mnyam po yin zhes dpog pas ma gus par mi byed pa'o //
translated: one speaks well with words that please the heart, and one does not show disrespect by thinking ‚ÄúI am equal to him in age and good qualities.

original: dman pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dman pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: ‚Äù There are two kinds of inferiority:

original: na tshod dang / yon tan gyi rnam pas so //
analyzed: na tshod dang / yon tan gyi rnam pas so //
translated: inferiority of age and inferiority of good qualities.

original: de la 'jig rten shes pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten shes pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four kinds of knowledge of the world:

original: yon tan bskyed par 'dod pa nyid dang / yon tan yod pa la rjod par byed pa dang / skyon yod pa 'chab par byed pa dang / brnyas par mi byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: yon tan bskyed par 'dod pa nyid dang / yon tan yod pa la rjod par byed pa dang / skyon yod pa 'chab par byed pa dang / brnyas par mi byed pa nyid do //
translated: the desire to generate good qualities, the desire to proclaim the good qualities of others, the desire to conceal the faults of others, and the desire not to despise others.

original: dman pa 'ga' zhig 'dod par gyur na de la yang ci nus kyis sgrub par byed pa ni rnam pa gsum du bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: dman pa 'ga' zhig 'dod par gyur na de la yang ci nus kyis sgrub par byed pa ni rnam pa gsum du bstan par bya ste /
translated: The third is the desire to accomplish the aims of others to the best of one's ability.

original: phyir phyogs par mi byed pa ni /üîΩgang gi phyir smras pa /
analyzed: phyir phyogs par mi byed pa ni / gang gi phyir smras pa /
translated: One should not turn one's back on them.üîΩOne should not be angry with them.üîΩOne should not laugh at them.üîΩOne should not despise them.üîΩOne should not look down on them.üîΩOne should not insult them.

original: phyir phyogs shing khro gnyer mi byed pa zhes bya ba'o //üîΩbzhad gad dang dpyas mi byed pa ni /
analyzed: phyir phyogs shing khro gnyer mi byed pa zhes bya ba'o // bzhad gad dang dpyas mi byed pa ni /
translated: One should not despise them.üîΩOne should not look down on them.üîΩOne should not insult them.üîΩOne should not despise them.üîΩOne should not look down on them.

original: 'khrul pa la yang 'phyas mi byed ces bya ba ste /üîΩyang dang yang mi lta zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'khrul pa la yang 'phyas mi byed ces bya ba ste / yang dang yang mi lta zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: One should not insult them.üîΩOne should not despise them.
