original: gsong por smra ba'i tshig gis tshur shog bde bar 'ongs so zhes smra ba nyid dang / sbyin par dam bcas pas bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa ste /
analyzed: gsong por smra ba'i tshig gis tshur shog bde bar 'ongs so zhes smra ba nyid dang / sbyin par dam bcas pas bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa ste /
translated: One should not despise them.üîΩOne should not look down on them.üîΩOne should not insult them.

original: gang yang smras pa /
analyzed: gang yang smras pa /
translated: One should

original: ngal sor 'jug cing zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ngal sor 'jug cing zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase he engages in relaxation means

original: 'dod pa zhi bar byed pas na ngal sor 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa zhi bar byed pas na ngal sor 'jug pa'o //
translated: that he engages in relaxation in order to pacify desire.

original: khas blangs pa ltar byed pa zhes 'don pa de'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: khas blangs pa ltar byed pa zhes 'don pa de'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The phrase he acts in accordance with his promises means

original: ji ltar dam bcas pa de bzhin du sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar dam bcas pa de bzhin du sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: that he acts in accordance with his promises.

original: de'i phyir smras pa ci nus kyis sdud par byed ces bya ba'o //üîΩ'dod pa'i don du gnyer bas bslangs pa na bcos ma'i zab @227a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa ci nus kyis sdud par byed ces bya ba'o // 'dod pa'i don du gnyer bas bslangs pa na bcos ma'i zab @227a * //
translated: Therefore, the phrase he attracts them by whatever means are necessary is stated.

original: mo ltar bcos nas cang mi smra bar 'dug pa ste /
analyzed: mo ltar bcos nas cang mi smra bar 'dug pa ste /
translated: When he is requested to do something for the sake of a desired object, he does not respond with a pretense of profundity, such as remaining silent and feigning profundity.

original: gang gi phyir smras pa drod mi zin pa dang ldan par mi byed ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir smras pa drod mi zin pa dang ldan par mi byed ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the phrase he does not engage in insincere behavior is stated.

original: yang na gya gyus zab pa ltar ston pa ste bcos pa'i zab pa ltar ston pa'o //üîΩphongs pa rnams la sgrub par byed pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na gya gyus zab pa ltar ston pa ste bcos pa'i zab pa ltar ston pa'o // phongs pa rnams la sgrub par byed pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Alternatively, the phrase he does not engage in insincere behavior means that he does not pretend to be profound by feigning profundity.

original: yo byad thams cad dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: yo byad thams cad dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In order to demonstrate that he is one who provides assistance to those who are in distress, the root text declares, he is not possessive, and so on.üîΩThe phrase he is not possessive means that he does not keep things for his own use.

original: nye bar longs spyad pa thams cad kyis nye bar sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar longs spyad pa thams cad kyis nye bar sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: He accomplishes all of them by means of his own enjoyment.

original: mthun pa'i lus dang / ngag gi las kyis kyang yal bar mi 'dor ro zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: mthun pa'i lus dang / ngag gi las kyis kyang yal bar mi 'dor ro zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: He does not abandon them even by means of his agreeable bodily and vocal actions.

original: 'dis ni sbyin pa'i spyod pa kun du tshol pa'i yang dag pa'i sgrub pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni sbyin pa'i spyod pa kun du tshol pa'i yang dag pa'i sgrub pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the correct practice of the search for the practice of generosity.

original: grogs po la sogs pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /üîΩthams cad kyang mdza' bo dang grogs por byed do zhes bya ba ni thams cad grogs po'i bya ba sgrub par byed pa ni /
analyzed: grogs po la sogs pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa / thams cad kyang mdza' bo dang grogs por byed do zhes bya ba ni thams cad grogs po'i bya ba sgrub par byed pa ni /
translated: With regard to friends, etc., it is said:üîΩHe makes all of them friends and allies.

original: thams cad mdza' bo dang grogs por byed pa ste /üîΩbdag nyid kyi sgrub pas phyir rgol ba med ba nyid ni /
analyzed: thams cad mdza' bo dang grogs por byed pa ste / bdag nyid kyi sgrub pas phyir rgol ba med ba nyid ni /
translated: He makes all of them friends and allies by accomplishing the actions of a friend.üîΩHe is free from opposition by means of his own practice.

original: phyir rgol ba dang bral bar gyur ba'o //üîΩmgon med pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa mgon med cing rten med pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: phyir rgol ba dang bral bar gyur ba'o // mgon med pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa mgon med cing rten med pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: He is free from opposition by means of his own practice.üîΩWith regard to those who are helpless and without a protector, it is said:üîΩHe is the protector of those who are helpless and without a protector.

original: mgon dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs su bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mgon dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs su bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: He is the protector of those who are helpless and without a protector in the situation of having a protector. This is the meaning.

original: sems can gyi dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: sems can gyi dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: He speaks from the point of view of sentient beings:

original: rnam grangs gang gis kyang zhes bya ba ni gang ci yang rung ba'i rnam par reg par mi gnas pa'i bsam pas sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba sgrub par mi byed do ;
analyzed: rnam grangs gang gis kyang zhes bya ba ni gang ci yang rung ba'i rnam par reg par mi gnas pa'i bsam pas sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba sgrub par mi byed do ;
translated: By any means means that with the intention of not remaining indifferent to any sentient being, he does not inflict suffering or mental pain.

original: / na tshod kyi dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: / na tshod kyi dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: He speaks from the point of view of age:

original: dgod par byed na yang ran par dgod par byed kyi ma 'os par dgod par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: dgod par byed na yang ran par dgod par byed kyi ma 'os par dgod par mi byed pa'o //
translated: When he laughs, he laughs appropriately, not inappropriately.

original: tshogs par mi 'byung ba'i tshig brjod par mi byed ces bya ba ni gang dang shin tu gcugs par gyur pa de la yang tshig mi snyan pa rjod par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: tshogs par mi 'byung ba'i tshig brjod par mi byed ces bya ba ni gang dang shin tu gcugs par gyur pa de la yang tshig mi snyan pa rjod par mi byed pa'o //
translated: He does not speak words that cause division in the assembly. He does not speak unpleasant words even to those with whom he is very familiar.

original: de ltar na de dag 'jig rten shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na de dag 'jig rten shes pa yin no //
translated: Thus he knows the world.

original: gnod par byed pa rnams la bzod pa'i sgo nas 'jig rten shes pa bstan pa'i phyir gnod pa byas pa dag la yang khro bar mi bya ba yin pas /
analyzed: gnod par byed pa rnams la bzod pa'i sgo nas 'jig rten shes pa bstan pa'i phyir gnod pa byas pa dag la yang khro bar mi bya ba yin pas /
translated: To show knowledge of the world through patience toward those who do harm, he does not get angry at those who do him harm.

original: gang gi phyir smras pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir smras pa /
translated: For what reason?

original: khro bar yang mi byed do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khro bar yang mi byed do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: He does not get angry.üîΩEven if he gets angry, he does not speak harshly.

original: khros su zin kyang tshig ngan pa smra bar mi byed pa'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: khros su zin kyang tshig ngan pa smra bar mi byed pa'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: To show that he does not speak harshly, it says:

original: mtshang sgrogs par yang mi byed do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mtshang sgrogs par yang mi byed do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: He does not expose others‚Äô faults.

original: khro ba la slar khro bar mi bya zhing brdegs kyang slar brdeg par mi bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: khro ba la slar khro bar mi bya zhing brdegs kyang slar brdeg par mi bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: To show that he does not get angry in return and does not strike back when struck, it says:

original: gzhan dag gi lus dang ngag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag gi lus dang ngag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: He does not strike back with his body or speech.

original: bstings su zin kyang zhes bya ba ni brdegs shing spyos kyang ngo //
analyzed: bstings su zin kyang zhes bya ba ni brdegs shing spyos kyang ngo //
translated: Even if he is struck and insulted,

original: de'i @227b rgyu bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i @227b rgyu bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: To show the cause of that, it says:

original: chos nyid yid la byed pa'am /
analyzed: chos nyid yid la byed pa'am /
translated: He keeps in mind the nature of reality.

original: byis pa'i rang bzhin can gyi gnod pa byed par brtags nas bzod pa la mang du gnas pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: byis pa'i rang bzhin can gyi gnod pa byed par brtags nas bzod pa la mang du gnas pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: To show that he is patient because he considers the harm-doer to be a childlike person, it says:üîΩHe is patient because he considers the harm-doer to be a childlike person.

original: sems brtan zhing zhes bya ba la sngar ji lta ba de bzhin du gnod pa byas pa'i dus su yang lus la sogs pas bzod pas bzod pa bstan pas mi rgod pa'o //üîΩde'i phyir smas pa /
analyzed: sems brtan zhing zhes bya ba la sngar ji lta ba de bzhin du gnod pa byas pa'i dus su yang lus la sogs pas bzod pas bzod pa bstan pas mi rgod pa'o // de'i phyir smas pa /
translated: The phrase firm in mind means that, just as before, one is patient with the body, etc. at the time of being harmed. Thus, one is not agitated by the teaching of patience.üîΩTherefore, it is said: firm in mind.

original: brtan ba yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: brtan ba yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase and so forth refers to the following:

original: bdag nyid yang dag par bsgrub pa'i 'jig rten shes pa bstan pa nyid ni khyim par gyur cing de lta bur gnas kyang de lta bur 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag nyid yang dag par bsgrub pa'i 'jig rten shes pa bstan pa nyid ni khyim par gyur cing de lta bur gnas kyang de lta bur 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The phrase one should know the world in terms of the correct practice of oneself is taught in order to demonstrate that, even though one is a householder and lives in that way, one should engage in that way.üîΩ The phrase free from the fourteen impure activities means that one is free from the fourteen impure activities.

original: dri ma'i las kyi mtha' bcu bzhi dang bral ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dri ma'i las kyi mtha' ni dge ba ma yin pa'i las kyi mtha' zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dri ma'i las kyi mtha' bcu bzhi dang bral ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dri ma'i las kyi mtha' ni dge ba ma yin pa'i las kyi mtha' zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the term impure activities is that they are not virtuous activities.

original: de la mdo'i tshig ni khyim bdag gi bu bzhi po 'di dag ni spang bar bya ba'i las kyi nyon mongs pa ste /
analyzed: de la mdo'i tshig ni khyim bdag gi bu bzhi po 'di dag ni spang bar bya ba'i las kyi nyon mongs pa ste /
translated: In this regard, the words of the sutra state: These four sons of the householder are the afflictions of the activities that are to be abandoned.üîΩ

original: srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par spyod pa dang / brdzun du smra ba'o //
analyzed: srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par spyod pa dang / brdzun du smra ba'o //
translated: killing, stealing, sexual misconduct, and lying.

original: gnas bzhis sdig pa'i las byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gnas bzhis sdig pa'i las byed par 'gyur te /
translated: One commits evil actions through four bases:

original: 'dun pa dang / zhe sdang dang / 'jigs pa dang / gti mug go //
analyzed: 'dun pa dang / zhe sdang dang / 'jigs pa dang / gti mug go //
translated: desire, hatred, fear, and confusion.

original: longs spyod zad par 'gyur ba'i sgo na drug ste //üîΩchang dang bcos pa'i chang dang myos par 'gyur pa bag med pa'i gnas la chags pa dang / dus ma yin pa'i mtshan mo kun du spyod pa la chags pa dang / ltad mo dang 'dus pa la kun du chags pa dang / rgyan po dang sho 'gyed pa la kun du chags pa dang /
analyzed: longs spyod zad par 'gyur ba'i sgo na drug ste // chang dang bcos pa'i chang dang myos par 'gyur pa bag med pa'i gnas la chags pa dang / dus ma yin pa'i mtshan mo kun du spyod pa la chags pa dang / ltad mo dang 'dus pa la kun du chags pa dang / rgyan po dang sho 'gyed pa la kun du chags pa dang /
translated: There are six ways in which one's enjoyments are exhausted:üîΩattachment to drinking alcohol, distilled spirits, and intoxicants, which are the basis of heedlessness; attachment to nocturnal conduct at inappropriate times; attachment to spectacles and crowds; attachment to gambling and betting;

original: sdig pa'i grogs po la kun du chags pa dang / le lo dang snyom las la kun du chags pa'o //
analyzed: sdig pa'i grogs po la kun du chags pa dang / le lo dang snyom las la kun du chags pa'o //
translated: attachment to evil friends; and attachment to laziness and idleness.

original: dri ma'i las kyi mtha' bcu bzhi po 'di dag spang ba byas pas dri ma'i las kyi mtha' bcu bzhi dang bral ba 'thob bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dri ma'i las kyi mtha' bcu bzhi po 'di dag spang ba byas pas dri ma'i las kyi mtha' bcu bzhi dang bral ba 'thob bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By abandoning these fourteen impure activities, one obtains freedom from the fourteen impure activities.

original: phyogs drug gis bkab pa ni rjes su gzung bzhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phyogs drug gis bkab pa ni rjes su gzung bzhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The six directions are covered, which means that they are taken care of.

original: phyogs drug la phyag bya /üîΩmchod pa bya /
analyzed: phyogs drug la phyag bya / mchod pa bya /
translated: One should pay homage to the six directions.üîΩOne should make offerings to them.

original: phyag byas shing mchod pa byas na de dag gis so sor rjes su brtse bar 'gyur ro zhes byas nas so //
analyzed: phyag byas shing mchod pa byas na de dag gis so sor rjes su brtse bar 'gyur ro zhes byas nas so //
translated: If one pays homage and makes offerings to them, they will each take care of one.

analyzed: de la shar gyi phyogs ni ma dang pha'o //

analyzed: lho'i phyogs ni slob dpon dang mkhan po'o //

original: nub kyi phyogs ni bu dang chung ma'o //
analyzed: nub kyi phyogs ni bu dang chung ma'o //

original: byang gi phyogs ni grogs po dang blon po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: byang gi phyogs ni grogs po dang blon po la sogs pa'o //
translated: The northern direction is one's friends, ministers, and so on.

original: 'og gi phyogs ni bran la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'og gi phyogs ni bran la sogs pa'o //
translated: The lower direction is one's servants and so on.

original: steng gi phyogs ni dge slong dang bram ze'o //
analyzed: steng gi phyogs ni dge slong dang bram ze'o //
translated: The upper direction is one's monks and brahmins.

original: sdig pa'i grogs po bzhi spangs pa yin zhes bya ba la sdig pa'i grogs po bzhi ni gzhan gyi nor 'phrog pa @228a * //
analyzed: sdig pa'i grogs po bzhi spangs pa yin zhes bya ba la sdig pa'i grogs po bzhi ni gzhan gyi nor 'phrog pa @228a * //
translated: The four kinds of bad friends are: those who steal the wealth of others;

original: dang ; dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi gzugs kyis sdig pa'i grogs por gnas pa dang / bcos ma'i ngag smra pas snyan par smra ba tsam shis pa dang / thabs dang mi ldan pa'i grogs po'o //
analyzed: dang ; dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi gzugs kyis sdig pa'i grogs por gnas pa dang / bcos ma'i ngag smra pas snyan par smra ba tsam shis pa dang / thabs dang mi ldan pa'i grogs po'o //
translated: those who are bad friends in the guise of spiritual teachers; those who are merely pleasant in speech, speaking with a false sweetness; and those who are not helpful friends.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen bzhi ni phan pa byed pa dang / bde ba dang sdug bsngal mnyam du spyod pa dang / pan pa ston pa dang / rjes su brtse ba can no //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen bzhi ni phan pa byed pa dang / bde ba dang sdug bsngal mnyam du spyod pa dang / pan pa ston pa dang / rjes su brtse ba can no //
translated: The four kinds of spiritual teachers are: those who are helpful; those who share in others' happiness and suffering; those who teach what is helpful; and those who are compassionate.

original: 'di dag gis bshad pa ni ji ltar gtsug phud can gyi mdo las 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di dag gis bshad pa ni ji ltar gtsug phud can gyi mdo las 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: This explanation is in accordance with the Cudapak·π£a S≈´tra.

original: tshe 'di la chos dang mthun pa'i longs spyod dang rab tu ldan pa'i phan 'dogs pa las brtsams nas 'jig rten shes pa dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' nyams su len pa'i sgrub pa las brtsams nas sgrub phod pas le lo la sogs pa rnam par spangs pa dang /
analyzed: tshe 'di la chos dang mthun pa'i longs spyod dang rab tu ldan pa'i phan 'dogs pa las brtsams nas 'jig rten shes pa dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' nyams su len pa'i sgrub pa las brtsams nas sgrub phod pas le lo la sogs pa rnam par spangs pa dang /
translated: He is a refuge because he is endowed with the refuge of others, beginning with the refuge of himself.üîΩHe is a support because he is endowed with the support of others, beginning with the support of himself.

original: yongs su srung ba las brtsams nas /üîΩkun nas srung ba dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su srung ba las brtsams nas / kun nas srung ba dang ldan pa ste /
translated: He is a defender because he is endowed with the defense of others, beginning with the defense of himself.üîΩHe is a friend because he is endowed with the friendship of others, beginning with the friendship of himself.üîΩHe is a companion because he is endowed with the companionship of others, beginning with the companionship of himself.üîΩHe is a kinsman because he is endowed with the kinship of others, beginning with the kinship of himself.üîΩHe is a servant because he is endowed with the service of others, beginning with the service of himself.üîΩHe is a benefactor because he is endowed with the benefit of others, beginning with the benefit of himself.üîΩHe is a well-wisher because he is endowed with the good wishes of others, beginning with his own good wishes.üîΩHe is a compassionate one because he is endowed with the compassion of others, beginning with his own compassion.

original: mtshon cha len pa la sogs pa spangs pa nyid kyis nor legs par srung ba'o //
analyzed: mtshon cha len pa la sogs pa spangs pa nyid kyis nor legs par srung ba'o //
translated: He is a giver because he is endowed with the giving of others, beginning with his own giving.üîΩHe is a speaker of truth because he is endowed with the truthfulness of others, beginning with his own truthfulness.

original: longs spyod pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: longs spyod pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: He is a speaker of what is beneficial because he is endowed with the beneficialness of others, beginning with his own beneficialness.üîΩHe is a speaker of Dharma because he is endowed with the Dharma of others, beginning with his own Dharma.üîΩHe is a speaker of what is meaningful because he is endowed with the meaningfulness of others, beginning with his own meaningfulness.üîΩHe is a speaker of what is pleasant because he is endowed with the pleasantness of others, beginning with his own pleasantness.

original: mthun pas 'tsho ba dang zhes bya ba la bdag nyid kyang tshim par byed ces bya ba nas rgyas par bslab par bya ba la slob par byed ces bya ba'i bar tshigs su bcad pas bstan pa yin te //
analyzed: mthun pas 'tsho ba dang zhes bya ba la bdag nyid kyang tshim par byed ces bya ba nas rgyas par bslab par bya ba la slob par byed ces bya ba'i bar tshigs su bcad pas bstan pa yin te //
translated: He is a speaker of what is suitable because he is endowed with the suitability of others, beginning with his own suitability.

original: de la mkhas par gyur pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: de la mkhas par gyur pa thob pa'o //
translated: He is a speaker

original: gzhan dag la slu bar mi byed pas na pha rol 'drid pa'i ngang tshul can ma yin pa'i 'jig rten shes pa bstan pa'i phyir dang / 'jal lugs la sogs pas gzhan dag slu bar mi byed pas na g-yo med pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag la slu bar mi byed pas na pha rol 'drid pa'i ngang tshul can ma yin pa'i 'jig rten shes pa bstan pa'i phyir dang / 'jal lugs la sogs pas gzhan dag slu bar mi byed pas na g-yo med pa'o //
translated: He is not a deceiver of others because he does not deceive others by means of weights and measures, etc.

original: bya ba de lta bu la ngo tsha bar 'gyur bas na sgyu med par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: bya ba de lta bu la ngo tsha bar 'gyur bas na sgyu med par gyur pa yin no //

original: yul la sogs pa'i rjes su 'jug pas spyod pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: yul la sogs pa'i rjes su 'jug pas spyod pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: He is endowed with perfect conduct because he engages in conduct that is in accord with the Dharma.

original: nam yang 'da' bar mi byed pas na de lhur len pa'o//
analyzed: nam yang 'da' bar mi byed pas na de lhur len pa'o//
translated: He is devoted to that because he never transgresses it.

original: de nyid kyis na spyod pa srung ba'o //üîΩnor bcol ba nyams par mi byed pas ne da gtams pa la yang g-yo mi byed pa yin zhes bya ba'o //üîΩbu lon chags pa la yang mi slu bas na smras pa /üîΩbu lon chags pa la yang dor ba mi byed pa yin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na spyod pa srung ba'o // nor bcol ba nyams par mi byed pas ne da gtams pa la yang g-yo mi byed pa yin zhes bya ba'o // bu lon chags pa la yang mi slu bas na smras pa / bu lon chags pa la yang dor ba mi byed pa yin zhes bya'o //
translated: He is a protector of his conduct because of that.üîΩHe is not deceitful with regard to a sealed deposit because he does not damage a sealed deposit that is entrusted to him.

original: bgo bsha' la sogs pa la yang mi slu bas smras pa /
analyzed: bgo bsha' la sogs pa la yang mi slu bas smras pa /
translated: He is not deceitful with regard to a debt because he does not deceive a creditor.üîΩHe is not deceitful with regard to a division because he does not deceive those who are dividing property.

original: bgo skal gcig pa la yang mi 'drid pa yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bgo skal gcig pa la yang mi 'drid pa yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: He is not a cheat even to his own share.üîΩHe does not deceive even the ignorant about the value of gems.

original: rin po che brtag pa la rmongs pa rnams la yang slu bar mi byed pas smras pa /
analyzed: rin po che brtag pa la rmongs pa rnams la yang slu bar mi byed pas smras pa /
translated: He says:

original: rin po che'am rin po cher smos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rin po che'am rin po cher smos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: A gem or what is called a gem.

original: mi shes pa la slu bar mi byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi shes pa la slu bar mi byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: He does not deceive the ignorant, that is the meaning.

original: kha na ma tho ba med pa'i 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi tshul la @228b yang mkhas pa yin pas rang nyid grogs su g-yar ba'i blo dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med pa'i 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi tshul la @228b yang mkhas pa yin pas rang nyid grogs su g-yar ba'i blo dang ldan pa'o //
translated: He is skilled in the ways of the world, which are free from reproach. He is intelligent, and he is a good friend.

original: grogs med pa dag la bcol na grogs su 'gro ste /
analyzed: grogs med pa dag la bcol na grogs su 'gro ste /
translated: He is a good friend to those who are friendless.

original: mi 'gyur ba ni log par sgrub par mi byed pa yin no //
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba ni log par sgrub par mi byed pa yin no //
translated: He is not fickle, that is, he does not act perversely.

original: gtam rlung skur ba ni gzhan gyis dris na gzhan gyis lan 'debs pa ste /
analyzed: gtam rlung skur ba ni gzhan gyis dris na gzhan gyis lan 'debs pa ste /
translated: He does not gossip, that is, he does not repeat to one person what he has heard from another.

original: dris pa'i lan mi 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: dris pa'i lan mi 'debs pa'o //
translated: He does not ask questions out of curiosity.

original: las kyi mtha' bzang po dang ldan pa ni dus dang 'tsham pa dang / thabs dang ldan par brtsams pa nyid do //
analyzed: las kyi mtha' bzang po dang ldan pa ni dus dang 'tsham pa dang / thabs dang ldan par brtsams pa nyid do //
translated: He is skillful in his work, that is, he is timely and he is skillful.

original: rgyal por gyur pa'i 'jug pa bstan pa'i phyir rgyal po byed na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rgyal por gyur pa'i 'jug pa bstan pa'i phyir rgyal po byed na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In order to show the conduct of a king, he says, ‚ÄúEven when acting as a king, etc.‚Äù

original: rnam pa gnyis kyis rgyal po byed pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis kyis rgyal po byed pa yin te /
translated: He acts as a king in two ways.

original: rtsod pa med par rgyal srid skyong ba gang yin pa de ni chos kyi rgyal srid byed pa yin gyi rtsod pas rgyal po byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rtsod pa med par rgyal srid skyong ba gang yin pa de ni chos kyi rgyal srid byed pa yin gyi rtsod pas rgyal po byed pa ma yin no //
translated: He acts as a king righteously, not as a king through strife, in that he rules the kingdom without strife.

original: tshe 'di'i bde ba 'ba' zhig sgrub par byed pa ma yin gyi 'jig rten la phan pa byed do zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshe 'di'i bde ba 'ba' zhig sgrub par byed pa ma yin gyi 'jig rten la phan pa byed do zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He does not just pursue the happiness of this life, but acts for the benefit of the world.

original: skye bo phal po che 'chal ba'i tshul khrims las bzlog nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: skye bo phal po che 'chal ba'i tshul khrims las bzlog nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: In order to show this, he says, ‚ÄúHaving turned away the multitude of people from immorality, etc.‚Äù

original: rgyal po smra ba lan gcig go //üîΩzhes bya ba'i tshig gis smras pa /
analyzed: rgyal po smra ba lan gcig go // zhes bya ba'i tshig gis smras pa /
translated: This is the first statement of the king.

original: 'phags pa'i tha snyad ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i tha snyad ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe noble convention, etc.‚Äù

original: 'jig rten shes pa'i bsdus pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir smras pa //
analyzed: 'jig rten shes pa'i bsdus pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir smras pa //
translated: In order to show the condensed meaning of knowing the world, he says,

original: 'jig rten ji ltar shes par bya ba dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'jig rten ji ltar shes par bya ba dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: How should one understand the world?

original: rnam pa gnyis su 'jig rten shes pa rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis su 'jig rten shes pa rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
translated: The world should be understood in two ways:

analyzed: 'jig rten yongs su shes pa dang // 'jig rten rjes su 'jug pa'o //
translated: as the world that is to be understood, and as the world that is to be entered.

original: rton pa bzhi po dag la zhes bya ba ni don rnam pa bzhis rton pa rnam pa bzhi la ji ltar rton par rigs par 'gyur zhes dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: rton pa bzhi po dag la zhes bya ba ni don rnam pa bzhis rton pa rnam pa bzhi la ji ltar rton par rigs par 'gyur zhes dris pa'i don to //
translated: The four reliances are mentioned. The meaning of the question is: How is it proper to rely on the four reliances, which are established by the four kinds of meaning?

original: don 'dod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni don lhur len par gyur pas nyan par byed kyi yi ge sbyar ba lhur len pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don 'dod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni don lhur len par gyur pas nyan par byed kyi yi ge sbyar ba lhur len pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Because of the desire for the meaning, one listens with the aim of understanding the meaning, not with the aim of repeating the words.

original: don lhur len pa'i phyir phal pa'i skad kyis chos ston na yang gus par byas te chos nyan par byed do //
analyzed: don lhur len pa'i phyir phal pa'i skad kyis chos ston na yang gus par byas te chos nyan par byed do //
translated: Because of the aim of the meaning, one listens to the teaching of the Dharma even in a vernacular, with respect, as the teaching of the Dharma.

original: de ltar na don la rton pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na don la rton pa yin no //
translated: Thus, one relies on the meaning.

original: chos la rton pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: chos la rton pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /

original: nag po bstan pa dang / chen po bstan pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nag po bstan pa dang / chen po bstan pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: the teaching of the black, and the teaching of the great.

original: nag po dang dkar po ma 'dres par zhes bya ba ste rigs pa shes pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nag po dang dkar po ma 'dres par zhes bya ba ste rigs pa shes pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúWithout mixing up the black and white‚Äù means ‚Äúknowing the reasoning.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir smras pa rigs pa la rton par byed pa yin gyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa rigs pa la rton par byed pa yin gyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúOne should rely on reasoning.‚Äù

original: gnas brtan zhes bya ba ni chos nyid la gnas pa brtan pa yin te /
analyzed: gnas brtan zhes bya ba ni chos nyid la gnas pa brtan pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúElder‚Äù means one who is firm in the nature of things.

original: sgrub pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sgrub pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means ‚Äúone who is accomplished.‚Äù

original: shes pa'i gang zag ces bya ba ni kun gyis slob dpon du 'khur ba ste /
analyzed: shes pa'i gang zag ces bya ba ni kun gyis slob dpon du 'khur ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúPerson who knows‚Äù means one who is carried by all as a teacher.

original: mang du thos pa zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩdge 'dun gyis zhes bya ba ni tshogs @229a * //
analyzed: mang du thos pa zhes bya ba'i don to // dge 'dun gyis zhes bya ba ni tshogs @229a * //
translated: It means ‚Äúone who has heard much.‚Äù

original: kyi dge 'dun te /
analyzed: kyi dge 'dun te /
translated: ‚ÄúSa·πÖgha‚Äù means the assembly of the Sa·πÖgha.

original: 'dis ni btags pa'i dge 'dun la bya bar bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni btags pa'i dge 'dun la bya bar bstan to //
translated: This shows that the Sa·πÖgha is to be understood as a nominal reality.

original: de ltar gang zag la brten par mi bya'i /
analyzed: de ltar gang zag la brten par mi bya'i /
translated: Thus, one should not rely on the person,

original: gzhan du na rigs pa la brten par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan du na rigs pa la brten par bya'o //
translated: but rather on something else, namely, on reasoning.

original: de'i phan yon bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phan yon bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the benefit of that, it is said:

original: de kho na'i don las mi g-yo zhing zhes bya ba ni chos 'di ston pas gsungs pa'i bstan pa yin gyi zung shig ces zer ba ni /
analyzed: de kho na'i don las mi g-yo zhing zhes bya ba ni chos 'di ston pas gsungs pa'i bstan pa yin gyi zung shig ces zer ba ni /
translated: Not deviating from the meaning of reality means that this teaching is the teaching spoken by the Teacher. Take it up means

original: rigs pa la rton pa sun 'byin par byed cing bkrir mi btub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rigs pa la rton pa sun 'byin par byed cing bkrir mi btub par 'gyur ro //
translated: to refute reliance on reasoning and to be unyielding.

original: de las bzlog pa ni len par byed do //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni len par byed do //
translated: The opposite of that is to take it up.

original: de'i phyir gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa yang yin te //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa yang yin te //
translated: Therefore, it is also not dependent on others.

original: gzhan gyi rkyen gyis mi 'gro ba //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rkyen gyis mi 'gro ba //
translated: It is not going by the conditions of others.

original: zhes bya'o // dad pas zhen zhing zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa la dad pas zhen pa ste /üîΩmdo gzhan las bzhi las skyes pa //
analyzed: zhes bya'o // dad pas zhen zhing zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa la dad pas zhen pa ste / mdo gzhan las bzhi las skyes pa //
translated: Faithfully adhering means adhering to the Tathagata through faith.

original: zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: Up to arisen from the four in another sutra.

original: de lta na yang gzhan du mi 'gyur zhing gcig tu nges pa'i gsungs la ni mngon par rab tu dga' bar 'gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang gzhan du mi 'gyur zhing gcig tu nges pa'i gsungs la ni mngon par rab tu dga' bar 'gyur pa yin no //
translated: Even so, it does not become otherwise, and one definitely delights in the teaching.

original: gcig tu nges pa'i gsung bstan pa'i phyir nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde zhes bya ste //
analyzed: gcig tu nges pa'i gsung bstan pa'i phyir nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde zhes bya ste //
translated: In order to show the definite teaching, it is called a sutra of definitive meaning.

original: ji ltar ma dang pha ni rjes su mthun pa'i gnas yin no zhes bya ba lta bu drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar ma dang pha ni rjes su mthun pa'i gnas yin no zhes bya ba lta bu drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde la ni ma yin te /

original: ji ltar gang zag yod pa nyid du bstan pa la gang zag ni rnam pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar gang zag yod pa nyid du bstan pa la gang zag ni rnam pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is like the teaching of the existence of the person, where it is said, ‚ÄúThe person is fourfold.‚Äù

original: rab tu grub pa'i de kho na'i don la gnas pa ni mi 'phrogs par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: rab tu grub pa'i de kho na'i don la gnas pa ni mi 'phrogs par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: One who is established in the reality that is well-established is not to be led away.

original: drang ba'i don ji ltar tshad ma ma yin pa de bstan pa'i phyir sgo sna tshogs nas zhugs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: drang ba'i don ji ltar tshad ma ma yin pa de bstan pa'i phyir sgo sna tshogs nas zhugs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: To show how interpretable meaning is not a valid cognition, he says, ‚Äúbecause of the various entrances, etc.‚Äù

original: de dang de dag gis ji ltar 'dod par yongs su 'dren par byed pas the tshom skye ba'i phyir de dag tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: de dang de dag gis ji ltar 'dod par yongs su 'dren par byed pas the tshom skye ba'i phyir de dag tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: They are not valid cognitions because they give rise to doubt, since they lead one to various opinions.

original: nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde tshad ma ma yin no zhes zer ba'i nyes dmigs bstan pa'i phyir gal te byang chub sems dpa' nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde tshad ma ma yin no zhes zer ba'i nyes dmigs bstan pa'i phyir gal te byang chub sems dpa' nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: In order to show the fault of saying that the sutras of definitive meaning are not valid, it says, ‚ÄúIf a bodhisattva does not respect the sutras of definitive meaning, etc.‚Äù

original: nges pa'i don yin yang thams cad kyis ye shes 'thob pa ma yin pas tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: nges pa'i don yin yang thams cad kyis ye shes 'thob pa ma yin pas tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: Even though they are of definitive meaning, they are not valid because not everyone attains knowledge.

original: 'o na tshad ma'i shes pa thob pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na tshad ma'i shes pa thob pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: Well, then, what is the attainment of valid knowledge?

original: smras pa / rtogs pa'i ye shes la snying por blta ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /

analyzed: don dam pa'i ngo bo la dmigs pa'i phyir de med pa yang ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not non-existent, because it is the object of the ultimate essence.

original: dbu ma'i rnam pas bsdus pa bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: dbu ma'i rnam pas bsdus pa bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate that it is included within the middle way, he says:

original: brjod du med ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos nyid ces bya ba ni lus kyi de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i tha @231a * //üîΩtshig go // des na smras pa /
analyzed: brjod du med ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos nyid ces bya ba ni lus kyi de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i tha @231a * // tshig go // des na smras pa /
translated: The reality that is inexpressible in nature refers to the essence of the suchness of the body.üîΩTherefore, he says: the ultimate. It is the ultimate in the sense of being the object of the wisdom that is the realization of the suchness of the body.

original: don dam pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes pa dang shes bya dag ste de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid kyis rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir ji ltar rigs bar don dam pa nyid do //
analyzed: don dam pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes pa dang shes bya dag ste de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid kyis rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir ji ltar rigs bar don dam pa nyid do //
translated: It is the ultimate in the sense of being the object of the wisdom that is the realization of the suchness of the body.

original: kun rdzob kyi tshul gyis ni lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i rnam pa dpag tu med pa nyid de /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi tshul gyis ni lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i rnam pa dpag tu med pa nyid de /
translated: By the method of the conventional, the aspects of the applications of mindfulness of the body are immeasurable,

original: lus kyi 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i bye brag gi dbye ba tshad med pas tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus kyi 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i bye brag gi dbye ba tshad med pas tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the body is differentiated by the immeasurable distinctions of the primary elements and the derivatives of the primary elements.

original: de bzhin du lhag pa rnams kyang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du lhag pa rnams kyang blta bar bya'o //
translated: The remaining [applications of mindfulness] should be understood in the same way.

original: nyan thos rnams byang chub kyi phyogs bsgoms pa ni bden pa rnam par gzhag pa rab tu shes pa nyid do //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams byang chub kyi phyogs bsgoms pa ni bden pa rnam par gzhag pa rab tu shes pa nyid do //
translated: The ≈õrƒÅvakas cultivate the factors of enlightenment by thoroughly knowing the arrangement of the truths.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i don dam pa'i tshul du byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos bsgom pa'i tshul gyis chos nyid rab tu rtogs par bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i don dam pa'i tshul du byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos bsgom pa'i tshul gyis chos nyid rab tu rtogs par bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to teach that the bodhisattvas realize reality by the method of cultivating the factors of enlightenment in the ultimate mode, it is said:

original: lus dang tshor ba la sogs pa la 'bras bur gyur pa sdug bsngal nyid du yang rnam bar mi rtog la kun 'byung ba la rgyur gyur par yang rnam par mi rtog cing byang chub kyi phyogs bsgoms pas byas pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba la yang
analyzed: lus dang tshor ba la sogs pa la 'bras bur gyur pa sdug bsngal nyid du yang rnam bar mi rtog la kun 'byung ba la rgyur gyur par yang rnam par mi rtog cing byang chub kyi phyogs bsgoms pas byas pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba la yang
translated: They do not conceptualize the body, feelings, etc., as the effect, suffering, nor do they conceptualize the origin of suffering as its cause.

original: 'gog pa zhes mi rtog la /
analyzed: 'gog pa zhes mi rtog la /
translated: They do not conceptualize the elimination of the factors to be abandoned by meditating on the factors for awakening as cessation.üîΩThey do not conceptualize the cause for attaining the elimination of the factors to be abandoned as the path.

original: spong ba thob pa'i rgyur gyur pa la yang lam du mi rtog cing bden pa rnam par gzhag pa'i tshul gyi dbang du byas nas bden pa mthong ba'i dus su chos bdag med pa'i shes pas bden pa mthong ngo zhes byas nas brjod du med pa'i ngo bor
analyzed: spong ba thob pa'i rgyur gyur pa la yang lam du mi rtog cing bden pa rnam par gzhag pa'i tshul gyi dbang du byas nas bden pa mthong ba'i dus su chos bdag med pa'i shes pas bden pa mthong ngo zhes byas nas brjod du med pa'i ngo bor
translated: In terms of the way the truths are posited, when the truths are seen, they are seen by the knowledge of the selflessness of phenomena.

original: sdug bsngal gyi chos nyid la sogs pa bstan pas de ltar don dam pa'i tshul gyis bden pa bsgom pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi chos nyid la sogs pa bstan pas de ltar don dam pa'i tshul gyis bden pa bsgom pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: The teaching on the reality of suffering, etc., demonstrates the cultivation of the truths in terms of the ultimate.

original: kun rdzob kyi tshul gyis ni bden pa la mkhas pa tshad med pa'i tshul gyis rjes su 'gro bar shes par bya ba'o //üîΩzhi gnas kyi rnam pa'am /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi tshul gyis ni bden pa la mkhas pa tshad med pa'i tshul gyis rjes su 'gro bar shes par bya ba'o // zhi gnas kyi rnam pa'am /
translated: By the method of the conventional, one should understand the method of the immeasurable skill in the truths.üîΩOne should cultivate the factors of enlightenment by way of calm abiding or

original: lhag mthong gi rnam pas kyang byang chub kyi phyogs bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba bstan pa'i phyir de'i rjes la zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bstan te //
analyzed: lhag mthong gi rnam pas kyang byang chub kyi phyogs bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba bstan pa'i phyir de'i rjes la zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bstan te //
translated: by way of insight. In order to demonstrate that, after that, calm abiding and insight are taught.

original: chos de dang de dag la rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi rnam pas rab tu phye ba'i phyir rtog ba med pa ni zhi gnas so zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: chos de dang de dag la rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi rnam pas rab tu phye ba'i phyir rtog ba med pa ni zhi gnas so zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Non-discursive thought is calm abiding, because it is distinguished by the aspect of the non-conceptual image of those and those phenomena.

original: lhag mthong ni ye shes kyis rab tu phye ba'i phyir ji lta ba bzhin shes pa ni lhag mthong zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: lhag mthong ni ye shes kyis rab tu phye ba'i phyir ji lta ba bzhin shes pa ni lhag mthong zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Insight is just as it is understood, because it is distinguished by wisdom.

original: rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag ces bya ba ni rgyu bsgom pa nyid dang / 'bras bu bsgom pa nyid dang / lhun gyis grub par 'jug pa nyid dang / ro gcig par 'jug pa nyid do //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag ces bya ba ni rgyu bsgom pa nyid dang / 'bras bu bsgom pa nyid dang / lhun gyis grub par 'jug pa nyid dang / ro gcig par 'jug pa nyid do //
translated: These four aspects are: the cause of cultivation, the result of cultivation, the spontaneous engagement, and the engagement of oneness.

original: de ltar na rgyu'i ngo bo dang / 'bras bu'i ngo bo dang / rnam pa'i khyad @231b par gyi dbang du byas nas rnam pa bzhir rnam par gzhag go //

translated: Thus, the four aspects are established in terms of the nature of the cause, the nature of the result, and the distinction of aspects.üîΩIn order to demonstrate that insight is cultivated in dependence on serenity, it is said:

translated: The insight that is cultivated in dependence on serenity is the supramundane wisdom that is the antidote to the afflictions.üîΩThe supramundane wisdom is the wisdom that is attained in dependence on the meditative realization of the direct perception of reality.üîΩThe mundane wisdom is the wisdom that is attained in dependence on the meditative realization of the direct perception of reality.üîΩThe supramundane wisdom is the wisdom that is attained in dependence on the meditative realization of the direct perception of reality.

original: don dam pa pa ni brjod du med pa'i chos nyid la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa pa ni brjod du med pa'i chos nyid la dmigs pa'o //
translated: The mundane wisdom is the wisdom that is attained in dependence on the meditative realization of the direct perception of reality.üîΩThe supramundane wisdom is the wisdom that is attained in dependence on the meditative realization of the direct perception of reality.üîΩThe mundane wisdom is the wisdom that is attained in dependence on the meditative realization of the direct perception of reality.üîΩThe supramundane wisdom is the wisdom that is attained in dependence on the meditative realization of the direct perception of reality.üîΩThe mundane wisdom is the wisdom that is attained in dependence on the meditative realization of the direct perception of reality.üîΩThe supramundane wisdom is the wisdom that is attained in dependence on the meditative realization of the direct perception of reality.üîΩThe mundane wisdom is the wisdom that is attained in dependence on the meditative realization of the direct perception of reality.üîΩThe supramundane wisdom is the wisdom that is attained in dependence on the meditative realization of the direct perception of reality.üîΩThe mundane wisdom is the wisdom that is attained in dependence on the meditative realization of the direct perception of reality.üîΩThe supramundane wisdom is the wisdom that is attained in dependence on the meditative realization of the direct perception of reality.üîΩThe mundane wisdom is the wisdom that is attained in dependence on the meditative realization of the direct perception of reality.üîΩThe supramundane wisdom is the wisdom that is attained in dependence on the meditative realization of the direct perception of reality.

original: brdar btags pa ni rnam par gzhag pa tshad med pa'i rjes su 'jug pas rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: brdar btags pa ni rnam par gzhag pa tshad med pa'i rjes su 'jug pas rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la dmigs pa'o //
translated: The mundane wisdom is the wisdom that is attained in dependence on the meditative realization of the direct perception of reality.üîΩThe supramundane wisdom is the wisdom that is attained in dependence on the meditative realization of the direct

original: dang po'i sngon du 'gro ba ni mtshan ma med pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: dang po'i sngon du 'gro ba ni mtshan ma med pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
translated: The first has as its antecedent the non-conceptualization of signs.

original: gnyis pa'i sngon du 'gro ba ni mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa'o ;
analyzed: gnyis pa'i sngon du 'gro ba ni mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa'o ;
translated: The second has as its antecedent the conceptualization of signs.

original: / gang gi tshe lhag mthong la brten nas zhi gnas sgom par byed na ni de'i tshe shes pa'i 'bras bu rnam par gzhag par bya ste //
analyzed: / gang gi tshe lhag mthong la brten nas zhi gnas sgom par byed na ni de'i tshe shes pa'i 'bras bu rnam par gzhag par bya ste //
translated: When one cultivates calming on the basis of insight, then the result of knowledge is to be established.

original: don dam pa'i shes pa'i 'bras bu ni zhi gnas so //
analyzed: don dam pa'i shes pa'i 'bras bu ni zhi gnas so //
translated: The result of the knowledge of the ultimate is calming.

original: tha snyad thams cad kyi 'du shes yid la mi byed par 'jug pa dang lhun gyis grub par 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: tha snyad thams cad kyi 'du shes yid la mi byed par 'jug pa dang lhun gyis grub par 'jug pa ste /
translated: It is the entry into the non-attention to all conventional notions and the spontaneous entry into the non-attention to all conventional notions.

original: brjod du med pa'i rnam pa nyid yin pa'i phyir yid la byed pas dben pa nyid do //
analyzed: brjod du med pa'i rnam pa nyid yin pa'i phyir yid la byed pas dben pa nyid do //
translated: It is the isolation from attention because it is the inexpressible aspect.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: brjod du med pa'i dngos po tsam de la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: brjod du med pa'i dngos po tsam de la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: ‚ÄúAnd also in that mere inexpressible entity, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa yid la mi byed pas dben pa'i phyir mtshan ma med pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa yid la mi byed pas dben pa'i phyir mtshan ma med pa'o //
translated: It is signless because of the isolation from the attention to form, etc.

original: ngo bo nyid du rtogs pa la sogs pa dang bral ba'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa'o//
analyzed: ngo bo nyid du rtogs pa la sogs pa dang bral ba'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa'o//
translated: It is non-conceptual because it is free from the conceptualization of an entity, etc.

original: rnam pa 'di gnyis nyid kyis ni zhi ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di gnyis nyid kyis ni zhi ba'o //
translated: It is tranquil by virtue of these two aspects.

original: mnyam pa nyid du ro gcig pa nyid ni don dam pa'i rnam pa nyid dang / ro gcig par 'jug pa nyid dang / de bzhin du thog ma dad bar ma dang tha mar sa dang sa rnams la zhi gnas kyi lam 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid du ro gcig pa nyid ni don dam pa'i rnam pa nyid dang / ro gcig par 'jug pa nyid dang / de bzhin du thog ma dad bar ma dang tha mar sa dang sa rnams la zhi gnas kyi lam 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: The sameness of taste in sameness is the ultimate aspect, the entry into sameness, and likewise, the entry into the path of serenity in the stages, from the first to the last.

original: lhag mthong rnam pa bzhi yang thabs kyi rgyu nyid dang / rab tu dbye bas rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag mthong rnam pa bzhi yang thabs kyi rgyu nyid dang / rab tu dbye bas rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
translated: The four aspects of insight are to be established by way of cause and method, and by way of differentiation.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i zhi gnas la brten nas don dam pa pa dang / brdar btags pa'i shes pas bsdus pa'i lhag mthong bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i zhi gnas la brten nas don dam pa pa dang / brdar btags pa'i shes pas bsdus pa'i lhag mthong bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should cultivate insight by means of the knowledge that is included in the conventional and the ultimate, in dependence on the serenity as it has been explained.

original: rgyu'i sgo nas rnam par gcig rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i sgo nas rnam par gcig rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
translated: It is to be established by way of cause and by way of differentiation.

original: don dam pa'i ye shes kyis bsdus pa ni mtha' gnyis rnam par spangs pa'i sgo nas rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: don dam pa'i ye shes kyis bsdus pa ni mtha' gnyis rnam par spangs pa'i sgo nas rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: The ultimate is twofold, in terms of the abandonment of the two extremes.

original: kun rdzob kyi shes pa'i sgo nas bsdus pa ni tshad med pa'i dbye ba'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi shes pa'i sgo nas bsdus pa ni tshad med pa'i dbye ba'i tshul gyis so //
translated: The conventional is included in terms of the method of the division of the immeasurables.

original: de lta bu'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dag bsgoms pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar smras pa /üîΩyang dag par 'thob @232a * //
analyzed: de lta bu'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dag bsgoms pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar smras pa / yang dag par 'thob @232a * //
translated: By cultivating such ≈õamatha and vipa≈õyanƒÅ, one attains unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: pa'i bar du 'jug ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: pa'i bar du 'jug ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is said that one enters up to the attainment of perfect enlightenment.

original: thabs la mkhas pas zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom par bya'o zhes bya bar de'i rjes la thabs mkhas pas bstan to //
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pas zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom par bya'o zhes bya bar de'i rjes la thabs mkhas pas bstan to //
translated: After that, skillful means is taught, saying that one should cultivate ≈õamatha and vipa≈õyanƒÅ with skillful means.

original: gzhan du thabs la mkhas pa med par zhi gnas dang lhag mthong sgom par byed pa ni 'gog pa mngon sum du byed par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du thabs la mkhas pa med par zhi gnas dang lhag mthong sgom par byed pa ni 'gog pa mngon sum du byed par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, without skillful means, cultivating ≈õamatha and vipa≈õyanƒÅ would lead to actualizing cessation.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par byed pa'i thabs ma yin pa'i chos ni drug go //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par byed pa'i thabs ma yin pa'i chos ni drug go //
translated: The six aspects of their antidotes are the skills in means.üîΩThey are: (1) affection for sentient beings, (2) seeing the faults of cyclic existence, (3) seeing the benefits of attaining nirvana, (4) abandoning cyclic existence which is based on both of those, (5) not being discouraged by the suffering of sentient beings, and (6) not being discouraged by the suffering of the path.üîΩThe six dharmas which are not the means of ripening the Buddha dharmas are:üîΩ(1) affection for sentient beings, (2) seeing the faults of cyclic existence, (3) seeing the benefits of attaining nirvana, (4) abandoning cyclic existence which is based on both of those, (5) not being discouraged by the suffering of sentient beings, and (6) not being discouraged by the suffering of the path.

original: de'i gnyen po'i phyogs rnam pa drug ni thabs la mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: de'i gnyen po'i phyogs rnam pa drug ni thabs la mkhas pa ste /
translated: The six aspects of their antidotes are the skills in means.

original: sems can rnams la nyon mongs pa can gyi snying brtse ba dang / 'khor ba'i nyes dmigs la blta ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i phan yon mthong ba dang / de dag gnyi ga la brten pa'i 'khor ba yongs su spong ba dang /üîΩkun du rmongs pa la brten pa dang / le los brtson 'grus mi rtsom pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la nyon mongs pa can gyi snying brtse ba dang / 'khor ba'i nyes dmigs la blta ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i phan yon mthong ba dang / de dag gnyi ga la brten pa'i 'khor ba yongs su spong ba dang / kun du rmongs pa la brten pa dang / le los brtson 'grus mi rtsom pa'o //
translated: They are: (1) affection for sentient beings, (2) seeing the faults of cyclic existence, (3) seeing the benefits of attaining nirvana, (4) abandoning cyclic existence which is based on both of those, (5) not being discouraged by the suffering of sentient beings, and (6) not being discouraged by the suffering of the path.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi snying brtse ba'i gnyen por smras pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi snying brtse ba'i gnyen por smras pa /
translated: The antidote to affection for sentient beings is stated in:üîΩ‚ÄúOne should see that they are endowed with compassion.‚Äù

original: snying rje dang ldan par blta ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //üîΩde bzhin du ji ltar rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: snying rje dang ldan par blta ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // de bzhin du ji ltar rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: And so on.üîΩOne should apply them as appropriate.

original: thabs la mkhas pa 'di dag ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum du gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa 'di dag ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum du gzhag par bya ste /
translated: These skills in means are to be established in brief as threefold:

original: shes rab dang thabs mi 'gal bar 'jug pa nyid dang / 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa mi 'gal bar bsgrub pa nyid dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / brtson 'grus brtsams pa mi 'gal bar 'jug pa nyid do //
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs mi 'gal bar 'jug pa nyid dang / 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa mi 'gal bar bsgrub pa nyid dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / brtson 'grus brtsams pa mi 'gal bar 'jug pa nyid do //
translated: the non-contradictory engagement of wisdom and means;  the accomplishment of samsara and nirvana as non-contradictory;  the non-contradictory engagement of the absence of defilement and the undertaking of striving;

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa can yin yang nyon mongs pa dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir brtson 'grus 'bar bar gyur pa ste /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa can yin yang nyon mongs pa dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir brtson 'grus 'bar bar gyur pa ste /
translated: and even though he is defiled, he is ablaze with striving in order to become undefiled.

original: byang chub sems dpa' kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral bzhin du brtson 'grus 'bar ba dang ldan pa 'di ni thabs la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral bzhin du brtson 'grus 'bar ba dang ldan pa 'di ni thabs la mkhas pa'o //
translated: This is the skill in means of the bodhisattva who, even though he is undefiled, is ablaze with striving.

original: 'bras bu tshad med pa yongs su 'dzin pa dang / de bzhin du bsod nams tshad med pa yongs su 'dzin pa dang / sems can rnam pa bzhi la yang dag pa'i sgrub pa rnam pa bzhi'i dbang du byas nas smras pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu tshad med pa yongs su 'dzin pa dang / de bzhin du bsod nams tshad med pa yongs su 'dzin pa dang / sems can rnam pa bzhi la yang dag pa'i sgrub pa rnam pa bzhi'i dbang du byas nas smras pa'o //
translated: He embraces immeasurable results, and likewise he embraces immeasurable merit.

original: gzhan yang thabs la mkhas pa rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang thabs la mkhas pa rnam pa drug ste /
translated: Moreover, there is a sixfold skill in means:

original: dngos po dang zhing dag chung ngu dag las dge ba chung du bskyed pa las /
analyzed: dngos po dang zhing dag chung ngu dag las dge ba chung du bskyed pa las /
translated: From small things, objects, and fields, one generates small virtues.

original: yongs su bsngo ba'i khyad par gyi sbyor bas 'bras bu tshad med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yongs su bsngo ba'i khyad par gyi sbyor bas 'bras bu tshad med par 'gyur ro //
translated: But through the application of the distinctive dedication, the result becomes immeasurable.

original: de ni gzhung nyid las don go bar zad de /üîΩsdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa dang / nor zad pa dang bral bas bde ba dang / yid bde ba'i sgo nas bsod nams mang po la @232b yang dag par sbyor ba ni bsod nams tshad med pa yongs su 'dzin to //
analyzed: de ni gzhung nyid las don go bar zad de / sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa dang / nor zad pa dang bral bas bde ba dang / yid bde ba'i sgo nas bsod nams mang po la @232b yang dag par sbyor ba ni bsod nams tshad med pa yongs su 'dzin to //
translated: This is understood from the text itself.üîΩOne who is happy and joyful, and who is free from suffering, mental unhappiness, agitation, and loss of wealth, is connected with much merit.

original: de las 'dun pa bzlog cing zhes pa mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu ster ba thabs ma yin pa de las bzlog nas tshegs chung zhing 'bras bu che ba'i yang dag par blangs ba la 'dzud de /

translated: Having turned away from that which is not a method for bestowing the desired result, one introduces them to the correct practice which has little difficulty and great result.

original: de ltar na 'bad pa chung dus dge ba'i rtsa ba rgya chen po yang dag par skyed par byed do //üîΩyang dka' spyad kyi dka' thub kyis don med pa la zhugs pa'i sems can rnams la de las 'dun pa bzlog nas bde ba rjes su 'jug pa 'bras bu che ba de dag la ston par byed do //

translated: In that way, with little effort, one generates a great root of virtue.üîΩMoreover, for sentient beings who are engaged in pointless austerities, one turns away their aspiration from that and teaches them the great result of the practice of happiness.

original: yang mtho ris 'dod cing bde 'gro'i lam las nyams pas tshul ma yin pa'i sgor zhugs pas ngal bar gyur pa rnams la tshul dang mthun pa'i lugs 'jig rten gnyi gar bde ba'i lam ston par byed do //

translated: Moreover, for those who desire high status and who are exhausted by engaging in improper doors due to having fallen from the path of happy rebirth, one teaches the path of happiness in both this life and the next, which is the proper way.

original: yang dag par bya ba'i bsam pas yongs su ngal bar gyur cing don med pa'i bstan bcos la lhag par mos pa rnams sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la 'dzud cing yang dag par ston par byed do //

translated: And they lead them to the knowledge that by merely attending to the special features of the objects of knowledge with the eye of knowledge, one generates immeasurable and vast merit.üîΩThis is taught in the sutras, beginning with ‚Äúseeing all conditioned things as impermanent‚Äù and ending with ‚Äúthis has a much greater result.‚Äù
