original: ha cang yang rgyas ches pa rnams zhes bya ba ni rgyas par bstan pas 'jigs pa rnams la snying po'i don dang yi ge mdor bsdus pa'i bya bas yang dang yang du bstan pa byas pas blo dman pa rnams rjes su gzung ba'o //
analyzed: ha cang yang rgyas ches pa rnams zhes bya ba ni rgyas par bstan pas 'jigs pa rnams la snying po'i don dang yi ge mdor bsdus pa'i bya bas yang dang yang du bstan pa byas pas blo dman pa rnams rjes su gzung ba'o //
translated: The very extensive is for those who are afraid of the extensive explanation, and the brief is for those who are afraid of the very extensive. The repeated is for those who are afraid of the brief, and the not repeated is for those who are afraid of the repeated. The condensed is for those who are afraid of the extensive, and the expanded is for those who are afraid of the condensed.

original: rnam pa bzhis de bzhin gshegs pas bstan pa'i chos 'dul ba don dang yi ges rtogs par bya ba'i phyir bstan pa la sogs pas ston par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhis de bzhin gshegs pas bstan pa'i chos 'dul ba don dang yi ges rtogs par bya ba'i phyir bstan pa la sogs pas ston par shes par bya'o //
translated: By these four, the TathƒÅgata's teaching of the Dharma and Vinaya should be understood to be taught by means of teaching, etc., in order to be understood by meaning and letters.

original: mdor bstan pa dang dran par bya ba'i phyir yi ge bsgrub pa'o /
analyzed: mdor bstan pa dang dran par bya ba'i phyir yi ge bsgrub pa'o /
translated: The letters are established for the sake of brief indication and recollection.

original: phyin ci ma log par gzung ba dang / dran pas len pa dang go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log par gzung ba dang / dran pas len pa dang go rims bzhin no //
translated: They are to be grasped without error, and are to be taken up by means of mindfulness, respectively.

original: dris pa'i lan gdab pa dang / don bstan pa nyid ni don nye bar bsgrub pa ste /
analyzed: dris pa'i lan gdab pa dang / don bstan pa nyid ni don nye bar bsgrub pa ste /
translated: The answer to the question and the teaching of the meaning is the establishment of the meaning.

original: the tshom dang / mi shes pa gnyis kyi gnyen po'i phyogs so //
analyzed: the tshom dang / mi shes pa gnyis kyi gnyen po'i phyogs so //
translated: It is the antidote to both doubt and ignorance.

original: 'jug pa'i sgo zhes bya ba ni mi sdug pa bsgom pa la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo nas so //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i sgo zhes bya ba ni mi sdug pa bsgom pa la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo nas so //
translated: The gateway to entry is the gateway of samadhi, such as the cultivation of repulsiveness.

original: don dam pa nye bar sbas pa'i phyir shin tu zab pa'i chos ston pa dang / bdag med pa gsal bar byed pas stong pa nyid dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa nye bar sbas pa'i phyir shin tu zab pa'i chos ston pa dang / bdag med pa gsal bar byed pas stong pa nyid dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It is endowed with emptiness because it teaches the extremely profound Dharma by concealing the ultimate and because it illuminates selflessness.

original: dgongs pa dang bcas pa'i tshig gis bstan pas na dgongs pa'i don zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dgongs pa dang bcas pa'i tshig gis bstan pas na dgongs pa'i don zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is called the meaning of the intention because it is taught with words that have an intention.

original: mdo sde gang dag las zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin med pa la sogs par ston pa rnams so //
analyzed: mdo sde gang dag las zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin med pa la sogs par ston pa rnams so //
translated: The sutras that say... means those that teach the absence of intrinsic nature and so forth.

original: nyan thos kyi theg par ni chos rnams kyi ngo bo la sogs pas bstan to zhes bya bas dngos po la mngon par zhen pa nyid 'jig pa'i sems kyis 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa ma yin no zhes rab tu spong bar byed do //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg par ni chos rnams kyi ngo bo la sogs pas bstan to zhes bya bas dngos po la mngon par zhen pa nyid 'jig pa'i sems kyis 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa ma yin no zhes rab tu spong bar byed do //
translated: In the ≈örƒÅvaka Vehicle, the nature of phenomena and so on are taught, and so they are attached to things. With a mind that destroys, they reject this, saying, ‚ÄúThis is not the teaching of the TathƒÅgata.‚Äù

original: de dag las mthun pa dang / 'gal ba med pa dang / dgongs pa dang bcas pa'i don ston par byed /
analyzed: de dag las mthun pa dang / 'gal ba med pa dang / dgongs pa dang bcas pa'i don ston par byed /
translated: From among those, they teach the meaning that is consistent, non-contradictory, and intentional.

original: 'dzin du 'jug go //
analyzed: 'dzin du 'jug go //
translated: They make them take it up.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: 'di ltar chos 'di dag ni thams cad kyi @234b thams cad du med pa ma yin gyi zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bor 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos 'di dag ni thams cad kyi @234b thams cad du med pa ma yin gyi zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bor 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Thus, these phenomena are not completely non-existent, meaning they would become the nature of non-existence.

original: 'on kyang byis pas kun du brtags pa'i ngo bo 'di la med pas ngo bo med pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'on kyang byis pas kun du brtags pa'i ngo bo 'di la med pas ngo bo med pa zhes brjod do //
translated: However, since the nature imagined by the childish does not exist here, it is called ‚Äúnatureless.‚Äù

original: dngos po med pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po med pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is non-existence like?

original: smras pa / dngos po zhes brjod pa ni mngon par brjod pa'i brjod pa'i tshig gi gnas su gyur pa gang la brten nas byis pa rnams kyi brjod pa 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / dngos po zhes brjod pa ni mngon par brjod pa'i brjod pa'i tshig gi gnas su gyur pa gang la brten nas byis pa rnams kyi brjod pa 'jug pa'o //
translated: That which is called an entity is the basis of the verbal expression of verbalization, in dependence upon which the verbalizations of fools operate.

original: de ltar na yang dngos po ni ngag gi yul las 'das par gyur pa'i phyir mngon par brjod pa'i bdag nyid du yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na yang dngos po ni ngag gi yul las 'das par gyur pa'i phyir mngon par brjod pa'i bdag nyid du yod pa ma yin te /
translated: However, since an entity is beyond the domain of speech, it does not exist in the nature of verbalization,

original: don dam pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the nature of the ultimate.

original: de'i phyir ngo bo nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir ngo bo nyid med pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is natureless.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' gos pa med cing spros pa dang bral ba gzugs med pa bya ba thams cad kyi skabs 'byed pa dang rten du gyur pa nyid la glo bur gyi gzugs kyi dri ma dang bral bar gyur na 'od gsal ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' gos pa med cing spros pa dang bral ba gzugs med pa bya ba thams cad kyi skabs 'byed pa dang rten du gyur pa nyid la glo bur gyi gzugs kyi dri ma dang bral bar gyur na 'od gsal ba zhes brjod do //
translated: Just as space, which is unafflicted and free from fabrication, is formless, yet is the basis and the opportunity for all activities, and when it is free from adventitious defilements, it is said to be luminous,

original: de bzhin du brjod du med pa'i yongs su grub pa'i dngos po yang glo bur gyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pas nye bar nyon mongs pa rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyi spros pa dang bcas par snang ba yang rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa dang bral na
analyzed: de bzhin du brjod du med pa'i yongs su grub pa'i dngos po yang glo bur gyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pas nye bar nyon mongs pa rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyi spros pa dang bcas par snang ba yang rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa dang bral na
translated: But when it is free from the proliferation of conceptual thoughts,

original: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba yin te /
translated: it is naturally luminous.

original: de'i phyir nam mkha' dang mtshungs par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir nam mkha' dang mtshungs par bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is taught to be like space.

original: 'du shes rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bor gtogs pa'i spros pa ni khyad par du rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'du shes rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bor gtogs pa'i spros pa ni khyad par du rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The proliferation that belongs to the nature of the conceptualizations of discriminations is the conceptualization of distinctions, etc.

original: de la chags pa ni mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: de la chags pa ni mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: Attachment to that is strong adherence.

original: de ltar na rnam par rtog pa la mngon par zhen cing chags pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: de ltar na rnam par rtog pa la mngon par zhen cing chags pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: Thus, it is said that one is attached to conceptualization and strongly adheres to it.

original: gzugs kyi bya ba'i gnas glo bur bas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs kyi bya ba'i gnas glo bur bas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the activity of form is engaged by the adventitious.

original: rnam par rtog pa 'di rnams ni rang gi dang gis 'jug pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa 'di rnams ni rang gi dang gis 'jug pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that these conceptualizations are free from the conceptualization that engages them by their own intrinsic nature,

original: ye shes 'phags pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe ye shes kyi stobs kyis bsal ba de'i tshe 'phags pa'i mchog byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'phags pa'i mchog gi ye shes yongs su grub pa'i yul gyi ngo bor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ye shes 'phags pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe ye shes kyi stobs kyis bsal ba de'i tshe 'phags pa'i mchog byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'phags pa'i mchog gi ye shes yongs su grub pa'i yul gyi ngo bor 'gyur ro //
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúThe wisdom of the noble ones.‚Äù When the object is illuminated by the power of wisdom, then it becomes the object of the perfected wisdom of the noble ones, the supreme among the bodhisattvas.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: snang ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: snang ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: It appears,

original: 'di las mchog tu gyur pa'i ngo bo med pa ste /
analyzed: 'di las mchog tu gyur pa'i ngo bo med pa ste /
translated: but it is not that there is anything superior to it,

original: de nyid ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that itself is the perfected nature.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: gzhan tshol bar mi byed de zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan tshol bar mi byed de zhes bya'o //
translated: One does not seek anything else.

original: ji ltar sgyu ma dngos po dang dngos po med pa las grol ba'i phyir gnyis su med pa'i rnam pa yin par ltar chos thams cad kyang sgyu ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar sgyu ma dngos po dang dngos po med pa las grol ba'i phyir gnyis su med pa'i rnam pa yin par ltar chos thams cad kyang sgyu ma lta bu'o //
translated: Just as an illusion is nondual in aspect because it is free from being an entity and being a nonentity, so too all phenomena are like an illusion.

original: de ltar na @235a * //
analyzed: de ltar na @235a * //
translated: Thus,

original: gnyis su med pa'i chos nyid kyi rnam pa la gzhan cung zad kyang bsal bar bya ba med de /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i chos nyid kyi rnam pa la gzhan cung zad kyang bsal bar bya ba med de /
translated: In the aspect of the nondual reality, there is nothing else whatsoever to be removed,

original: de tsam du khas blangs pa'i phyir dang / skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de tsam du khas blangs pa'i phyir dang / skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is accepted as just that, and because the extreme of denial is avoided.

original: cung zhig bstan du yang med de /
analyzed: cung zhig bstan du yang med de /
translated: Nor is there anything to be posited,

original: sgro 'dogs pa'i mtha' spangs ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa'i mtha' spangs ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the extreme of fabrication is avoided.

original: de'i rnam grangs nyid ni nyung ngur yang mi byed /
analyzed: de'i rnam grangs nyid ni nyung ngur yang mi byed /
translated: Nor is there any increase or decrease,

original: lhag par yang mi byed ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lhag par yang mi byed ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: as stated in the verse, ‚ÄúNor is there any decrease.‚Äù

original: rnam par 'jig par yang mi byed ces bya ba'i don bstan pa'i phyir yang dag pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'jig par yang mi byed ces bya ba'i don bstan pa'i phyir yang dag pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: In order to demonstrate the meaning of ‚ÄúNor is there any decrease,‚Äù it says, ‚ÄúIn reality,‚Äù and so on.

original: sems can rnam pa dgu la 'dod pa'i don bsgrub par bya ba nyid kyi phyir mngon du lhags pa'i bar chad byed pa ni phan pa'i bsam pa ste /
analyzed: sems can rnam pa dgu la 'dod pa'i don bsgrub par bya ba nyid kyi phyir mngon du lhags pa'i bar chad byed pa ni phan pa'i bsam pa ste /
translated: The obstructive forces that arise in the nine types of sentient beings are the harmful thoughts,

original: mdo las ma dang pha'i bu la re zhig mi ster ba lta bu'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: mdo las ma dang pha'i bu la re zhig mi ster ba lta bu'o zhes bstan to //
translated: because they prevent the attainment of the desired goal, as stated in the sutra, ‚ÄúJust as a mother and father do not give to their child.‚Äù

original: sems can rnam pa dgu ni lus kyi yo byad 'dod pa dang / de dag 'du ba'i sgo 'dod pa dang / bzo'i gnas 'dod pa dang / gnyen 'brel dang 'dris pa 'dod pa dang / grogs byed pa 'dod pa dang / gzhan gyis gnod pa byed pa dang /
analyzed: sems can rnam pa dgu ni lus kyi yo byad 'dod pa dang / de dag 'du ba'i sgo 'dod pa dang / bzo'i gnas 'dod pa dang / gnyen 'brel dang 'dris pa 'dod pa dang / grogs byed pa 'dod pa dang / gzhan gyis gnod pa byed pa dang /
translated: There are nine types of sentient beings who desire physical necessities, who desire the door of assembly, who desire the abode of craftsmanship, who desire relatives and friends, who desire to be helpful, who desire to be free from harm by others,

original: 'jigs shing skrag pa dang / 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa dang phrad pa dang bral bar 'dod pa dang / nad las thar par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: 'jigs shing skrag pa dang / 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa dang phrad pa dang bral bar 'dod pa dang / nad las thar par 'dod pa'o //
translated: who desire to be free from fear, who desire to meet with the desirable and be free from the undesirable, and who desire to be free from illness.

original: nan tur yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: nan tur yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Also, in brief, there are two types of punishment:

original: dgos pa gnyis bsgrub pa'i phyir te dge ba la yang dag par bskul ba'i phyir dang / mi dge ba spang bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgos pa gnyis bsgrub pa'i phyir te dge ba la yang dag par bskul ba'i phyir dang / mi dge ba spang bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: in order to accomplish two aims, in order to instigate virtue and in order to stop non-virtue.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: sdig pa spang ba dang dge ba yang dag par blang ba de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dga' mgur byed pa zhes bya ba ni mngon du lhags pa'i don de gtsor byed pa yin pas de bzhin du sgrub par byed pa zhes bya ba la
analyzed: sdig pa spang ba dang dge ba yang dag par blang ba de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dga' mgur byed pa zhes bya ba ni mngon du lhags pa'i don de gtsor byed pa yin pas de bzhin du sgrub par byed pa zhes bya ba la
translated: In that regard, in accordance with one's desire means that one should accomplish the meaning that has been presented, as it is presented.

original: sogs pa'i don to //
analyzed: sogs pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of and so on is as follows.

original: gal te bsngags pa bzhin mi byed na rjes su mthun par ma byas su zin kyang phan pa'i bsam pa can la kha na ma tho bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir gnod pa byung ba la sogs pa la dus cung zhig btang snyoms su 'jog ste
analyzed: gal te bsngags pa bzhin mi byed na rjes su mthun par ma byas su zin kyang phan pa'i bsam pa can la kha na ma tho bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir gnod pa byung ba la sogs pa la dus cung zhig btang snyoms su 'jog ste
translated: If one does not act in accordance with the praise, then even if one does not act in accordance with it, there is no fault for one who has the intention to benefit. In order to demonstrate this, it says having set aside for a while the occurrence of harm, and so on,

original: gtan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gtan du ni ma yin no //
translated: but not permanently.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it was said:

original: re zhig yal bar 'jog ste yal bar 'dor ba'i bsam pa dang zhes bya ba sogs pa'o //
analyzed: re zhig yal bar 'jog ste yal bar 'dor ba'i bsam pa dang zhes bya ba sogs pa'o //
translated: Having set aside for a while, with the intention to set aside, and so on.

original: mi 'dra ba'i las bstan pa'i phyir slob pa yang med la zhes bya ba sogs pa la /
analyzed: mi 'dra ba'i las bstan pa'i phyir slob pa yang med la zhes bya ba sogs pa la /
translated: In order to demonstrate dissimilar actions, it says there is no training, and so on.

original: de dag la ni mthun pa'i thabs bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de dag la ni mthun pa'i thabs bstan pa'o //
translated: The method of agreement is taught for them.

original: 'on kyang 'dris shing mdza' bshes yin par gyur na de dag mthun pa'i thabs pa'i thabs kyis dge ba la yang dag par 'god par byed do //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'dris shing mdza' bshes yin par gyur na de dag mthun pa'i thabs pa'i thabs kyis dge ba la yang dag par 'god par byed do //
translated: But when they have become familiar and friendly, he establishes them in virtue by means of the methods of concord.

original: de ltar yang dag par @235b bskul yang sgrub par mi byed na de dag la khro ba'i bsam pa bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar yang dag par @235b bskul yang sgrub par mi byed na de dag la khro ba'i bsam pa bstan par bya ste /
translated: If, even though they have been properly urged, they still do not practice, he should show them the attitude of anger.

original: phan pa 'dod pa yin gyi mi mthun pa'i bsam pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phan pa 'dod pa yin gyi mi mthun pa'i bsam pas ni ma yin no //
translated: He should show the attitude of anger for the sake of benefit, not for the sake of enmity.

original: mi mthun pa'i sbyor ba'i bya ba ston pa yin gyi bsam pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i sbyor ba'i bya ba ston pa yin gyi bsam pas ni ma yin no //
translated: He should show the activity of the application of anger, not the attitude of anger.

original: 'jig rten 'di'i dus re zhig pa'i sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba bskyed pa don med pa las zlog par byed kyi /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di'i dus re zhig pa'i sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba bskyed pa don med pa las zlog par byed kyi /
translated: He should turn them away from the useless production of suffering and unhappiness in this world for a while,

original: don mi 'dod pas ni ma yin te bsam pa dag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don mi 'dod pas ni ma yin te bsam pa dag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: not from the useful, because his attitude is pure.

original: de ltar na sems can de dang de dag la bya ba de dang de dag gis bsam pa gzhan gyis sbyor ba gzhan dag ston pa ni bsam pa mi 'dra ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na sems can de dang de dag la bya ba de dang de dag gis bsam pa gzhan gyis sbyor ba gzhan dag ston pa ni bsam pa mi 'dra ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, in regard to this or that sentient being, by this or that activity, he shows another application with another attitude. This is called the variety of attitudes.

original: thabs nyid du bstan pa'i phyir de ni mi mthun pa'i bsam pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: thabs nyid du bstan pa'i phyir de ni mi mthun pa'i bsam pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Since it is taught as a method, it is called the attitude of non-opposition.

original: stobs kyis zil gyis mnan nas 'dul bar byed pa ni nan tur las byung ba'i thabs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: stobs kyis zil gyis mnan nas 'dul bar byed pa ni nan tur las byung ba'i thabs zhes bya'o //
translated: The method that arises from punishment is the method of subduing by overpowering with strength.

original: dge ba yang dag par blangs te gnas so zhes bya ba ni gzhan la gnod pa med pa'i thabs kyis dgongs pa sgrub par nus pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dge ba yang dag par blangs te gnas so zhes bya ba ni gzhan la gnod pa med pa'i thabs kyis dgongs pa sgrub par nus pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The method of taking up virtue is the method of accomplishing the intention by means of a method that does not harm others. This is the meaning of able to accomplish.

original: phan pa byas pa dag la lan du phan gdags par 'dod ba phan 'dogs pa la 'jug pa ni lan ldon pa'i thabs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phan pa byas pa dag la lan du phan gdags par 'dod ba phan 'dogs pa la 'jug pa ni lan ldon pa'i thabs zhes bya'o //
translated: The method of repayment is the engagement in benefiting those who have benefited, desiring to repay them.

original: phan 'dogs pa bstan pa'i phyir zang zing gi sbyin pa dang / mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa dang / yid la re ba yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir dang / nad rab tu zhi bar byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa bstan pa'i phyir zang zing gi sbyin pa dang / mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa dang / yid la re ba yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir dang / nad rab tu zhi bar byed pa nyid do //
translated: In order to demonstrate benefiting, there is the giving of material things, the giving of fearlessness, the fulfillment of wishes, and the pacification of illness.

original: sems can de dag la byas pa la lan ldon par 'dod pas thabs shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can de dag la byas pa la lan ldon par 'dod pas thabs shes par bya'o //
translated: One should know the method of repaying those sentient beings who have benefited.

original: mthar thug pa thob pa'i phyir rnam par dag pa'i thabs zhes brjod do //

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod yul ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ngo //

translated: The vow to cultivate the immeasurables with the attitude of loving kindness toward all beings, etc., is the vow of the domain of the cultivation of the immeasurables.

analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas yang dag par bsdus pa gang yin pa ni yang dag pa'i smon lam ste /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi mchod pa dang rim gro bya ba tshad med pa dag go zhes bya bar gzung bar bya'o //

analyzed: ston pa nyid mchog gi rnam pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: skad cig gcig la 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gsum @240b mthong la zhes bya ba la skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'gag pa'o //
analyzed: skad cig gcig la 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gsum @240b mthong la zhes bya ba la skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'gag pa'o //
translated: The three characteristics are arising, enduring, and ceasing.üîΩAfter the moment, the fourth characteristic of conditioned phenomena is called aging.

original: skad cig gi 'og tu 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid bzhi pa zhes bya ba ni sngar gyi mtshan nyid rnams la ltos nas gzhan du rnam par gzhag pa ni rga ba yin no zhes byas nas so //
analyzed: skad cig gi 'og tu 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid bzhi pa zhes bya ba ni sngar gyi mtshan nyid rnams la ltos nas gzhan du rnam par gzhag pa ni rga ba yin no zhes byas nas so //
translated: The three characteristics are established as different from each other based on each other.

original: 'du byed kyi skad cig dang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid sbyar bar bya'o//
analyzed: 'du byed kyi skad cig dang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid sbyar bar bya'o//
translated: The first moment of conditioned phenomena and so on should be applied to the characteristics.

original: des na skye ba ni dngos po sngon med pa'i 'byung ba'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na skye ba ni dngos po sngon med pa'i 'byung ba'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, arising is the appearance of a previously non-existent entity.

original: skyes pa rang gi mtshan nyid kyi gnas skabs na de'i dus na ma nyams pa ni gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skyes pa rang gi mtshan nyid kyi gnas skabs na de'i dus na ma nyams pa ni gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That which has arisen, in the state of its own characteristic, undiminished at that time, is called enduring.

original: sngar 'gags pa de la ltos nas zhes bya ba ni rga ba ni gzhan du 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid can te /
analyzed: sngar 'gags pa de la ltos nas zhes bya ba ni rga ba ni gzhan du 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid can te /
translated: In dependence on that which has ceased before, aging is the characteristic of transformation.

original: gzhan du 'gyur ba yang sngon dang phyi ma'i khyad par gyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur ba yang sngon dang phyi ma'i khyad par gyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: And the characteristic of the otherness of the prior and subsequent moments is the transformation of the thing.

original: des na skad cig de nyid gzhan du 'gyur ba'i khyad par ni dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na skad cig de nyid gzhan du 'gyur ba'i khyad par ni dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the difference of the very moment of the thing in its transformation is not perceived.üîΩTherefore, it is said:

original: de'i phyir / de bzhin gnas pas rgas mi 'grub //
analyzed: de'i phyir / de bzhin gnas pas rgas mi 'grub //
translated: The thing does not age because it remains as it is.

original: gzhan du gyur na gzhan nyid yin //
analyzed: gzhan du gyur na gzhan nyid yin //
translated: If it were to age, it would be other.

original: de phyir chos ni gcig nyid la //
analyzed: de phyir chos ni gcig nyid la //
translated: Therefore, in the case of a single thing,

original: rgas zhes bya ba dmigs pa med //üîΩces bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rgas zhes bya ba dmigs pa med // ces bstan pa yin no //
translated: the so-called aging is not perceived.

original: rga ba ni rnam pa gnyis te nye bar 'gro ba'i rga ba dang / yongs su dbye ba dang bcas pa'i rga ba'o //
analyzed: rga ba ni rnam pa gnyis te nye bar 'gro ba'i rga ba dang / yongs su dbye ba dang bcas pa'i rga ba'o //
translated: Aging is twofold: the aging of the approach and the aging with the differentiation.

original: de gnyis ka'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: de gnyis ka'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: With reference to both of these, it is said:

original: gzhan nam gzhan du gyur pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan nam gzhan du gyur pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhat is other or what has become other.‚Äù

original: yang de nyid don gzhan du bstan pa ni gzhan nam zhes bya ba ni 'dra bar 'byung ba'i dus su'o //
analyzed: yang de nyid don gzhan du bstan pa ni gzhan nam zhes bya ba ni 'dra bar 'byung ba'i dus su'o //
translated: Again, the same point is taught in a different way: ‚ÄúWhat is other‚Äù refers to the time of the arising of the similar class.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo nyams pa dang / rang go ngo bo rab tu zhi pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo nyams pa dang / rang go ngo bo rab tu zhi pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise‚Äù means that it is not in its own nature, nor is it in the pacification of its own nature.

original: de ltar na mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag nas mtshan nyid 'di dag la sde ba gzhag dag gis 'dod pas dbang gis btags pa'i rdzas kyi khyad par dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar na mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag nas mtshan nyid 'di dag la sde ba gzhag dag gis 'dod pas dbang gis btags pa'i rdzas kyi khyad par dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, having established the characteristics, in order to refute the substantial particularities that are imagined by the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas, who maintain that these characteristics exist as real entities, he says,

original: ngo bo nyid yang dag par mthong ba gang yin pa de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid yang dag par mthong ba gang yin pa de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la //
translated: ‚ÄúThe correct seeing of the nature of that . . .‚Äù

original: ngo bo zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa las gzhan par 'dod pa la 'gog par byed do //
analyzed: ngo bo zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa las gzhan par 'dod pa la 'gog par byed do //
translated: ‚ÄúNature‚Äù is a denial of the belief that it is different from form, etc.

original: da ni skye ba la sogs pa las gzhan pa'i 'jig pa med par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni skye ba la sogs pa las gzhan pa'i 'jig pa med par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that there is no destruction apart from arising, etc., he says,

original: de'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: ‚ÄúThe nature of that . . .‚Äù

original: de dag ni mtshan nyid kyi gnas skabs kyi khyad par gyis rab tu phye ba'i phyir dngos po dang dngos bo med pa gnyis su rnam par gzhag go// mdo las mtshan nyid gsum rnam par gzhag pa bstan pa'i phyir mtshan nyid bzhi po de dag ces bya ba
analyzed: de dag ni mtshan nyid kyi gnas skabs kyi khyad par gyis rab tu phye ba'i phyir dngos po dang dngos bo med pa gnyis su rnam par gzhag go// mdo las mtshan nyid gsum rnam par gzhag pa bstan pa'i phyir mtshan nyid bzhi po de dag ces bya ba
translated: Since they are distinguished by the particularities of the state of characteristics, they are posited as both things and nonthings.

original: la sogs pa la /
analyzed: la sogs pa la /
translated: In order to demonstrate the teaching of the three characteristics in the s≈´tras, he says, ‚ÄúThose four characteristics,‚Äù and so on.

original: yod ba gang yin pa de ni zhes bya ba la skyes pa ni bdag gi lus kyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir skye ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yod ba gang yin pa de ni zhes bya ba la skyes pa ni bdag gi lus kyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir skye ba zhes bya ste /
translated: That which exists is called ‚Äúarising,‚Äù because the arising of the body is the characteristic of the self.

original: @241a * // mngon par 'grub pa zhes byas nas so //
analyzed: @241a * // mngon par 'grub pa zhes byas nas so //
translated: It is called ‚Äúestablishment.‚Äù

original: ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni zhes bya ba ni 'gag pa ste /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni zhes bya ba ni 'gag pa ste /
translated: That which is the essence is called ‚Äúcessation,‚Äù

original: de'i ngo bo med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo med pa nyid do //
translated: because it is the nonexistence of that essence.

original: skad cig so so la skye ba dang 'jig pa dang ldan pas 'jug pa na 'du byed kyi rgyun gzhan du 'gyur ba ni mtshan nyid gsum pa'o //
analyzed: skad cig so so la skye ba dang 'jig pa dang ldan pas 'jug pa na 'du byed kyi rgyun gzhan du 'gyur ba ni mtshan nyid gsum pa'o //
translated: Since it possesses arising and disintegration in every moment, the transformation of the continuum of formations is the third characteristic.

original: de ltar gnas skabs gsum bstan pa'i phyir gsum du bstan te /
analyzed: de ltar gnas skabs gsum bstan pa'i phyir gsum du bstan te /
translated: Thus the three states are taught, and for that reason, three characteristics are taught.

original: 'dus byas zhes bya ba med pa las byung ba dang / byung ba nyams par 'gyur ba dang / de'i rgyun zhes bya ba 'jug pa gzhan du 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'dus byas zhes bya ba med pa las byung ba dang / byung ba nyams par 'gyur ba dang / de'i rgyun zhes bya ba 'jug pa gzhan du 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The three characteristics are taught in terms of the three kinds of impermanence: the conditioned means that which arises from what does not exist, arising means the deterioration of what has arisen, and continuance means the transformation of the process.

original: mi rtag pa rnam pa gsum gyi dbang du byas nas mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa rnam pa gsum gyi dbang du byas nas mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The three characteristics are taught in terms of the three kinds of impermanence.

original: dngos po snga na med pa'i mi rtag pa dang / dngos po rnam par 'gyur ba'i mi rtag pa dang / dngos po 'gag pa'i mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po snga na med pa'i mi rtag pa dang / dngos po rnam par 'gyur ba'i mi rtag pa dang / dngos po 'gag pa'i mi rtag pa'o //
translated: Impermanence is threefold: impermanence as the nonexistence of what previously existed, impermanence as the transformation of what exists, and impermanence as the cessation of what exists.

original: mtshan nyid de dag kyang rdzas nyid du yod par 'dod pa la tshad ma med par bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: mtshan nyid de dag kyang rdzas nyid du yod par 'dod pa la tshad ma med par bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Since the existence of those characteristics as real entities is unacceptable, it is said that there is no valid cognition to prove it.

original: de la byang chub sems dpas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The bodhisattva, having seen with the eye of wisdom that all conditioned things are impermanent, should practice the discipline of non-production.

original: des 'du byed tsam zhig 'byung bar dmigs par zad ces bya bas ni ngo bo nyid med par mngon sum gyi tshad mas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: des 'du byed tsam zhig 'byung bar dmigs par zad ces bya bas ni ngo bo nyid med par mngon sum gyi tshad mas bstan pa yin no //
translated: The phrase, he observes only the occurrence of mere conditioning, demonstrates the valid cognition of direct perception of realitylessness.

original: de ltar na skye ba la sogs pa rnams mngon sum gyi tshad mas ngo bo nyid nges par gzung bar mi nus pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na skye ba la sogs pa rnams mngon sum gyi tshad mas ngo bo nyid nges par gzung bar mi nus pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, arising and so on cannot be ascertained by the valid cognition of direct perception.

original: rigs pas dpyad na zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pas kyang bya ba mi dmigs par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rigs pas dpyad na zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pas kyang bya ba mi dmigs par bstan pa yin no //
translated: ‚Äú When analyzed by reasoning‚Äù means that activity is not observed even by inference.

original: de ltar ngo bo nyid dang / bya ba nges par mi dmigs pas rdzas nyid du med do zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de ltar ngo bo nyid dang / bya ba nges par mi dmigs pas rdzas nyid du med do zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin no //
translated: ‚Äú Since the entity and activity are not observed,‚Äù this is the nature.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i rigs pas rnam par dgrol pa ni gal te gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i rigs pas rnam par dgrol pa ni gal te gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: ‚Äú When analyzed by the reasoning of inference‚Äù means that if form and so on

original: gzugs kyi skye ba gzugs las gzhan nyid du 'gyur na ni tshor ba la sogs pa bzhin du dngos po tha dad du skye bar thal par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs kyi skye ba gzugs las gzhan nyid du 'gyur na ni tshor ba la sogs pa bzhin du dngos po tha dad du skye bar thal par 'gyur ro //
translated: are different from the entity of form, it follows that they would arise as different things, like feeling and so on.

original: 'dod pa kho na yin pas gnod pa med do zhes bya bar gzhan gyi 'dod pa bkod nas smras pa /
analyzed: 'dod pa kho na yin pas gnod pa med do zhes bya bar gzhan gyi 'dod pa bkod nas smras pa /
translated: Since that is asserted, there is no fault. Having set forth the assertion of others, he says:

original: de lta na ni 'du byed kyi skye ba gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'du byed kyi skye ba gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In that case, the arising of the arising of that arising is the third arising.

original: chos kyi skye ba yang gzhan yin la skye ba'i skye ba yang gzhan yin pas de chos brgyad dang gcig la 'jug par byed do zhes rnam par 'jog par byed pas de dag ni skye ba gnyis 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi skye ba yang gzhan yin la skye ba'i skye ba yang gzhan yin pas de chos brgyad dang gcig la 'jug par byed do zhes rnam par 'jog par byed pas de dag ni skye ba gnyis 'dod pa yin no //
translated: The arising of formations is one thing, and the arising of arising is another. Thus, they posit that the arising of arising engages one dharma and one arising.

original: de'i phyogs la skyon bstan pa'i phyir de la 'du byed kyi skye ba de zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de'i phyogs la skyon bstan pa'i phyir de la 'du byed kyi skye ba de zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In order to demonstrate the error in his position, the root text states, ‚ÄúIn that case, the arising of that arising of formations . . . ‚Äù

original: 'du byed kyi skye ba dang / skye ba'i skye ba de tha dad pa yin nam gcig nyid yin /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi skye ba dang / skye ba'i skye ba de tha dad pa yin nam gcig nyid yin /
translated: Is the arising of formations and the arising of arising different or the same?

original: rnam par rtog pa gsum pa ni med do //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gsum pa ni med do //
translated: There is no third alternative.

original: @241b gcig nyid yin na ni don tha dad par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: @241b gcig nyid yin na ni don tha dad par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: If they are the same, it is illogical for them to be different things.

original: de dag skye ba gcig gis rab tu phye ba'i lus yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag skye ba gcig gis rab tu phye ba'i lus yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are bodies that are distinguished by a single arising.

original: tha dad pa yin na ni gzugs kyi skye ba zhes tha snyad du gdags par mi rigs te /
analyzed: tha dad pa yin na ni gzugs kyi skye ba zhes tha snyad du gdags par mi rigs te /
translated: If they are different, it is illogical to designate them as the arising of form.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: the nature of feeling, etc.

original: ji ltar gzugs las gzhan pa'i tshor ba la sogs pa'i skye ba gcig pa ma yin pa de bzhin du 'dus byas kyi ngo bo dang / skye ba yang rigs pa'i lam 'dis rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs las gzhan pa'i tshor ba la sogs pa'i skye ba gcig pa ma yin pa de bzhin du 'dus byas kyi ngo bo dang / skye ba yang rigs pa'i lam 'dis rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
translated: Just as feeling, etc., are not the same in arising as form is, so also the nature of the conditioned and arising should be established by this path of reasoning.

original: de bzhin du rga ba la sogs pa la yang ci rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rga ba la sogs pa la yang ci rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Aging, etc., should be applied in the same way, as appropriate.

original: 'jig pa yang don tha dad pa zhig yin par gyur na nyes pa 'phel ba bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: 'jig pa yang don tha dad pa zhig yin par gyur na nyes pa 'phel ba bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: If destruction were a different object, the fault would increase.

original: gal te 'jig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'jig pa yang don tha dad par gyur pa zhig yin na ni tha dad du gyur pa'i skye ba dang 'jig pa 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'jig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'jig pa yang don tha dad par gyur pa zhig yin na ni tha dad du gyur pa'i skye ba dang 'jig pa 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: If destruction were a different object, then arising and destruction would be different.

original: de dag la skye ba yod par gyur na ni de 'gag par yang 'gyur bas de nyams par 'gyur ba yang 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras pa /
analyzed: de dag la skye ba yod par gyur na ni de 'gag par yang 'gyur bas de nyams par 'gyur ba yang 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras pa /
translated: If they had arising, they would also have cessation, and so their deterioration would be obtained.

original: 'du byed thams cad 'gag par 'gyur te zhes bya ba la phyogs de khas len par byed na skyon bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩde lta na ni tshegs chung ngus zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad 'gag par 'gyur te zhes bya ba la phyogs de khas len par byed na skyon bstan pa'i phyir / de lta na ni tshegs chung ngus zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: If you accept that position, then the error would be as follows.

original: tshegs chung ngus zhes bya ba ni mthar gyis 'jug pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu la ma ltos par yang so so'i skye bo thams cad kyis kyang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ltar sems dang sems las byung ba 'gog pa 'thob par 'gyur ro //üîΩji ltar 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa sems dang sems las byung ba 'gags pas rab tu phye ba yin pa ltar 'jig pa skye bar gyur pa yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: tshegs chung ngus zhes bya ba ni mthar gyis 'jug pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu la ma ltos par yang so so'i skye bo thams cad kyis kyang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ltar sems dang sems las byung ba 'gog pa 'thob par 'gyur ro // ji ltar 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa sems dang sems las byung ba 'gags pas rab tu phye ba yin pa ltar 'jig pa skye bar gyur pa yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ste /
translated: If that were so, then all ordinary beings would obtain the cessation of mind and mental factors without relying on the nine meditative attainments that are entered serially, since they would obtain the meditative attainment of cessation through little effort.üîΩJust as the meditative attainment of cessation is distinguished by the cessation of mind and mental factors, so too would the world come to an end.üîΩJust as the meditative attainment of cessation is distinguished by the cessation of mind and mental factors, so too would the world come to an end.

original: ji ltar 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang bral bar gyur ba'i gnas skabs na sems dang sems las byung ba 'jug pa ltar /
analyzed: ji ltar 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang bral bar gyur ba'i gnas skabs na sems dang sems las byung ba 'jug pa ltar /
translated: Just as mind and mental factors operate in the state of separation from the meditative attainment of cessation, so too they would operate in the state of separation from the meditative attainment of cessation.

original: 'jig pa 'gag par 'gyur ba'i dus na yang skye bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni nyes pa lhag par sogs par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig pa 'gag par 'gyur ba'i dus na yang skye bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni nyes pa lhag par sogs par bstan pa yin no //
translated: Also, when destruction ceases, it would follow that it would arise. This is the presentation of the additional fault.

original: de ltar mtshan nyid rab tu bkag nas 'du byed rnams dus thams cad du yod par rab tu dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar mtshan nyid rab tu bkag nas 'du byed rnams dus thams cad du yod par rab tu dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: Having thus refuted the characteristics, in order to refute the existence of compounded phenomena at all times,

original: rigs kyi bu'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /üîΩdus gsum du yang 'du byed rnams rnam par gnas pa la ngo bo nyid kyis yod par gyur na ni rtag par thal bar 'gyur bas de lta na de dag la 'dod chags dang bral ba dang rnam par grol bar @242a * //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / dus gsum du yang 'du byed rnams rnam par gnas pa la ngo bo nyid kyis yod par gyur na ni rtag par thal bar 'gyur bas de lta na de dag la 'dod chags dang bral ba dang rnam par grol bar @242a * //
translated: the root text says, ‚ÄúSon of noble family, if compounded phenomena existed inherently, they would have to be permanent.‚Äù

original: yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If compounded phenomena were to exist essentially in a state of abiding in the three temporal periods, it would follow that they are permanent. In that case, it would not be tenable that one could become free from attachment to them and be liberated.

original: bzlog pas bstan pa'i phyir de las bzlog pa ni rung ste zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bzlog pas bstan pa'i phyir de las bzlog pa ni rung ste zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to indicate the opposite, the text says, ‚ÄúThe opposite of this is tenable.‚Äù

original: ther zug ma yin pa dang mi rtag par mthong bas ni 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / rnam par grol bar yang rung ngo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ther zug ma yin pa dang mi rtag par mthong bas ni 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / rnam par grol bar yang rung ngo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Since one sees that they are impermanent and not permanent, it is tenable that one becomes free from attachment and is liberated.

original: ji skad bstan pa'i mi rtag pa nyid kyi rjes su 'brangs nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa'i khyad par bstan pa'i phyir de ltar rnam pa de dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i mi rtag pa nyid kyi rjes su 'brangs nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa'i khyad par bstan pa'i phyir de ltar rnam pa de dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Thus, by these aspects, the bodhisattvas contemplate the suffering of conditioned things.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i 'du byed la gang zag la bdag med pas bdag med par bstan te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i 'du byed la gang zag la bdag med pas bdag med par bstan te /
translated: The non-self of the person is taught in regard to the conditioned things of form, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rang nyid kyis bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir dang // de dag la de las gzhan pa'i mtshan nyid kyang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rang nyid kyis bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir dang // de dag la de las gzhan pa'i mtshan nyid kyang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because form, etc. themselves have the characteristic of non-self, and because they do not have a characteristic other than that.

original: brjod par bya ba'i dngos po thams cad ces bya ba ni brjod par bya ba'i tshig gi gnas la'o //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba'i dngos po thams cad ces bya ba ni brjod par bya ba'i tshig gi gnas la'o //
translated: All things that are expressible means the basis of the words that are expressible.

translated: Moreover, the bodhisattvas, whether childish or

analyzed: nyan thos dag 'di lta bu ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes de tsam la mos par byas nas cung zhig spong ba la mtshams sbyor bas spang bya'i gnyen po thob par bya ba'i phyir gong nas gong du bstan pa'i khyad par la 'jug par mi 'gyur bas

translated: The perfection of their own aim is also twofold:

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul gyi de kho na nyid so sor rig pa dang mthu'i chos rgya cher thob pa'o //
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul gyi de kho na nyid so sor rig pa dang mthu'i chos rgya cher thob pa'o //
translated: they have the insight that is the object of the wisdom that is purified of the obscurations of the knowable, and they have attained the extensive qualities of power.

original: yang na bsam pa nyid dang / sbyor ba nyid kyis gzhan gyi don sgrub pa nyid kyi dbang du byas nas ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos lnga rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: yang na bsam pa nyid dang / sbyor ba nyid kyis gzhan gyi don sgrub pa nyid kyi dbang du byas nas ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos lnga rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Alternatively, the five marvelous and wonderful dharmas are presented from the perspective of their accomplishment of the aims of others through their intention and through their application.

original: bsam pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: bsam pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Their intention is as above.

original: sbyor ba'i sgrub pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sgrub pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Their application is fourfold:

original: bdag nyid sdug bsngal la mi mjed pa dang / gdul bya'i thabs shes pa dang / nyon mongs pa med par sbyor ba dang / skyo ba med par sbyor ba nyid do //
analyzed: bdag nyid sdug bsngal la mi mjed pa dang / gdul bya'i thabs shes pa dang / nyon mongs pa med par sbyor ba dang / skyo ba med par sbyor ba nyid do //
translated: It is not painful for him, he knows the means of conversion, he is free from defilement, and he is free from weariness.

original: thun mong ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni ngo mtshar nyid ston pa ste /
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni ngo mtshar nyid ston pa ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúuncommon‚Äù shows the marvel.

original: bdag nyid la ltos nas ngo mtshar ma yin pa'o //üîΩgzhan la phan pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i sdug @244a * //
analyzed: bdag nyid la ltos nas ngo mtshar ma yin pa'o // gzhan la phan pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i sdug @244a * //
translated: It is not a marvel from the point of view of the bodhisattva himself.

original: bsngal gyi bde ba'i bdag nyid du gyur pa ni ngo mtshar nyid do //
analyzed: bsngal gyi bde ba'i bdag nyid du gyur pa ni ngo mtshar nyid do //
translated: The suffering that arises from the cause of helping others becomes the essence of his happiness.

original: 'jig rten gzhan gyi don la 'dun pa chen po med pa de'i bdag nyid can rnams ni gzhan la phan par bya ba'i phyir sdug bsngal dang du len pa la ngo mtshar ba med pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gzhan gyi don la 'dun pa chen po med pa de'i bdag nyid can rnams ni gzhan la phan par bya ba'i phyir sdug bsngal dang du len pa la ngo mtshar ba med pa'o //
translated: It is a marvel that those who are not intent on the welfare of others, who are not of that nature, would not take up suffering for the sake of helping others.

original: yang na gzhan la phan pa'i phyir sdug bsngal nyid bde ba'i bdag nyid du 'gyur pa ni ngo mtshar ba med pa ste /
analyzed: yang na gzhan la phan pa'i phyir sdug bsngal nyid bde ba'i bdag nyid du 'gyur pa ni ngo mtshar ba med pa ste /
translated: Or, it is not a marvel that suffering becomes the essence of happiness for the sake of helping others.

original: gzhan la brtse ba'i bsam pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan la brtse ba'i bsam pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he has a compassionate attitude toward others.

original: de'i bsam pa can ni sdug bsngal ba khas len pa ni ngo mtshar ba ste /
analyzed: de'i bsam pa can ni sdug bsngal ba khas len pa ni ngo mtshar ba ste /
translated: It is amazing that one who has that attitude accepts suffering,

original: sdug bsngal nyid la sdug bsngal du mi lta ba bzhin du khas len pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal nyid la sdug bsngal du mi lta ba bzhin du khas len pa'o //
translated: just as one accepts suffering itself without seeing it as suffering.

original: de kho na nyid kyi don mthong ba'i shes rab dang ldan pa ni 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i nyes dmigs dang phan yon mthong ba la ngo mtshar che ba med pa dang / de lta na yang sems can la brtse ba'i phyir 'khor bar sgrub par byed pa ngo mtshar che ba dang /
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi don mthong ba'i shes rab dang ldan pa ni 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i nyes dmigs dang phan yon mthong ba la ngo mtshar che ba med pa dang / de lta na yang sems can la brtse ba'i phyir 'khor bar sgrub par byed pa ngo mtshar che ba dang /
translated: One who has the wisdom that sees the meaning of reality has no amazement in seeing the faults of samsara and the benefits of nirvana, and even so, it is amazing that he accomplishes samsara out of compassion for sentient beings.üîΩOr else, it is amazing that he sees the faults of samsara and the virtues of nirvana out of compassion for sentient beings.

original: yang na bzlog nas sems can rnams la brtse bas 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i skyon dang yon tan la blta ba ngo mtshar che ba dang // sems can la brtse ba yin pa'i phyir 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal khas len pa la ngo mtshar che ba med pa'o //
analyzed: yang na bzlog nas sems can rnams la brtse bas 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i skyon dang yon tan la blta ba ngo mtshar che ba dang // sems can la brtse ba yin pa'i phyir 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal khas len pa la ngo mtshar che ba med pa'o //
translated: It is not amazing that he accepts the suffering of samsara out of compassion for sentient beings.

original: dben pa gtsor byed pa la zhugs pas bde ba'i nyams shes bzhin du mi smra ba la ngo mtshar che ba med pa dang / de lta na yang 'du 'dzi'i nang na gnas pa'i sbyor bas chos bstan pa la sbyor ba ngo mtshar che ba dang /
analyzed: dben pa gtsor byed pa la zhugs pas bde ba'i nyams shes bzhin du mi smra ba la ngo mtshar che ba med pa dang / de lta na yang 'du 'dzi'i nang na gnas pa'i sbyor bas chos bstan pa la sbyor ba ngo mtshar che ba dang /
translated: It is surprising that they apply themselves to teaching the Dharma through the application of remaining in the midst of busyness.üîΩIt is not surprising that they teach the Dharma through love for sentient beings.

original: bzlog nas ni sems can rnams la byams pa yin pas chos ston pa ni ngo mtshar mi che ba dang / de lta na yang mi smra ba'i tshul gyis bde ba'i nyams shes pa ngo mtshar che'o //
analyzed: bzlog nas ni sems can rnams la byams pa yin pas chos ston pa ni ngo mtshar mi che ba dang / de lta na yang mi smra ba'i tshul gyis bde ba'i nyams shes pa ngo mtshar che'o //
translated: It is surprising that they know the experience of happiness through the way of not speaking.üîΩIt is not surprising that they dedicate the roots of virtue arising from the perfections to the welfare of sentient beings through their love for sentient beings.

original: sems can rnams la brtse bas sems can rnams kyi don du pha rol tu phyin pa las byung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su bsngo ba ngo mtshar mi che ba dang / cung zad la ltos pas spyod pa ni ngo mtshar che ba dang /
analyzed: sems can rnams la brtse bas sems can rnams kyi don du pha rol tu phyin pa las byung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su bsngo ba ngo mtshar mi che ba dang / cung zad la ltos pas spyod pa ni ngo mtshar che ba dang /
translated: It is surprising that they practice in dependence on a little.üîΩIt is not surprising that they are not discouraged by the faults of sentient beings.

original: gzhan gyi bya ba la rang gi bya bar mthong bas /
analyzed: gzhan gyi bya ba la rang gi bya bar mthong bas /
translated: It is surprising that they see their own actions in the actions of others.

original: bdag gi bya ba ltar byed pa ngo mtshar mi che ba dang snying rje'i dbang gis gzhan gyi don bdag gi don nyid du byed pa ni ngo mtshar che ba'o //
analyzed: bdag gi bya ba ltar byed pa ngo mtshar mi che ba dang snying rje'i dbang gis gzhan gyi don bdag gi don nyid du byed pa ni ngo mtshar che ba'o //
translated: It is not surprising that he acts as he does, for he is acting in accordance with his own nature. But it is surprising that he should make others' welfare his own business, out of compassion.

original: bsam pa'i bye brag med par rnam pa lngas sems can thams cad la sems snyoms par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsam pa'i bye brag med par rnam pa lngas sems can thams cad la sems snyoms par 'gyur ro //
translated: Without any difference in attitude, he is impartial toward all living beings in five ways.

original: dang po byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i dus na yang dbye ba med pa'i bsam pas smon lam 'debs pa ste /
analyzed: dang po byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i dus na yang dbye ba med pa'i bsam pas smon lam 'debs pa ste /
translated: At the time of first generating the mind of enlightenment, he makes a vow with an attitude of nondifferentiation.

original: sems can thams cad kyi don @244b kyi dbang du byas nas sems bskyed pa'i phyir dang / phan pa ngang bde ba'i bsam pa'i dbye ba med pa dang / snying brtse ba'i bsam pa'i dbye ba med pa dang / chos nyid kyi bsam pa'i dbye ba med pa dang /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi don @244b kyi dbang du byas nas sems bskyed pa'i phyir dang / phan pa ngang bde ba'i bsam pa'i dbye ba med pa dang / snying brtse ba'i bsam pa'i dbye ba med pa dang / chos nyid kyi bsam pa'i dbye ba med pa dang /
translated: He generates the mind of enlightenment in order to benefit all living beings, and he has no differentiation of attitude in terms of benefit and happiness, no differentiation of attitude in terms of compassion, no differentiation of attitude in terms of reality,

original: don dang sbyor ba'i bsam pa'i dbye ba med pa'o //
analyzed: don dang sbyor ba'i bsam pa'i dbye ba med pa'o //
translated: and no differentiation of attitude in terms of application to the goal.

original: rnam pa lnga po 'di dag gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems can rnams la sna tshogs kyi blo skyed par mi byed do //
analyzed: rnam pa lnga po 'di dag gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems can rnams la sna tshogs kyi blo skyed par mi byed do //
translated: By these five aspects, the bodhisattvas do not generate a variety of thoughts toward sentient beings.

original: des na de sems can thams cad la sems snyoms pa yin no //
analyzed: des na de sems can thams cad la sems snyoms pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are impartial toward all sentient beings.

original: de lta na yang sems can thams cad kyi don du bdag gis sbyar bar bya'o zhes 'jug par 'gyur gyi tha dad kyi bsam pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang sems can thams cad kyi don du bdag gis sbyar bar bya'o zhes 'jug par 'gyur gyi tha dad kyi bsam pas ni ma yin no //
translated: Even so, they engage in the thought, I will apply myself for the benefit of all sentient beings, not with a discriminatory attitude.üîΩThe beneficial activities of the bodhisattvas toward sentient beings should be understood in brief as fivefold.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems can rnams la phan 'dogs pa'i bya ba thams cad ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste zhes bya ba la phan 'dogs pa ni mdor na rnam pa gnyis te //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems can rnams la phan 'dogs pa'i bya ba thams cad ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste zhes bya ba la phan 'dogs pa ni mdor na rnam pa gnyis te //
translated: The benefit is twofold:

original: tshe 'di pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i'o /
analyzed: tshe 'di pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i'o /
translated: in this life and in future lives.üîΩThe benefit in this life is twofold:

original: tshe 'di pa'i yang sems can rnam pa gsum la rnam gnyis te ;
analyzed: tshe 'di pa'i yang sems can rnam pa gsum la rnam gnyis te ;
translated: for the three types of sentient beings.

original: 'jig rten 'di'i bde ba'i phyir 'tsho ba log pa la zhugs pa rnams la yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba ston pa bsgrub pa dang / bya ba dag la mi mthun par bsgrub pa dag la rigs pa nye bar ston pa dang / bdag nyid kyi bde ba'i don bsgrub par mi nus pa dag la mgon yod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di'i bde ba'i phyir 'tsho ba log pa la zhugs pa rnams la yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba ston pa bsgrub pa dang / bya ba dag la mi mthun par bsgrub pa dag la rigs pa nye bar ston pa dang / bdag nyid kyi bde ba'i don bsgrub par mi nus pa dag la mgon yod par byed pa'o //
translated: For those who are engaged in wrong livelihood for the sake of the happiness of this world, he shows the correct livelihood. For those who are engaged in incompatible activities, he shows the proper activities. For those who are unable to achieve their own happiness, he acts as a protector.

original: ma 'ongs pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: In the future, he makes two kinds of aspirations:

original: mngon par mtho ba 'dod pa rnams la mngon par mtho ba'i lam ston pa dang / thar pa 'dod pa rnams la theg pa gsum nye bar ston pa ste /üîΩrnam pa lnga po 'di dag gis byang chub sems dpa' sems can rnams la phan 'dogs par byed do //
analyzed: mngon par mtho ba 'dod pa rnams la mngon par mtho ba'i lam ston pa dang / thar pa 'dod pa rnams la theg pa gsum nye bar ston pa ste / rnam pa lnga po 'di dag gis byang chub sems dpa' sems can rnams la phan 'dogs par byed do //
translated: For those who desire high status, he aspires to teach the path to high status. For those who desire liberation, he aspires to teach the three vehicles.üîΩBy these five aspects, the bodhisattva benefits sentient beings.

original: rnam pa lnga po 'di dag gis dus rtag tu sems can rnams la yang dag par sgrubs shig ces smon lam 'debs par byed do //
analyzed: rnam pa lnga po 'di dag gis dus rtag tu sems can rnams la yang dag par sgrubs shig ces smon lam 'debs par byed do //
translated: By these five aspects, he always makes aspirations to accomplish the welfare of sentient beings.

original: de ltar byas na lan du phan 'dogs par rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de ltar byas na lan du phan 'dogs par rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Thus, it is established that the bodhisattva is always to be honored in return.

original: rtag tu smon par bya ba yin te zhes bya ba ni nyin zhag gcig la yang byang chub sems dpa' mang du smon par byed par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: rtag tu smon par bya ba yin te zhes bya ba ni nyin zhag gcig la yang byang chub sems dpa' mang du smon par byed par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: One should always aspire to it means that in a single day, the bodhisattva should aspire to many things,

original: bsam pa de la mang du zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam pa de la mang du zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is engaged in many thoughts.

original: de'i phyir gnas lnga po de la 'dod par bya ba yin te //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnas lnga po de la 'dod par bya ba yin te //
translated: Therefore, one should aspire to these five states.

original: mos pas spyod pa ni rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa ni rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: The stage of devoted interest is threefold.

original: phyi ma gnyis ni sa la zhugs pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: phyi ma gnyis ni sa la zhugs pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: The latter two are for those who have entered the stages.

original: sangs rgyas 'byung ba mnyes par bya ba ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'byung ba mnyes par bya ba ni /
translated: The Buddha's appearance is to be pleased.

original: gang gi tshe gang du sangs rgyas 'byung @245a * //
analyzed: gang gi tshe gang du sangs rgyas 'byung @245a * //
translated: When and where the Buddha appears,

original: bar 'gyur ba der skye ba smon lam 'debs pa dang / de dag gi spyan sngar chos nyan par smon lam 'debs pa nyid dang / sems can yongs su smin par byed nus par smon pa nyid dang / sangs rgyas mthong ba dang yid la byed pa dang mi 'bral ba dang /
analyzed: bar 'gyur ba der skye ba smon lam 'debs pa dang / de dag gi spyan sngar chos nyan par smon lam 'debs pa nyid dang / sems can yongs su smin par byed nus par smon pa nyid dang / sangs rgyas mthong ba dang yid la byed pa dang mi 'bral ba dang /
translated: In the intermediate state, one prays for rebirth, and prays to hear the Dharma in their presence, and prays to be able to bring beings to maturity.

original: dam pa'i chos thos pa dang mi 'bral ba dang / sems can gyi don yid la byed pa dang 'bral ba'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos thos pa dang mi 'bral ba dang / sems can gyi don yid la byed pa dang 'bral ba'o //
translated: One is never separated from seeing the Buddhas, from keeping them in mind, from hearing the good Dharma, and from keeping it in mind for the sake of beings.

original: sa la zhugs pa rnams kyi ni byang chub tu smon pa dang / byang chub 'thob pa rnams kyi ni nyan pa'i 'khor tshogs par smon pa'o //
analyzed: sa la zhugs pa rnams kyi ni byang chub tu smon pa dang / byang chub 'thob pa rnams kyi ni nyan pa'i 'khor tshogs par smon pa'o //
translated: For those who have entered the stages, it is the prayer for enlightenment; for those who have attained enlightenment, it is the prayer for the assembly of disciples to gather.

original: dge ba la brten pa'i phyir de'i bsam pas sems can gyi don gang ci byas pa de grub par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba dang 'bras bu dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba la brten pa'i phyir de'i bsam pas sems can gyi don gang ci byas pa de grub par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba dang 'bras bu dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Whatever is done for the sake of beings by one whose intention is thus, that is accomplished, because it is based on virtue. This is the application and its result.

original: 'di dag thams cad ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi bya ba bstan pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi bya ba bstan pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas shes par bya'o //
translated: All this should be understood in accordance with the teaching of the spiritual teacher's activity.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: mchod pa dang / bsten pa dang / tshad med pa'i le'u las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mchod pa dang / bsten pa dang / tshad med pa'i le'u las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: in the chapter on worship, reliance and the immeasurables.

original: gang gis sbyor ba dang / gang ltar sbyor ba dang / gang la sbyor ba'i dbang du byas nas yang dag pa'i sbyor ba rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gis sbyor ba dang / gang ltar sbyor ba dang / gang la sbyor ba'i dbang du byas nas yang dag pa'i sbyor ba rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
translated: The correct application should be presented from the point of view of the one who applies, the manner in which he applies, and that to which he applies himself.

original: rjes su bsrung ba'i sbyor bas rab tu sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su bsrung ba'i sbyor bas rab tu sbyor ba'o //
translated: He applies himself by means of the application of protection.

original: kha na mtho ba med pa'i sbyor bas gang ltar sbyor ro //
analyzed: kha na mtho ba med pa'i sbyor bas gang ltar sbyor ro //
translated: He applies himself in such a way by means of the application of non-transgression.

original: mos pas spyod pa'i sa dang / skyon med pa'i sa la 'jug pa dang spyod pa'i sa la rab tu sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa'i sa dang / skyon med pa'i sa la 'jug pa dang spyod pa'i sa la rab tu sbyor bar byed do //
translated: He applies himself to the stage of action in faith and to the entry into the faultless stage.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la nan tan byed pa dang / bdag nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa med par nan tan byed pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par byed pa la nan tan byed pa'i dbang du byas nas 'phags pa'i chos rjes su bsrung ngo /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la nan tan byed pa dang / bdag nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa med par nan tan byed pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par byed pa la nan tan byed pa'i dbang du byas nas 'phags pa'i chos rjes su bsrung ngo /
translated: He protects the noble Dharma in terms of the practice of the teachings of the Tathagata, the practice of the absence of affliction, and the practice of the maturation of sentient beings.

original: de la yid gzhungs pa ni shes rab kyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: de la yid gzhungs pa ni shes rab kyi khyad par ro //
translated: Here, intelligence is a special kind of wisdom.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: shes pa des zhes bya ba ste gang gis myur du 'dzin par nus par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: shes pa des zhes bya ba ste gang gis myur du 'dzin par nus par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: By that knowledge, by which one is able to grasp quickly.

original: des na smras pa /
analyzed: des na smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: myur ba myur ba kho nar zhes bya'o //
analyzed: myur ba myur ba kho nar zhes bya'o //
translated: Very quickly, very quickly.

original: dran pa ni thos pa brjed par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: dran pa ni thos pa brjed par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Recollection is the non-forgetting of what has been heard.

original: ngo'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: ngo'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: blangs pa'i chos rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: blangs pa'i chos rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: The teachings that have been received.

original: shes pa ni yang dag ji lta bzhin du mthong ba'o //
analyzed: shes pa ni yang dag ji lta bzhin du mthong ba'o //
translated: Knowledge is seeing things as they are.

original: gzung ba'i chos rnams kyi don la nye bar rtog go zhes bya bas ni bsams pa las byung ba'i shis pa bstan to //
analyzed: gzung ba'i chos rnams kyi don la nye bar rtog go zhes bya bas ni bsams pa las byung ba'i shis pa bstan to //
translated: The meaning of the teachings that have been grasped is investigated. This shows the wisdom that arises from reflection.

original: so sor rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bsgoms pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: so sor rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bsgoms pa las byung ba'o //
translated: The phrase one comes to understand refers to the understanding that is derived from meditation.

original: 'grib pa ni @245b yang mi 'byung ba ste zad ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩde dag 'thob par byed pa ni 'grib pa dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: 'grib pa ni @245b yang mi 'byung ba ste zad ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // de dag 'thob par byed pa ni 'grib pa dang mthun pa'o //
translated: The phrase there is no longer any diminution means that there is no longer any loss of the understanding that is derived from meditation.

original: de la phan pa yin pas na 'grib pa dang mthun pa'i gzhi zhes bya'o //üîΩgzhi de nyid la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la phan pa yin pas na 'grib pa dang mthun pa'i gzhi zhes bya'o // gzhi de nyid la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The phrase the basis that is conducive to diminution means that which causes the diminution of the understanding that is derived from meditation.

analyzed: shes pas mkhas par bgrang ba dang / kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i dge ba spyod pa dang / sred pa ni bdag nyid kyis mngon sum du byed bar 'dod pa'o //
translated: The wise are those who are counted as wise by the wise.  The virtuous are those who practice virtue without fault.  The craving is the desire to make manifest that which is not manifest.

original: ston pa ni gzhan dag la nges par sbyor bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: ston pa ni gzhan dag la nges par sbyor bar byed pa'o //
translated: The teachers are those who apply themselves to the definite release of others.
