analyzed: de dag las bzlog pa ni yang dag pa'i yon tan no //
translated: The opposites of these are the true virtues.

original: bslab pa gsum ni gdul bya'i dbang du byas nas gnas bcur rnam par gzhag par bya ba ste /
analyzed: bslab pa gsum ni gdul bya'i dbang du byas nas gnas bcur rnam par gzhag par bya ba ste /
translated: The three trainings should be established in ten topics with reference to the disciples.

original: khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba'i tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa dang / tshul khrims de ma nyams shing ma ral ba'i dbang du byas nas gsum mo //
analyzed: khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba'i tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa dang / tshul khrims de ma nyams shing ma ral ba'i dbang du byas nas gsum mo //
translated: The vows are the vows of morality for the householder and the monk. The morality is the morality that is not damaged or broken.

original: sngom pa dang bcas pa'i lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa yang dag par blangs pa'i dbang du byas nas ni drug go //
analyzed: sngom pa dang bcas pa'i lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa yang dag par blangs pa'i dbang du byas nas ni drug go //
translated: The superior thought is the training of superior thought that is accompanied by vows.

original: lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa yang dag par blangs pa'i dbang du byas nas ni tha ma'o //
analyzed: lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa yang dag par blangs pa'i dbang du byas nas ni tha ma'o //
translated: The last is from the point of view of the acceptance of the training in higher wisdom.

original: yang kha cig tu ni mngon du rgyu dang / bag la nyal gyi gnyen por 'gyur ba'i phyir gnas tha ma gnyis lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab par 'jog par byed do //
analyzed: yang kha cig tu ni mngon du rgyu dang / bag la nyal gyi gnyen por 'gyur ba'i phyir gnas tha ma gnyis lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab par 'jog par byed do //
translated: And in some places, the last two are established as the training in higher wisdom, because they are the antidote to the manifest and the latent.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i lung bstan pa thams cad mdor bsdu na rnam pa drug tu gzhag @246b par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i lung bstan pa thams cad mdor bsdu na rnam pa drug tu gzhag @246b par bya'o //
translated: All the predictions of the bodhisattvas can be summarized as six types.

original: de'i phyir lung bstan pa ni rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir lung bstan pa ni rnam pa drug ste /
translated: Therefore, the predictions are of six types.

original: rigs la gnas pa lung ston pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i rigs kyi rtags ma lus pa dang ldan pa'i sems can skal pa dang ldan pa khyad par can la ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'di sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro zhes byang chub tu lung ston par
analyzed: rigs la gnas pa lung ston pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i rigs kyi rtags ma lus pa dang ldan pa'i sems can skal pa dang ldan pa khyad par can la ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'di sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro zhes byang chub tu lung ston par
translated: The prediction of those abiding in the lineage is the prediction of enlightenment, saying in the future this one will become a buddha, to a fortunate being who possesses all the signs of the lineage of the perfections and is a special being.

original: mdzad do // de ltar na rigs la gnas pa thams cad lung ston ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: mdzad do // de ltar na rigs la gnas pa thams cad lung ston ba ma yin gyi /
translated: Thus not all those abiding in the lineage are predicted.

original: 'on kyang bsam pa dang sbyor ba khyad par can 'ga' zhig lung ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: 'on kyang bsam pa dang sbyor ba khyad par can 'ga' zhig lung ston par mdzad do //
translated: However, he does prophesy some who have special attitudes and practices.

original: sems bskyed pa lung ston pa ni kha cig shin tu drag cing dang ba'i dad pa ro gcig par gyur pas bsod nams rgya chen po yongs su gzung ba byas nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyan sngar rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skyed par byed pa de lta
analyzed: sems bskyed pa lung ston pa ni kha cig shin tu drag cing dang ba'i dad pa ro gcig par gyur pas bsod nams rgya chen po yongs su gzung ba byas nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyan sngar rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skyed par byed pa de lta
translated: The prediction of the generation of the Thought is for one who, having taken up a great deal of merit by means of a single taste of very intense and clear faith, generates the Thought of supreme enlightenment in the presence of a Tathagata.

original: bu la yang dag par gzengs bstod pa'i phyir lung ston par mdzad do //üîΩmngon sum du gyur pa la lung ston pa ni sangs rgyas kyi spyan snga na gnas pa lung ston pa'o //
analyzed: bu la yang dag par gzengs bstod pa'i phyir lung ston par mdzad do // mngon sum du gyur pa la lung ston pa ni sangs rgyas kyi spyan snga na gnas pa lung ston pa'o //
translated: The prediction is for the purpose of encouraging him.üîΩThe prediction in the presence is for one who is present before the Buddha.

original: lkog na gnas pa ni rab tu grags pa'i gang zag mngon sum du ma gyur pa lung ston pa'o //
analyzed: lkog na gnas pa ni rab tu grags pa'i gang zag mngon sum du ma gyur pa lung ston pa'o //
translated: The prediction in the absence is for one who is not present before the Buddha, but is a well-known person.

original: dus dpag tu rung ba ni dus thams cad kyi tshad byas nas lung ston pa'o //
analyzed: dus dpag tu rung ba ni dus thams cad kyi tshad byas nas lung ston pa'o //
translated: The prediction with a limited time is for one who is predicted after a certain time has been limited.

original: dus dpag tu mi rung ba ni dus nges pa med par lung ston pa'o //
analyzed: dus dpag tu mi rung ba ni dus nges pa med par lung ston pa'o //
translated: The indeterminate time is the prediction without a fixed time.

original: de ltar na gnas skabs kyi dbye ba dang / nye ba dang nye ba ma yin pa'i dbye ba dang / dus kyi dbye bar lung bstan pa rnam pa drug go //
analyzed: de ltar na gnas skabs kyi dbye ba dang / nye ba dang nye ba ma yin pa'i dbye ba dang / dus kyi dbye bar lung bstan pa rnam pa drug go //
translated: Thus, there are six kinds of predictions: by the state, by the near or remote future, by the time, and by the certainty of the vehicle, by the certainty of the time, and by the certainty of the prediction.

original: nges par zhugs pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /üîΩskal ba dang ldan pa nyid dang / rigs la gnas pa'i theg pa gzhan gyis mya ngan las 'da' ba'i skal ba can ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: nges par zhugs pa ni rnam pa gsum ste / skal ba dang ldan pa nyid dang / rigs la gnas pa'i theg pa gzhan gyis mya ngan las 'da' ba'i skal ba can ma yin pa'am /
translated: The certainty of the prediction is threefold:üîΩthe certainty of the spiritual gene, the certainty of the vehicle, and the certainty of the time.

original: mya ngan las mi 'da' ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las mi 'da' ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: The certainty of the spiritual gene is the prediction of those who are endowed with the spiritual gene, who are in the stage of the spiritual gene, and who are destined for the ultimate liberation of the Great Vehicle, not for the liberation of the other vehicles.üîΩThe certainty of the vehicle is the prediction of those who are in the stage of action in faith, who are destined for the ultimate liberation of the Great Vehicle, not for the liberation of the other vehicles.üîΩThe certainty of the time is the prediction of those who are in the stage of the realization of the truths, who are destined for the ultimate liberation of the Great Vehicle, not for the liberation of the other vehicles.

original: de lta bas na dus ring du gnas kyang byang chub kyi snod nyid yin pas des na nges par zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na dus ring du gnas kyang byang chub kyi snod nyid yin pas des na nges par zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The long time is the prediction of those who are in the stage of action in faith, who are destined for the ultimate liberation of the Great Vehicle, not for the liberation of the other vehicles.

original: gnyis pa ni brtan zhing snying por gyur pa'i smon lam yongs su gzung bas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las cis kyang ldog par mi 'gyur zhing rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa las cis kyang gzhan du smon lam 'debs par mi 'gyur ro zhesüîΩbya bas de sems bskyed pa'i nges pa la 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni brtan zhing snying por gyur pa'i smon lam yongs su gzung bas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las cis kyang ldog par mi 'gyur zhing rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa las cis kyang gzhan du smon lam 'debs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bas de sems bskyed pa'i nges pa la 'jug pa yin no //
translated: The second is the entrance into the certainty of generating the Thought, because one will not turn away from perfect enlightenment by any means, and one will not make a prayer for anything other than generating the Thought of perfect enlightenment, by taking up the firm, essential prayers.

original: spyod pa nges pa la 'jug pa ni lhun gyis grub pa'i sbyor bas mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i phyir spyod pa'i sbyor ba 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: spyod pa nges pa la 'jug pa ni lhun gyis grub pa'i sbyor bas mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i phyir spyod pa'i sbyor ba 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: The entrance into the certainty of practice is that the practice of the Bodhisattva is fruitful, because of the effortless application by the spontaneous accomplishment.

original: yang de ni sa brgyad pa la gnas pa @247a * //
analyzed: yang de ni sa brgyad pa la gnas pa @247a * //
translated: Moreover, that is for one who is on the eighth stage.

original: ste ; phyi ma gtsor byas nas nges pa la 'jug pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: ste ; phyi ma gtsor byas nas nges pa la 'jug pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: The latter is emphasized in the statement, ‚Äúentrance into the certainty.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTherein, the Tathagatas, etc.‚Äù

original: byang chub sems dpas nges par bya ba ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas nges par bya ba ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: The bodhisattva must definitely do what is appropriate.

original: ji ltar rigs pa de dag ma byas na byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya bar rnam par mi gzhag la sangs rgyas nyid thob pa yang ma yin no zhes bya bar nges par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar rigs pa de dag ma byas na byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya bar rnam par mi gzhag la sangs rgyas nyid thob pa yang ma yin no zhes bya bar nges par bya ba yin no //
translated: If he does not do what is appropriate, he is not established as a bodhisattva, and he does not attain buddhahood.

original: des na smras pa /
analyzed: des na smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:üîΩIf he does not do them, etc.

original: de dag ma byas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sems ma bskyed pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa'i bsod nams kyi bya ba rnams pha rol tu phyin pa'i grangs su mi chud pas /
analyzed: de dag ma byas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sems ma bskyed pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa'i bsod nams kyi bya ba rnams pha rol tu phyin pa'i grangs su mi chud pas /
translated: Meritorious actions such as generosity, which are not generated by the spirit of enlightenment, are not included in the number of perfections.

original: des na dang por smon lam nyid gdab par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: des na dang por smon lam nyid gdab par bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, one should first make the vow.

original: snying rje can ma yin pa la sems can sems yongs su smin par byed pa med la /
analyzed: snying rje can ma yin pa la sems can sems yongs su smin par byed pa med la /
translated: One who is not compassionate does not have the spirit to develop sentient beings,

original: de med par sangs rgyas nyid thob pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de med par sangs rgyas nyid thob pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: and without that, buddhahood is not attained.

original: de'i phyir snying brtse ba ni nges par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir snying brtse ba ni nges par bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, compassion is definitely to be cultivated.

original: sems bskyed pa dang / snying brtse ba dang bcas pa yin yang brtson 'grus brtsams pa med na tshogs yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur bas /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa dang / snying brtse ba dang bcas pa yin yang brtson 'grus brtsams pa med na tshogs yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur bas /
translated: Even though one has generated the Thought and is endowed with compassion, if one does not apply oneself with perseverance, the collections will not be completed.

original: des na brtson 'grus 'bar ba ni nges par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: des na brtson 'grus 'bar ba ni nges par bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is necessary to apply oneself with blazing perseverance.

original: brtson 'grus kyang thabs kyis yongs su zin par gyur na gnas de dang de la 'dod pa'i 'bras bu bsgrub par nus par 'gyur te /üîΩtshul bzhin brtson 'grus brtsams pa la //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyang thabs kyis yongs su zin par gyur na gnas de dang de la 'dod pa'i 'bras bu bsgrub par nus par 'gyur te / tshul bzhin brtson 'grus brtsams pa la //
translated: And when perseverance is taken hold of by means of, it is able to accomplish the desired fruit in that and that station.

original: dka' ba cung zad yod ma yin zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: dka' ba cung zad yod ma yin zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
translated: As it is said, ‚ÄúThere is not the slightest difficulty for one who applies perseverance properly.‚Äù

original: de lta bus rig pa'i gnas rnams la sbyar bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta bus rig pa'i gnas rnams la sbyar bar bya ba yin no //
translated: Thus, one should apply oneself to the branches of knowledge.

original: de lta bu'i sbyor ba dang ldan yang skyo bas sbyor ba lhod par gyur na yang sbyor ba lhod pa'i rig pa'i gnas yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba ma yin pas de'i phyir skyo ba med par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i sbyor ba dang ldan yang skyo bas sbyor ba lhod par gyur na yang sbyor ba lhod pa'i rig pa'i gnas yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba ma yin pas de'i phyir skyo ba med par bya'o //
translated: Even though one has such an application, if one relaxes the application because of weariness, one does not complete the branches of knowledge with relaxed application. Therefore, one should be free from weariness.

original: rnam pa gsum gyis skyo ba skye bar gyur na yang dag par rdzogs par byang chub par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum gyis skyo ba skye bar gyur na yang dag par rdzogs par byang chub par mi 'gyur te /
translated: One does not attain perfect enlightenment if one becomes weary in three ways:

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i sbyor ba la yong sa su ngal ba dang / sems can rnams kyi log par bsgrub pa'i sdug bsngal ba dang ; 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i sbyor ba la yong sa su ngal ba dang / sems can rnams kyi log par bsgrub pa'i sdug bsngal ba dang ; 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal lo //
translated: from over-exertion in the practice of the transcendences, from the suffering of sentient beings due to their perverse actions, and from the suffering of cyclic life.

original: de'i phyir skyo ba med pa'i yid kyis brtan zhing nges par bya'o zhes skyo ba med par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir skyo ba med pa'i yid kyis brtan zhing nges par bya'o zhes skyo ba med par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should be steadfast and firm with a mind free from weariness.

original: rtag par bya zhes bya ba ni skye zhing skye ba thams cad dang / nyi ma re re zhing sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba'i dbang du byas nas bag yod @247b par dge ba'i chos bsgom pa nyid dang / sems can yongs su smin pa'i dbang du byas nas sems can rnams mgon dang bcas pa'i bya ba dang /
analyzed: rtag par bya zhes bya ba ni skye zhing skye ba thams cad dang / nyi ma re re zhing sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba'i dbang du byas nas bag yod @247b par dge ba'i chos bsgom pa nyid dang / sems can yongs su smin pa'i dbang du byas nas sems can rnams mgon dang bcas pa'i bya ba dang /
translated: One should always practice means that one should always practice the cultivation of virtue with a mind free from heedlessness, in all one's lives and every day, in terms of the maturation of the qualities of a buddha and in terms of the maturation of sentient beings, by acting as a protector of sentient beings.

original: byas pa shes pa dang bsod nams kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i dbang du byas nas de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa'o //
analyzed: byas pa shes pa dang bsod nams kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i dbang du byas nas de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa'o //
translated: Worship of the Tathagata is in terms of the perfection of the stores of merit and knowledge.

original: bdag gi 'khrul pa yongs su shes pa ni ltung ba'i gnas kyi chos la so sor rtog pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi 'khrul pa yongs su shes pa ni ltung ba'i gnas kyi chos la so sor rtog pa'o //
translated: The thorough knowledge of one's own faults is the discernment of the dharmas which are the bases of downfalls.

original: bya ba dang spyod par gtogs pa thams cad la byang chub kyi sems sngon du 'gro bas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bya ba thams cad yongs su bsngo ba ni brtag par bya ba phyi ma ste /
analyzed: bya ba dang spyod par gtogs pa thams cad la byang chub kyi sems sngon du 'gro bas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bya ba thams cad yongs su bsngo ba ni brtag par bya ba phyi ma ste /
translated: The thorough dedication of all one's actions and practices to the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, preceded by the thought of enlightenment, is the future investigation.

original: spyod yul yongs su dag pa'i mdo'i rjes su 'brangs nas shes par bya'o //
analyzed: spyod yul yongs su dag pa'i mdo'i rjes su 'brangs nas shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood according to the Visuddha-gocara-sutra.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gnas bcu gtso bo yin par yid la bya zhing gzhan dag la yang de bzhin du bstan par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gnas bcu gtso bo yin par yid la bya zhing gzhan dag la yang de bzhin du bstan par bya ba yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva should keep in mind the ten principal topics and should teach them to others in the same way.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: 'dzin zhing mchog tu 'dogs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dzin zhing mchog tu 'dogs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: He grasps and ascribes the highest.

original: sangs rgyas kyi rigs na rigs thams cad kyi gtso bo yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rigs na rigs thams cad kyi gtso bo yin te /
translated: The Buddha lineage is the best of all lineages,

original: yon tan thams cad kyi rgyu'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir dang / gzhan gyi don thams cad bsgrub pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan thams cad kyi rgyu'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir dang / gzhan gyi don thams cad bsgrub pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause of all virtues and because it becomes the cause for accomplishing all altruistic aims.

original: smon lam thams cad kyi gtso bo ni dang po sems bskyed pa yin te /
analyzed: smon lam thams cad kyi gtso bo ni dang po sems bskyed pa yin te /
translated: The first generation of the Thought of Enlightenment is the best of all aspirations,

original: de'i rgyu las dge ba'i rtsa ba gzhan thams cad 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyu las dge ba'i rtsa ba gzhan thams cad 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because all other roots of virtue come from it as their cause.

original: dge ba'i chos thams cad la sbyor ba dang / dge ba thams cad la rtsom pas bsdus pa'i phyir brtson 'grus dang / shes rab ni gtso bo yin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos thams cad la sbyor ba dang / dge ba thams cad la rtsom pas bsdus pa'i phyir brtson 'grus dang / shes rab ni gtso bo yin no //
translated: Exertion and wisdom are the best, because they include all virtuous practices and all virtuous undertakings.

original: kha na ma tho ba med pa'i chos bstan pas bsdus pa'i phyir snyan par smra ba nyid gtso bo yin no //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med pa'i chos bstan pas bsdus pa'i phyir snyan par smra ba nyid gtso bo yin no //
translated: Pleasant speech is the best, because it includes the teaching of the Dharma without fault.

original: skyon dang yon tan thams cad spangs pa dang / mthar thug pa thob pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa ni sems can thams cad kyi mchog go //
analyzed: skyon dang yon tan thams cad spangs pa dang / mthar thug pa thob pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa ni sems can thams cad kyi mchog go //
translated: The Tathagata is the best of all beings, because he has abandoned all faults and has attained all perfections.

original: thabs la mkhas pa rnams kyi nang na ni rnam par dag pa'i thabs la mkhas pa gtso bo yin no //
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa rnams kyi nang na ni rnam par dag pa'i thabs la mkhas pa gtso bo yin no //
translated: Among those skilled in means, the one skilled in pure means is the chief.

original: gang la gdags par bya ba dang / gang gi phyir gdags par bya ba dang / gang ltar gdags pa dang / gang gi sgo nas gdags pa'i dbang du byas nas gdags pa rnam pa bzhir rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: gang la gdags par bya ba dang / gang gi phyir gdags par bya ba dang / gang ltar gdags pa dang / gang gi sgo nas gdags pa'i dbang du byas nas gdags pa rnam pa bzhir rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The designation is established in terms of four aspects: that which is to be designated, the purpose for which it is designated, the manner in which it is designated, and the means by which it is designated.

original: mdo'i sde la sogs pa gsung rab tu gtogs pa yan lag bcu gnyis po go rims bzhin du sbyar ba dang / go rims bzhin du yang dag par bkod pa rnams pa gzhan dag gis gdags pa ma byas shing ma @248a * //
analyzed: mdo'i sde la sogs pa gsung rab tu gtogs pa yan lag bcu gnyis po go rims bzhin du sbyar ba dang / go rims bzhin du yang dag par bkod pa rnams pa gzhan dag gis gdags pa ma byas shing ma @248a * //
translated: The twelve branches of the scriptures, such as the discourses, are not designated or taught by other means or arrangements.

original: bstan te / de'i phyir sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kho nas rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: bstan te / de'i phyir sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kho nas rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: Therefore, they are established solely by the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: des na de lta bu'i tshig gsungs pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: des na de lta bu'i tshig gsungs pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa zhes bya ba'am /
translated: Thus, those statements are called the teachings of the Tathagata

original: sangs rgyas kyi gsung zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gsung zhes bya'o //
translated: or the speech of the Buddha.

original: chos de yang bden pa mngon par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya bar de'i rjes la de rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: chos de yang bden pa mngon par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya bar de'i rjes la de rnam par gzhag go //
translated: And that doctrine is for the purpose of realizing the truth.

original: bden pa'i don ni phyin ci ma log pa'i don te /
analyzed: bden pa'i don ni phyin ci ma log pa'i don te /
translated: The meaning of truth is the meaning of non-error.

original: rnam pa de dang des phyin ci ma log pa'i don to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnam pa de dang des phyin ci ma log pa'i don to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means the meaning of non-error by that aspect.

original: nyan thos rnams kyi bden pa'i dbye ba rnam par gzhag pa ni bzhi'i bar du ste /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyi bden pa'i dbye ba rnam par gzhag pa ni bzhi'i bar du ste /
translated: The classification of the truths for the ≈õrƒÅvakas is up to four.

original: la lar ni gcig go //
analyzed: la lar ni gcig go //
translated: In some places, one truth is taught.

original: kha cig tu ni gnyis so //
analyzed: kha cig tu ni gnyis so //
translated: In some places, two truths are taught.

original: kha cig tu ni gsum mo //
analyzed: kha cig tu ni gsum mo //
translated: In some places, three truths are taught.

original: la lar ni bzhir bstan to //
analyzed: la lar ni bzhir bstan to //
translated: In some places, four truths are taught.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni gcig la sogs pa bcu'i bar gyi dbye bas so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni gcig la sogs pa bcu'i bar gyi dbye bas so //
translated: For the bodhisattvas, the classification is from one up to ten.

original: ston pa po'i gzhung tha dad kyi dbang du byas nas bden pa ni gcig kho na ste /
analyzed: ston pa po'i gzhung tha dad kyi dbang du byas nas bden pa ni gcig kho na ste /
translated: From the perspective of the different systems of the teachers, it is taught that there is only one truth.

original: gnyis su med do zhes bstan te /
analyzed: gnyis su med do zhes bstan te /
translated: It is taught that there is no second.

original: phan tshun gcig la gcig 'gal bar gyur pa ni bden pa yin par dka' ste /
analyzed: phan tshun gcig la gcig 'gal bar gyur pa ni bden pa yin par dka' ste /
translated: It is difficult for mutually contradictory things to be true.

original: phan tshun 'gal ba ni bden pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun 'gal ba ni bden pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are mutually contradictory, they are not true.

original: rnam pa gnyis ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i tshad nam mkha'i spyod yul gyi dbang du byas nas te /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i tshad nam mkha'i spyod yul gyi dbang du byas nas te /
translated: The two are from the mundane and supramundane points of view, in terms of the sphere of activity of space.

original: 'khrul pa med pa'i 'jig rten gyi shes pa'i dbang du byas nas ni /
analyzed: 'khrul pa med pa'i 'jig rten gyi shes pa'i dbang du byas nas ni /
translated: From the mundane point of view, which is not erroneous,

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa ste /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa ste /
translated: there is the conventional truth.

original: de rtogs par bya ba'i phyir mngon par brjod pa 'jug pa ni kun rdzob ces bya ste /
analyzed: de rtogs par bya ba'i phyir mngon par brjod pa 'jug pa ni kun rdzob ces bya ste /
translated: In order to understand that, the engagement of verbal and symbolic conventions is called the conventional.

original: ko bas pha rol tu sgrol bar byed pa la ko bas sgrol zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: ko bas pha rol tu sgrol bar byed pa la ko bas sgrol zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: It is like saying ‚Äúa raft is for crossing over‚Äù when one is crossing over with a raft.

original: dam pa'i shes pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i shes pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the holy is supramundane.

original: de'i don ni don dam pa ste /
analyzed: de'i don ni don dam pa ste /
translated: Its object is the ultimate.

original: don dam pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul zhes bya'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the sphere of activity of the wisdom of the ultimate.

original: de la dang po ni 'jig rten la grags pa dang / rigs pas grags pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: de la dang po ni 'jig rten la grags pa dang / rigs pas grags pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: The first of these is from the point of view of what is renowned in the world and what is renowned through reasoning.

original: gnyis pa ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i spyod yul gyi de kho na nyid do //üîΩmtshan nyid kyi bden pa ni /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i spyod yul gyi de kho na nyid do // mtshan nyid kyi bden pa ni /
translated: The second is the reality of the domain of the purification of the obscurations of the passions and of the knowable.

original: chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi dbang du byas nas med na mi 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi dbang du byas nas med na mi 'byung ba'o //
translated: The truth of characteristics is that which is not produced without the specific and general characteristics of things.

original: ngag gi bden pa ni drang po'i ngag ste /
analyzed: ngag gi bden pa ni drang po'i ngag ste /
translated: The truth of speech is the straight speech of the Buddha,

original: slu ba med pa nyid do //
analyzed: slu ba med pa nyid do //
translated: because it is not deceptive.

original: bya ba'i bden pa ni /üîΩji skad smras pa de bzhin byed pa ste /
analyzed: bya ba'i bden pa ni / ji skad smras pa de bzhin byed pa ste /
translated: The truth of action is thatüîΩwhich is done in accordance with one's words.

original: rang gi tshig dang rjes su mthun pa'i bya ba byed pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi tshig dang rjes su mthun pa'i bya ba byed pa'o //
translated: It is the performance of actions in accordance with one's words.

original: yang las kyi mtshan nyid kyi @248b dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: yang las kyi mtshan nyid kyi @248b dbang du byas nas /
translated: Moreover, from the point of view of the characteristics of action,

original: skye bo bram ze rnams kyi mchod sbyin las ni /
analyzed: skye bo bram ze rnams kyi mchod sbyin las ni /
translated: in the Brahmana's sacrifice,

original: sems can de dang de bsad na zhes 'byung la /
analyzed: sems can de dang de bsad na zhes 'byung la /
translated: it is said that one should kill this or that living being.

original: de'i gnyen po'i phyogs las ni sems can rnams la gnod pa mi bya zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i gnyen po'i phyogs las ni sems can rnams la gnod pa mi bya zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: But in the antidote to that, it is said that one should not harm living beings.

original: yang gzhan dag na re ni /
analyzed: yang gzhan dag na re ni /
translated: Moreover, others say that

original: rtag pa'i 'jig rten thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: rtag pa'i 'jig rten thob par 'gyur //
translated: one attains the eternal world.

original: zhes zer ro //
analyzed: zhes zer ro //
translated: Thus it is said.üîΩüîΩ

original: 'di lta bu dag ni brdzun te /
analyzed: 'di lta bu dag ni brdzun te /
translated: This is false.

original: de las bzlog nas ni 'du byed thams cad mi rtag par ston pa'i tshig ni bden pa yin no //
analyzed: de las bzlog nas ni 'du byed thams cad mi rtag par ston pa'i tshig ni bden pa yin no //
translated: The opposite of this is the truth, namely, that all conditioned things are impermanent.

original: yang de dag gis smras pa de'i 'bras bu ni bdag gir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang de dag gis smras pa de'i 'bras bu ni bdag gir 'gyur ro //
translated: Again, they say: ‚ÄúThe effect belongs to the self.

original: bdag ni 'bras bu la longs spyod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bdag ni 'bras bu la longs spyod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The self experiences the effect.

original: yang dag pa'i bram ze rnams kyis ni de dag gis smras pa de dag brdzun par shes pas de las bzlog pas 'di dag bdag kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i bram ze rnams kyis ni de dag gis smras pa de dag brdzun par shes pas de las bzlog pas 'di dag bdag kyang ma yin la /
translated: ‚Äù The true brahmans know that this is false, and they teach the opposite: ‚ÄúThere is no self, and there is nothing that belongs to the self.

original: bdag gi yang ma yin pa zhes bstan pa ni bya ba'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gi yang ma yin pa zhes bstan pa ni bya ba'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
translated: ‚Äù This is called the truth of action.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i phyogs dag gi rgyu dang 'bras bus bsdus pas phyin ci la log pa dag gi dbang du byas nas 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i phyogs dag gi rgyu dang 'bras bus bsdus pas phyin ci la log pa dag gi dbang du byas nas 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'o //
translated: The four noble truths are taught from the point of view of the errors of the side of affliction and the side of purification, which are included in cause and effect.

original: bzhi po de ngag nyid kyi dbye ba las rnam pa lngar bstan te /
analyzed: bzhi po de ngag nyid kyi dbye ba las rnam pa lngar bstan te /
translated: These four are taught as fivefold by way of their division into categories.

original: rgyu'i bden pa ni kun 'byung gi bden pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i bden pa ni kun 'byung gi bden pa'o //
translated: The truth of cause is the truth of origination.

original: 'bras bu'i bden pa ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i bden pa ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
translated: The truth of effect is the truth of suffering.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bden pa rnam par gzhag pa'i rim gyis dbye ba tha dad pa nyid de /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bden pa rnam par gzhag pa'i rim gyis dbye ba tha dad pa nyid de /
translated: The truth of cause and effect is the truth of origination and suffering.

original: shes pa'i bden pa ni lam gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa'i bden pa ni lam gyi bden pa'o //
translated: The truth of knowledge is the truth of the path.

original: bzhi po kun kyang shes bya'i ba dan pa ste /
analyzed: bzhi po kun kyang shes bya'i ba dan pa ste /
translated: All four are the truth of the knowable,

original: shes bya thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes bya thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they include all knowable things.

original: yang phyin ci ma log pa'i rgyu rnam par gzhag pa ni rgyu'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: yang phyin ci ma log pa'i rgyu rnam par gzhag pa ni rgyu'i bden pa'o //
translated: Again, the truth of cause is the cause of non-error.

original: de bzhin du 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa ni 'bras bu'i bden pa'o //üîΩbden pa bzhi la rjes su shes pa rnams ni shes pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa ni 'bras bu'i bden pa'o // bden pa bzhi la rjes su shes pa rnams ni shes pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the truth of effect is the effect of non-error.üîΩThe truths of suffering and origination are the objects of non-error.

original: yang dag pa'i ye shes dang / de bzhin nyid ni shes bya'i bden pa'o /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ye shes dang / de bzhin nyid ni shes bya'i bden pa'o /
translated: The truth of knowledge is the knowledge of non-error.üîΩThe truth of cessation is the state of non-error.üîΩThe truth of the path is the cause of non-error.üîΩThe truth of the knowable is the object of non-error.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni mchog gi bden pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni mchog gi bden pa'o //
translated: The truth of supreme meaning is the state of non-error.

original: bden pa'i bden pa ni drang po'i ngag go //
analyzed: bden pa'i bden pa ni drang po'i ngag go //
translated: The truth of truth is the speech of non-error.

original: brdzun pa'i bden pa ni drang po ma yin pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: brdzun pa'i bden pa ni drang po ma yin pa'i tshig ste /
translated: False truth is the words of the dishonest.

original: de'i ngo bor yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i ngo bor yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the truth of the false because it exists as that nature.

original: yang dngos po brjod du med pa ni bden pa'i bden pa ste /
analyzed: yang dngos po brjod du med pa ni bden pa'i bden pa ste /
translated: Moreover, the inexpressible thing is the truth of truth.

original: de bzhin nyid dang / phyin ci ma log pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang / phyin ci ma log pa'i don gyis so //
translated: It is the reality of suchness and the meaning of non-distortion.

original: khams gsum na nyi bar spyod pa'i nye bar len pa'i phung po ni brdzun pa'i bden pa ste /
analyzed: khams gsum na nyi bar spyod pa'i nye bar len pa'i phung po ni brdzun pa'i bden pa ste /
translated: The appropriated aggregates that are experienced in the three realms are the false truth.

original: sgyu ma lta bu'o zhes bya ba'i mdo'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu'o zhes bya ba'i mdo'i tshig gis so //
translated: It is like an illusion, as stated in the sutra.

original: gzhan dag ni gzhan du ston par byed de /üîΩbden pa'i @249a * //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni gzhan du ston par byed de / bden pa'i @249a * //
translated: Others teach differently.

original: bden pa ni 'gog pa'i bden pa dang / lam gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa ni 'gog pa'i bden pa dang / lam gyi bden pa'o //
translated: The truth of truth is the truth of cessation and the truth of the path.

original: brdzun pa'i ba dan pa ni sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung gi bden pa yin par shes par bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: brdzun pa'i ba dan pa ni sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung gi bden pa yin par shes par bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: The false truth should be understood as the truth of suffering and the truth of origination.

original: yongs su shes par bya ba'i bden pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: yongs su shes par bya ba'i bden pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'o //
translated: The truth to be fully understood is the four noble truths.

original: 'du byed rnams sam ;
analyzed: 'du byed rnams sam ;
translated: Are conditioned things or

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan rnams la bde ba'i tshor ba lus dang sems kyis myong bar phyin ci ma log par ni ro myang ba'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan rnams la bde ba'i tshor ba lus dang sems kyis myong bar phyin ci ma log par ni ro myang ba'i bden pa'o //
translated: The truth of taste is the experience of pleasure by body and mind with regard to the qualities of desire.

original: sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba ni nyes dmigs kyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba ni nyes dmigs kyi bden pa'o //
translated: The truth of danger is suffering and mental dissatisfaction.

original: 'dod pa la 'dun pa spangs pa ni nges par 'byung ba'i bden pa'o //üîΩchos la bdag med pa'am /
analyzed: 'dod pa la 'dun pa spangs pa ni nges par 'byung ba'i bden pa'o // chos la bdag med pa'am /
translated: The truth of escape is the abandonment of desire for desire.üîΩThe truth of reality is the selflessness of phenomena.

original: skye ba la sogs pa'i chos nyid ni chos nyid kyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa'i chos nyid ni chos nyid kyi bden pa'o //
translated: The truth of the way things are is the reality of arising, etc.

original: rang gi gnas la dad pa thob pa ni mos pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi gnas la dad pa thob pa ni mos pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: The truth of conviction is the attainment of faith in one's own stage.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyi bden pa ni 'gog pa dang lam mo //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyi bden pa ni 'gog pa dang lam mo //
translated: The truth of the noble ones is cessation and the path.

original: 'phags pa yin pa rnams kyi bden pa ni sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung dag go //
analyzed: 'phags pa yin pa rnams kyi bden pa ni sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung dag go //
translated: The truth of those who are noble ones is suffering and origination.

original: yang 'phags pa rnams kyi bden pa ni bden pa bzhi po de dag nyid la de dang de la de bzhin du sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: yang 'phags pa rnams kyi bden pa ni bden pa bzhi po de dag nyid la de dang de la de bzhin du sgrub pa'o //
translated: The truth of the noble ones is the four noble truths themselves, since they are established as such for the noble ones.

original: 'phags pa ma yin pa rnams kyi bden pa ni de dag nyid la phyin ci log gi rnam par sgrub pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa ma yin pa rnams kyi bden pa ni de dag nyid la phyin ci log gi rnam par sgrub pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: The truth of non-noble persons is from the perspective of their establishment of error.

original: 'di dag kho na bden gyi gzhan ni gti mug go zhes rnam par gzhag pa'i tshul gyis sdug bsngal gsum po gang yin pa nyid 'jug pa dang / ldog pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i dbang du byas nas rnam pa brgyad de /
analyzed: 'di dag kho na bden gyi gzhan ni gti mug go zhes rnam par gzhag pa'i tshul gyis sdug bsngal gsum po gang yin pa nyid 'jug pa dang / ldog pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i dbang du byas nas rnam pa brgyad de /
translated: These are the eight aspects of the four noble truths: the three kinds of suffering, from the perspective of engagement, disengagement, affliction, and purification, and the four kinds of noble truth, from the perspective of the four noble truths.

original: 'jug pa'i bden pa ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i bden pa ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
translated: The truth of engagement is the conventional truth.

original: ldog pa'i bden pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: ldog pa'i bden pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: The truth of disengagement is the ultimate truth.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i bden pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i bden pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i bden pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i bden pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'o //
translated: The truth of affliction and the truth of purification are the four noble truths.

original: bden pa la rnam par rtog pa'i sbyor ba dang / bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi sbyor ba ni yang dag pa'i sbyor ba'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa la rnam par rtog pa'i sbyor ba dang / bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi sbyor ba ni yang dag pa'i sbyor ba'i bden pa'o //
translated: The truth of right practice is the practice of the discernment of the truths and the practice of the accumulations of merit and knowledge.

original: bden pa rnam pa dgu ni lam gyi rnam pa dang / lam gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / lam gyi ngo bo dang / lam gyi 'bras bu'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa rnam pa dgu ni lam gyi rnam pa dang / lam gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / lam gyi ngo bo dang / lam gyi 'bras bu'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: The nine aspects of the truths are from the perspective of the aspects of the path, the counteragents to the path, the nature of the path, and the result of the path.

original: de la nye bar len pa'i phung po bzhi ni lam mo //
analyzed: de la nye bar len pa'i phung po bzhi ni lam mo //
translated: The four appropriated aggregates are the path.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: mi rtag pa'i bden pa nas /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i bden pa nas /
translated: The truth of suffering is impermanent,

original: bdag med pa'i bar ro zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag med pa'i bar ro zhes bya'o //
translated: and so on up to the truth of the selflessness of suffering.üîΩThe counteragents to the path are craving for existence

original: lam gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni srid pa las sred pa @249b ste ;
analyzed: lam gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni srid pa las sred pa @249b ste ;
translated: and craving for nonexistence.

original: des 'khor ba'i nyes dmigs mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des 'khor ba'i nyes dmigs mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of them, one does not see the faults of cyclic existence.üîΩCraving for separation from existence

original: srid pa dang bral ba la sred pa ste /
analyzed: srid pa dang bral ba la sred pa ste /
translated: is craving for nirvana.

original: des mya ngan las 'das pa'i phan yon mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des mya ngan las 'das pa'i phan yon mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of them, one does not see the benefits of nirvana.

original: de dag nyes dmigs dang / phan yon ma mthong bas lam skye bar 'gyur ba med pas shes nas so //
analyzed: de dag nyes dmigs dang / phan yon ma mthong bas lam skye bar 'gyur ba med pas shes nas so //
translated: Since they do not see the faults and benefits, they do not generate the path.

original: lam gyi ngo bo ni mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: lam gyi ngo bo ni mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob par rig par bya ste /
translated: The nature of the path should be understood as the attainment of nirvana.

original: gang gi phyir smras pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: de spong ba'i thabs kyi bden pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de spong ba'i thabs kyi bden pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The truth of the means to abandon that is the truth of the path.

original: 'bras bu ni mya ngan las 'das pa rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni mya ngan las 'das pa rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: The result is the two kinds of nirvana.

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ni rnam pa bcu'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ni rnam pa bcu'o //
translated: The truth of suffering has ten aspects.

original: sdug bsngal thams cad ni sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum gyi dbye ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal thams cad ni sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum gyi dbye ba'o //
translated: All suffering is classified into three kinds of suffering.

original: de la sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal ni rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal ni rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: The suffering of suffering is twofold.

original: rnam par 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal yang rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: rnam par 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal yang rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: The suffering of change is also twofold.

original: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dbye bas rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dbye bas rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: The suffering of conditioned existence is threefold by the classification of cause and effect.

original: gang gi phyir smras pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: gnas ngan len gyi sdug bsngal gyi bden pa nas nyon mongs pa'i bden pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: gnas ngan len gyi sdug bsngal gyi bden pa nas nyon mongs pa'i bden pa'i bar du'o //
translated: The truth of suffering is the suffering of the negative tendencies, up to the truth of the afflictions.

original: yang sdug bsngal gyi gnyen po dang spangs pa'i dbang du byas nas rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: yang sdug bsngal gyi gnyen po dang spangs pa'i dbang du byas nas rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Moreover, from the perspective of the antidote to suffering and abandonment, there are three aspects.

original: sdug bsngal gyi gnyen po ni thog ma dang bar dang tha mar thob pa'i shes rab po //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi gnyen po ni thog ma dang bar dang tha mar thob pa'i shes rab po //
translated: The antidote to suffering is the wisdom attained at the beginning, middle, and end.

original: gang gi phyir smras pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir smras pa /
translated: It is said:

original: thos pa dang tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i bden pa dang / yang dag pa'i lta ba'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thos pa dang tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i bden pa dang / yang dag pa'i lta ba'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe truth of hearing and proper mental attention is called the truth of right view.

original: spangs pa ni yang dag pa'i lta ba'i 'bras bu'i bden pas te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: spangs pa ni yang dag pa'i lta ba'i 'bras bu'i bden pas te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Abandonment is the truth of the result of right view.‚Äù

original: de'i rnam par dbye ba ni tshad med par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni bden pa re re yang dbye ba dpag tu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rnam par dbye ba ni tshad med par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni bden pa re re yang dbye ba dpag tu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It should be known that its classification is immeasurable. Each truth has immeasurable classifications.

original: rnam par gzhag pa ni rnam pa 'dun mdor bsdu na lam nyid dang / lam gyi 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa ni rnam pa 'dun mdor bsdu na lam nyid dang / lam gyi 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: The presentation is summarized in two parts: the presentation of the path itself and the presentation of the result of the path.

original: de la lam ni gtsor shes rab yin te /
analyzed: de la lam ni gtsor shes rab yin te /
translated: In that regard, the path is primarily wisdom.

original: nyon mongs pa ye shes kyis bcom nas zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ye shes kyis bcom nas zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhaving destroyed the afflictions with the sword of wisdom‚ÄùüîΩWhy is that?

original: gang gi phyir smras pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir smras pa /
translated: It is said:

original: shes rab gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: shes rab gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúWhatever is wisdom‚Äù and so on.

original: shes rab de ni yang rnam pa drug tu brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: shes rab de ni yang rnam pa drug tu brjod par bya ste /
translated: That wisdom should be stated as being of six types.

original: de yang sems las byung ba yin pa'i phyir rten dang bcas pa nyid yin pas rten med par mi 'byung ngo zhes bya bar smras pa /
analyzed: de yang sems las byung ba yin pa'i phyir rten dang bcas pa nyid yin pas rten med par mi 'byung ngo zhes bya bar smras pa /
translated: Since it is a mental factor, it has a basis, and so it does not occur without a basis.

original: rten dang zhes bya ba la dmigs ba dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir de bzhin no //üîΩrdzas dang lhan cig 'jug pa'i phyir grogs med pa @250a * //
analyzed: rten dang zhes bya ba la dmigs ba dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir de bzhin no // rdzas dang lhan cig 'jug pa'i phyir grogs med pa @250a * //
translated: It has a basis because it has an object.

original: ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no //
translated: It is not without a companion because it occurs together with a substance.

original: bya bas rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir las med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bya bas rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir las med pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not without activity because it is distinguished by activity.

original: ma goms par ma yin pa'i phyir tshogs ma bsags par yang ma yin no //
analyzed: ma goms par ma yin pa'i phyir tshogs ma bsags par yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not without a collection because it is not without cultivation.üîΩIt is not without a result because it is the vehicle that has a result.

original: 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i theg pa yin no zhes bya bar de ltar rnam pa bdun gyis theg pa rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i theg pa yin no zhes bya bar de ltar rnam pa bdun gyis theg pa rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: Thus the vehicle is presented in seven ways.

original: lam yang tshogs dang bcas pa'i lam smos pas rnam pa gnyis su bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: lam yang tshogs dang bcas pa'i lam smos pas rnam pa gnyis su bstan pa yin no //
translated: The path is also presented in two ways, since the path is mentioned together with its collection.

original: theg pa chen po'i 'bras bu'i sgo nyid nas shes rab kyi dmigs pa'i khyad par bstan pa'i phyir smras pa brjod du med pa'i dngos po dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yang shes rab de nyid kyi dmigs pa dang / rnam pa dang /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i 'bras bu'i sgo nyid nas shes rab kyi dmigs pa'i khyad par bstan pa'i phyir smras pa brjod du med pa'i dngos po dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yang shes rab de nyid kyi dmigs pa dang / rnam pa dang /
translated: In order to demonstrate the distinctive object of observation of wisdom from the perspective of the result of the MahƒÅyƒÅna, he says, ‚ÄúThe object of observation is an inexpressible thing,‚Äù and so on.üîΩThe object of observation, aspect, and

original: las kyis bstan pa ni de bzhin nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: las kyis bstan pa ni de bzhin nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: activity of that wisdom are taught.

original: chos thams cad kyi don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The ultimate nature of all phenomena is suchness.

original: de la dmigs pa'i rnam pa nyid ni rnam par mi rtog pa mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i rnam pa nyid ni rnam par mi rtog pa mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: The aspect that observes that is nonconceptual sameness.

original: ji ltar dmigs par 'gyur ba'i de bzhin nyid la rnam par rtog pa med pa de bzhin du shes rab kyang yin no zhes bya bas rnam par mi rtog pa mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: ji ltar dmigs par 'gyur ba'i de bzhin nyid la rnam par rtog pa med pa de bzhin du shes rab kyang yin no zhes bya bas rnam par mi rtog pa mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: Just as suchness is observed without conceptualization, so too is wisdom.

original: byung ba'i zhes bya ba ni las nyid de nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por gyur pa nyid kyis na /
analyzed: byung ba'i zhes bya ba ni las nyid de nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por gyur pa nyid kyis na /
translated: The word ‚Äúarising‚Äù refers to the activity itself, which is the counteragent to the afflictive and the objective obscurations.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: It is the nonconceptual, the equality.

original: de ltar na dmigs pa la sogs pa'i khyad par gyis shes rab bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar na dmigs pa la sogs pa'i khyad par gyis shes rab bstan to //
translated: Thus, wisdom is taught by way of the distinctions of its object, etc.

original: yang 'bras bu ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: yang 'bras bu ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: Its result is the liberation from the afflictive and objective obscurations.

original: rnam pa 'di dag gis khyad par rnam par gzhag pa bstan pa'i phyir 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan bstan pa'i dbang du byas pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa 'di dag gis khyad par rnam par gzhag pa bstan pa'i phyir 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan bstan pa'i dbang du byas pa yin te /
translated: In order to teach the establishment of the distinctions by way of these aspects, the verse states, ‚Äúpast, future, and present,‚Äù etc. This is from the perspective of teaching the qualities of the bodhisattva.

original: shes rab la sogs pa yang bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab la sogs pa yang bstan pa yin no //
translated: Wisdom, etc. are also taught.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin yongs su shes pa'i sngon du 'gro ba nyid kyis gnas yin pa'i phyir yongs su btsal ba'i dngos po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin yongs su shes pa'i sngon du 'gro ba nyid kyis gnas yin pa'i phyir yongs su btsal ba'i dngos po zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the ‚Äúthing to be investigated‚Äù because it is the basis for the perfect knowledge of things just as they are.

original: de'i phyir shes pa rnams la dngos po zhes ma bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir shes pa rnams la dngos po zhes ma bstan pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the entities are not taught to be cognitions.

original: yongs su tshol ba nyid dngos po'i don du shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su tshol ba nyid dngos po'i don du shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the very investigation is to be known as the meaning of the entity.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yon tan gyi khyad par dpag tu med pa bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yon tan gyi khyad par dpag tu med pa bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate the immeasurable special qualities of the bodhisattvas, he says:

original: dpag tu med pa lnga po 'di dag ces bya ba la /
analyzed: dpag tu med pa lnga po 'di dag ces bya ba la /
translated: These five are immeasurable.

original: grangs dang tshad yongs su chad pa med pa'i phyir dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: grangs dang tshad yongs su chad pa med pa'i phyir dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: They are immeasurable because their number and measure are not limited.

original: @250b 'di dag la byang chub sems dpa' rnams thabs mkhas pas 'jug pa'i phyir zhes bya bas yul nyid do //
analyzed: @250b 'di dag la byang chub sems dpa' rnams thabs mkhas pas 'jug pa'i phyir zhes bya bas yul nyid do //
translated: They are the objects because the bodhisattvas engage in them through skill in means.

original: de'i phyir smras pa thabs la mkhas par byed par zhes bya ba la thabs la mkhas pa thams cad ni de la brten pa'i phyir zhes byas nas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa thabs la mkhas par byed par zhes bya ba la thabs la mkhas pa thams cad ni de la brten pa'i phyir zhes byas nas so //
translated: Therefore, he says: they are the basis of the performance of skill in means. All skill in means is based on them.

original: byang chub sems dpas gnag la dmigs nas de dag gi don du 'jug par 'gyur ba'i sems can de dag ni dpag tu med pas sems can gyi khams dpag tu med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas gnag la dmigs nas de dag gi don du 'jug par 'gyur ba'i sems can de dag ni dpag tu med pas sems can gyi khams dpag tu med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva, observing the darkness, enters into it for the sake of those beings who are to be converted, and those beings are immeasurable.

original: de dag gang du gnas pa dpag tu med pa dang / chos gang dang ldan pa'i dge ba la sogs pa kun du spyod pa dpag tu med pa dang / 'dul bar bya ba gang yin pa dpag tu med pa dang / rnam pa gang gis 'dul bar byed pa'i thabs dpag tu med pas 'dul ba'i thabs dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gang du gnas pa dpag tu med pa dang / chos gang dang ldan pa'i dge ba la sogs pa kun du spyod pa dpag tu med pa dang / 'dul bar bya ba gang yin pa dpag tu med pa dang / rnam pa gang gis 'dul bar byed pa'i thabs dpag tu med pas 'dul ba'i thabs dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: The realm of beings is immeasurable because the places where they live are immeasurable, the virtues such as faith that they possess are immeasurable, the beings to be converted are immeasurable, and the means of conversion are immeasurable.

original: yid kyis las 'byung ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yid kyis las 'byung ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Like the arising of mental activity.

original: dmyal ba nas 'khor los sgyur ba'i bar du'o //üîΩsems can so so'i rgyud la ltos nas ni dpag tu med pa yin te /
analyzed: dmyal ba nas 'khor los sgyur ba'i bar du'o // sems can so so'i rgyud la ltos nas ni dpag tu med pa yin te /
translated: From the hells up to the wheel-turning kings.üîΩIn relation to the individual streams of beings, they are immeasurable.

original: de ltar na rnam par gzhag pa dang / rgyud kyi dpag tu med pas sems can gyi khams dpag tu med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rnam par gzhag pa dang / rgyud kyi dpag tu med pas sems can gyi khams dpag tu med pa bzhin no //
translated: Thus, the realm of beings is immeasurable because of the immeasurability of the classification and the streams.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams kyang dbyibs dang / ming bstan pa dpag tu med pa'i phyir dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams kyang dbyibs dang / ming bstan pa dpag tu med pa'i phyir dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: The world-realms are immeasurable because of the immeasurable shapes and names that are taught.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: phyogs bcu dag tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs bcu dag tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: In the ten directions, etc.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams kyi dbang du byas nas de dag gi ming dang rnam par gzhag pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams kyi dbang du byas nas de dag gi ming dang rnam par gzhag pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: In terms of the world-realms, their names and their arrangement, it is said:

original: mi mjed de zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi mjed de zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called Endurance.

original: de bzhin du gzhan dag kyang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan dag kyang rig par bya'o //
translated: The others should be understood in the same way.

original: gcig tu 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni thams cad sdug bsngal las nges par grol bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig tu 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni thams cad sdug bsngal las nges par grol bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They become one, because they are all liberated from suffering.

original: gang yang tha dad kyi dbye ba ni rnam pa bcu'i bar du'o //
analyzed: gang yang tha dad kyi dbye ba ni rnam pa bcu'i bar du'o //
translated: The divisions of the different kinds are up to ten kinds.

original: rnam pa gnyis ni nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang ma spangs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis ni nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang ma spangs pa'i phyir te /
translated: There are two kinds because of the abandonment or non-abandonment of the defilements.

original: thams cad kyi thams cad du nyon mongs pa ma spangs pa ni mtha' dag gis bcings pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi thams cad du nyon mongs pa ma spangs pa ni mtha' dag gis bcings pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Those who have not abandoned all the defilements are called ‚Äúbound by all bonds‚Äù.

original: nyon mongs pa'i phyogs gcig spangs pa ni mtha' dag ma yin pas bcings pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i phyogs gcig spangs pa ni mtha' dag ma yin pas bcings pa'o //
translated: Since the afflictions are not completely abandoned, because only a part of the afflictions is abandoned, one is still bound.

original: sa'i bye brag dang nyon mongs pa'i dbye bas kyang lhag ma dang bcas par spangs pa dang / ma spangs pa'i dbye ba'i dbang du byas nas so //
analyzed: sa'i bye brag dang nyon mongs pa'i dbye bas kyang lhag ma dang bcas par spangs pa dang / ma spangs pa'i dbye ba'i dbang du byas nas so //
translated: The abandonment with remainder and the abandonment without remainder are considered in terms of the abandonment of the afflictions and the different stages.

original: dbang po'i bye brag gis ni rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: dbang po'i bye brag gis ni rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: In terms of the different faculties, there are three types.

original: rigs kyi bye brag @251a * //
analyzed: rigs kyi bye brag @251a * //
translated: In terms of the different lineages,

original: gis ni rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: gis ni rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: there are four types.

original: spyod pa'i bye brag gis ni rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: spyod pa'i bye brag gis ni rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: In terms of the different practices, there are five types.

original: phyogs dang gnas skabs kyi dbye bas ni rnam pa drug go //
analyzed: phyogs dang gnas skabs kyi dbye bas ni rnam pa drug go //
translated: In terms of the different directions and circumstances, there are six types.

original: yang bstan pa lam zhugs pa'i dbye ba dang zhugs pa'i dbye bas ni rnam pa bdun no //
analyzed: yang bstan pa lam zhugs pa'i dbye ba dang zhugs pa'i dbye bas ni rnam pa bdun no //
translated: In terms of the classification of those who have entered the teaching and those who have not, there are seven types.

original: bstan pa la ma zhugs pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: bstan pa la ma zhugs pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Those who have not entered the teaching are of two types:

original: gnas ngan pa la mngon par mos pa'i dbang gis de la zhugs pa dang / de la ma zhugs kyang mos pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gnas ngan pa la mngon par mos pa'i dbang gis de la zhugs pa dang / de la ma zhugs kyang mos pa med pa'o //
translated: those who have entered the teaching through the power of their aspiration for the lower vehicles, and those who have not entered the teaching and have no aspiration for it.

original: zhugs pa yang dbang po'i bye brag gis rgyas pa dang / bsdus pa la mos pa rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: zhugs pa yang dbang po'i bye brag gis rgyas pa dang / bsdus pa la mos pa rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The one who has entered is of two kinds, according to whether he is devoted to the extensive or the concise.üîΩFor what reason?

original: gang gi phyir smras pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir smras pa /
translated: It is said:

original: spros pas shes pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: spros pas shes pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: because of the knowledge of the extensive and concise.

original: mdor bstan pa tsam gyis rtogs par 'gyur ba ni mgo glengs pas shes pa'o //
analyzed: mdor bstan pa tsam gyis rtogs par 'gyur ba ni mgo glengs pas shes pa'o //
translated: The one who understands by the mere indication of the brief teaching is the one who understands by the mere mention of the head.

original: de dag kyang gnas skabs kyi dbye bas ni rnam pa gsum du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang gnas skabs kyi dbye bas ni rnam pa gsum du 'gyur ro //
translated: They are also threefold according to the division of their states.

original: tshe de nyid la bstan pa'i dus su 'dul bar 'gyur ba'i phyir de'i mod la 'dul bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: tshe de nyid la bstan pa'i dus su 'dul bar 'gyur ba'i phyir de'i mod la 'dul bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The one who is to be disciplined immediately is the one who is to be disciplined at the time of the teaching of that very life, because he is to be disciplined at that time.

original: tshul bzhin yid la byed pas so sor rig pa'i lam zhes bya'o //üîΩgo rims bzhin du bsgrub pas 'dul bar 'gyur ba ni phyis 'dul bar 'gyur ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshul bzhin yid la byed pas so sor rig pa'i lam zhes bya'o // go rims bzhin du bsgrub pas 'dul bar 'gyur ba ni phyis 'dul bar 'gyur ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the path of individual intuitive wisdom because of proper mental attention.üîΩThe one who is to be disciplined by practice in due order is called the one who is to be disciplined later.

original: rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du 'jug par 'gyur bas na rkyen las 'gyur ba'i gdul bya zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du 'jug par 'gyur bas na rkyen las 'gyur ba'i gdul bya zhes bya'o //
translated: The one who is to be disciplined by conditions is called the one who is to be disciplined by conditions, because he engages in practice according to conditions.

original: yang tshe 'di dang skye ba gzhan la gdul byar 'gyur ba'i phyir gnyis ka'i ste rim bzhin no //
analyzed: yang tshe 'di dang skye ba gzhan la gdul byar 'gyur ba'i phyir gnyis ka'i ste rim bzhin no //
translated: and also both, because they are to be converted in this life and in other lives, respectively.

original: dus gnyis kar byung pa ni rkyen las gyur pa'i zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dus gnyis kar byung pa ni rkyen las gyur pa'i zhes bya'o //
translated: Those who are converted by both are called ‚Äúcircumstantial.‚Äù

original: 'khor gyi bye brag gis ni rnam pa brgyad do //
analyzed: 'khor gyi bye brag gis ni rnam pa brgyad do //
translated: There are eight types of conversion according to the differences in the retinue.

original: 'dul ba po dang / 'dul bya'i thabs kyi bye brag dang / dus kyi bye brag gis rnam pa dgu nyid de /
analyzed: 'dul ba po dang / 'dul bya'i thabs kyi bye brag dang / dus kyi bye brag gis rnam pa dgu nyid de /
translated: There are nine types of conversion according to the differences in the means of conversion, the differences in the disciples, and the differences in time.

original: bsgrub par dka' ba ni dbang po gdul bar dka' ba'o ;
analyzed: bsgrub par dka' ba ni dbang po gdul bar dka' ba'o ;
translated: Those who are difficult to convert are those whose faculties are difficult to develop.

original: / de las bzlog ba ni bsgrub par sla ba nyid do //
analyzed: / de las bzlog ba ni bsgrub par sla ba nyid do //
translated: Those who are easy to convert are the opposite of those.

original: 'jam pos gdul bar bya ba ni 'jam pos bsgrub par bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'jam pos gdul bar bya ba ni 'jam pos bsgrub par bya ba'o //
translated: Those who are to be converted by gentle means are to be converted by gentle means.

original: chad pa'i las kyi sbyor bas gdul bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir tshar bcad pas bsgrub par bya ba'o //
analyzed: chad pa'i las kyi sbyor bas gdul bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir tshar bcad pas bsgrub par bya ba'o //
translated: Those who are to be converted by the application of punishment are to be converted by the application of punishment.

original: dus kyi bye brag gis drung nas 'dul ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: dus kyi bye brag gis drung nas 'dul ba la sogs pa la /
translated: According to the differences in time, there are those who are to be converted in the present, and so on.

original: de'i mod la 'dul ba gang yin pa de ni drung nas 'dul ba'o //
analyzed: de'i mod la 'dul ba gang yin pa de ni drung nas 'dul ba'o //
translated: Those who are to be converted in the present are those who are to be converted immediately.

original: de las bzlog pa ni rgyang ring po nas 'dul ba'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni rgyang ring po nas 'dul ba'o //
translated: The opposite of this is the one who is disciplined from afar.üîΩThere are ten types of intermediate beings:

original: 'gro ba'i dbye ba dang / 'gro ba ma yin pa'i dbye ba dang / lus kyi dbye ba dang / 'du shes kyi dbye bas dbye ba rnam pa bcu ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i dbye ba dang / 'gro ba ma yin pa'i dbye ba dang / lus kyi dbye ba dang / 'du shes kyi dbye bas dbye ba rnam pa bcu ste /
translated: five types of those who go to a destination, one type of those who do not go to a destination, two types of those who have a body, and two types of those who have perception.

original: 'gro ba'i @251b dbye ba ni rnam pa lnga nyid do //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i @251b dbye ba ni rnam pa lnga nyid do //
translated: Those who go to a destination are of five types.

original: 'gro ba ma yin pa ni gcig nyid de /
analyzed: 'gro ba ma yin pa ni gcig nyid de /
translated: Those who do not go to a destination are of one type.

original: srid pa bar ma ni 'gro ba'i ris las grol ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srid pa bar ma ni 'gro ba'i ris las grol ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The intermediate beings are not included in the realms of sentient beings.

original: lus kyi dbye ba ni gzugs can dang gzugs can ma yin pa'i dbye bas rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: lus kyi dbye ba ni gzugs can dang gzugs can ma yin pa'i dbye bas rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: Those who have a body are of two types: those who have a form body and those who do not have a form body.

original: 'du byed kyi dbye ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi dbye ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Those who have perception are of three types:

original: 'du shes gsal po 'jug pa dang / 'jug pa ma yin pa gnyis dang / 'du shes mi gsal ba 'jug pa ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: 'du shes gsal po 'jug pa dang / 'jug pa ma yin pa gnyis dang / 'du shes mi gsal ba 'jug pa ni gsum pa'o //
translated: those who have clear perception and go, those who have clear perception and do not go, and those who have unclear perception and go.

original: gcig la sogs pa nas bcu 'das kyi bar du lnga bcu rtsa lnga ste /
analyzed: gcig la sogs pa nas bcu 'das kyi bar du lnga bcu rtsa lnga ste /
translated: There are fifty-five types of intermediate beings, from one to ten.

original: de dag rgyud so so'i dbye bas ni dpag tu med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de dag rgyud so so'i dbye bas ni dpag tu med pa nyid do //
translated: They are innumerable due to the division of individual mindstreams.

original: sngar bstan pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ni stobs kyi rigs kyi le'ur bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sngar bstan pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ni stobs kyi rigs kyi le'ur bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: As previously indicated means as previously indicated in the chapter on the family of powers.

original: dpag tu med pa yang rnam pa lngar rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir de dag bsdus na dpag tu med pa rnam po lngar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dpag tu med pa yang rnam pa lngar rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir de dag bsdus na dpag tu med pa rnam po lngar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Since the immeasurable is also established in five aspects, they are summarized as the five kinds of immeasurable.

original: de dag gis sems can rnams kyi spyi nyid dang / de dag gi rten nyid dang // sems can gyi gnas skabs dang / skal ba dang ldan pa nyid dang / rab tu dbye ba'i dbang du byas nas dpag tu med pa rnam pa lnga bstan pa yin no //üîΩlnga po 'di dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /üîΩlnga po 'di dag ni chos bstan pa'i 'bras bu'i phan yon rgya che ba yin par rig par bya'o zhes sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: de dag gis sems can rnams kyi spyi nyid dang / de dag gi rten nyid dang // sems can gyi gnas skabs dang / skal ba dang ldan pa nyid dang / rab tu dbye ba'i dbang du byas nas dpag tu med pa rnam pa lnga bstan pa yin no // lnga po 'di dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / lnga po 'di dag ni chos bstan pa'i 'bras bu'i phan yon rgya che ba yin par rig par bya'o zhes sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: They are taught in terms of the general state of sentient beings, their basis, the situation of sentient beings, their good fortune, and their differentiation.üîΩThese five are the great benefits of teaching the Dharma.üîΩThese five should be known as the great benefits of teaching the Dharma.

original: mod de dang de dag nas bstan pa'i 'bras bu'i dbang du byas nas lnga nyid du gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: mod de dang de dag nas bstan pa'i 'bras bu'i dbang du byas nas lnga nyid du gzhag pa yin no //
translated: They are established as five in terms of the result of teaching the Dharma as it is taught.

original: bstan pa'i 'bras bu ni mdor bsdu na nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: bstan pa'i 'bras bu ni mdor bsdu na nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: The result of the teaching is, in brief, the disciples and the bodhisattvas.

original: de la nyan thos rnams kyi ni tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang / rab tu 'brel pa'i 'bras bu rnam pa gnyis te ;
analyzed: de la nyan thos rnams kyi ni tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang / rab tu 'brel pa'i 'bras bu rnam pa gnyis te ;
translated: For the disciples, the result is twofold: proper mental attention and the result of connection.

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang / mthar thug pa'i lam thob pas nyon mongs pa ma lus par spangs pa'o //
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang / mthar thug pa'i lam thob pas nyon mongs pa ma lus par spangs pa'o //
translated: The result of connection is twofold: the abandonment of the passions to be abandoned by the path of insight and the abandonment of all passions by attaining the ultimate path.

original: de la 'dir mdo nas bstan pa ni yang chos kyi rnam grangs 'di bstan pa na chos kyi mig skyes nas thag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la 'dir mdo nas bstan pa ni yang chos kyi rnam grangs 'di bstan pa na chos kyi mig skyes nas thag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Here, the teaching in the scripture is that, when this Dharma teaching was given, the disciples generated the Dharma eye and their minds were liberated from defilements.

original: byang chub sems dpa' yang rnam pa gnyis kho na ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang rnam pa gnyis kho na ste /
translated: The bodhisattvas are also twofold:

original: theg pa chen po la 'jug pa dang / so sor rtog pa'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: theg pa chen po la 'jug pa dang / so sor rtog pa'i dbye bas so //
translated: those who have entered the Great Vehicle and those who are discerning.

original: de la mdo nas bstan pa ni 'di na 'ga' zhig yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / sems bskyed pa @252a * //
analyzed: de la mdo nas bstan pa ni 'di na 'ga' zhig yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / sems bskyed pa @252a * //
translated: The teaching in the sutra is this: ‚ÄúHere, someone generates the thought of perfect complete enlightenment and generates the thought of enlightenment.

original: rnams ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnams ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Those who generate the thought of enlightenment attain forbearance with regard to the teaching of non-production.

original: gnyi ga'i yang sgrub pa la ltos pa'i 'bras bu ni lnga pa'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i yang sgrub pa la ltos pa'i 'bras bu ni lnga pa'o //
translated: The fifth is the result that depends on the practice of both.

original: chen po nyid rnam pa bdun dang ldan pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen por brjod do //
analyzed: chen po nyid rnam pa bdun dang ldan pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen por brjod do //
translated: The bodhisattva is called a ‚Äúgreat being‚Äù because he possesses seven kinds of greatness.

original: de'i phyir yon tan bstan pa'i sgo nas chen po nyid bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir yon tan bstan pa'i sgo nas chen po nyid bstan to //
translated: Therefore, greatness is taught by way of the teaching of his virtues.

original: rnam pa bdun yang mdor bsdu na lam dang lam gyi 'bras bu'i dbang du byas nas rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: rnam pa bdun yang mdor bsdu na lam dang lam gyi 'bras bu'i dbang du byas nas rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The seven kinds of greatness, in brief, are established by way of the path and the result of the path.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i lam 'bras bu dang bcas pa ni theg pa chen po yin pas chen por rnam par gzhag go //
